Designing data warehouse dimensional modelling
requirements: Requirements Degree from a recognised university, preferably in Data Analytics or Computer Science domain; Must have at least two years hands-on experience as a Data Engineer; Must have knowledge of data warehouse concept (Star, snowflake or data vault) methodology and experience in designing data warehouse dimensional modelling Must have at least one year experience in Microsoft SSIS, Microsoft SSAS, Microsoft SQL Server and Python Knowledge of Azure or Microsoft MDM or .Net or C# or NoSQL or open source data analytics software will be advantageous

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities: You will lead and develop a team of data engineers. The team will be responsible in designing, prototyping and productizing data pipelines and datasets for the purpose of quantitative analysis and data/ metric-driven applications. Your will partner with internal customers, collaborate with data consumers, data analysts and scientists to build production data pipelines. You will determine the efficacy of our current data architecture maturity and, work out a strategy plan to close any gaps spanning data usage and management, data governance and security issues.   Requirements: We value an engineering manager who has the following attributes: -        4+ years of relevant technical management experience -        8+ years of hands-on data engineering work experience -        Been actively involved in setting enterprise data and data product strategy preferably in industrial/ commercial real estate business -        Proven track record of hiring and developing a high quality team of data/ ML/ backend engineers -        Architecture chops on constructing near real-time data infrastructure and deploying high performance production services with robust monitoring and logging practices -        Technical ability to build and interact with medium to large data processing pipelines, distributed data stores, and distributed file systems -        Strong programming, algorithmic, data processing skills with significant coding experience (Java, Python, SQL) -        Experience in the following software is a plus (HDFS, Kafka, Nifi, MongoDB, SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Spark, Presto, Zeppelin) -        Experience in the following cloud data technologies is a plus (AWS Data Lakes and Analytics, Google Big Data Analytics, Azure Big data and analytics, etc) -        Bonus: Experience in DevOps for data engineering -        Bonus: Experience with building data or metric-driven experimentation platform e.g. to conduct A/B experiments preferred.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Job The Data Centre (DC) Facilities Manager is responsible for the overall operation and maintenance of all DC infrastructure, including electrical, mechanical, fire suppression, IBMS/DCIM systems and security systems. The DC Facilities Manager is responsible for the day to day activities of the site facility team and engagement with outsourced FM and specialist contractor teams. The position will help to ensure overall availability and reliability to meet or exceed defined service levels of data centre operations while keeping operating costs at a minimum.    Provide engineering / technical support to project development teams during DC design and development phases, ensuring all operational requirements are defined and implemented correctly during constructions.    Participate in all testing and commissioning of systems, and support Operations Director to plan and manage the transition from construction to stable operations of the DC   Plan and manage maintenance programs, preventive programs, reactive and corrective actions to ensure uninterrupted operations of the entire DC facilities   Lead a team of 24x7 facilities engineers/technicians to carry out day-to-day DC operations, planned maintenance and support new data centre fit-outs/improvement projects.   Lead qualified engineers/technicians and manage their performance, morale and training.   Ensure company and data centre operations process and procedures are followed and meet internal/external audit standards.   Schedule and supervise the performance of routine maintenance and emergency repairs on all building services and data centre M&E equipment.    Responsible for occupational health and safety program day to day implementation.   Manage incidents response, recovery, resolution and reporting. Responsibility includes providing clear communications to internal and external stakeholders.    Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions to operate existing systems efficiently including their life cycle cost with conclusions and suitable approaches to problems.   Development and management of facilities budget for maintenance, repairs, capital and general operating costs; bottom-up development of yearly budgets.
requirements: RequirementsPrerequisites   Degree or Diploma in Electrical / Mechanical / Building Services Engineering    At least 5 years of experience in managing critical environment facilities; experience in data centre is an added advantage.   A team player with good verbal and written communication skill in English.   Possess excellent understanding, relevant knowledge and experience of the electrical and mechanical systems involved in critical data centre operations including systems such as feeders, transformers, generators, switchgear, UPS systems, ATS units, PDU units, chillers, pumps and CRAC units   Knowledge of governmental regulations on Security, Fire and Workplace Safety, Energy Management, Environment Management, ISO standards, PCI/DSS, OSPAR certification and Green Data Centre operations.    Demonstrated good people management and leadership skills with an ability to influence at all levels   Data Centre Professional training is an advantage.   Willing to travel and station overseas on short-term basis.

company: J.P. MORGAN SECURITIES ASIA PRIVATE LIMITED
job_title: CIB - Neovest Account Manager — Market Data & Analytics Services – Vice President
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small businesses, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands.　 Information about J.P. Morgan is available at www.jpmorganchase.com Neovest is a wholly owned subsidiary of J.P. Morgan which provides a comprehensive suite of financial technology services to the buy and sell-side communities. Neovest's technology encompasses direct market access, advanced order management, real-time market data, and advanced analytics in a comprehensive and robust application, which includes advanced ECN and exchange aggregation, broker routing, crossing, and algorithmic order routing aggregation. Tightly integrated with these features is Neovest's industry leading analytics platform, which includes superior charting, quotes, news, filtering/reverse filtering, and full depth of book. Other Neovest features include basket/list trading, order slicing, options execution, portfolio/risk management, and allocation and bunching capabilities.       We are currently looking to recruit a customer-facing Account Management position whose responsibilities will include analytic, order execution, IT, back office, FIX connectivity, customer service, internal sales, and trade support skill sets.  This is a highly visible opportunity to contribute to growth in electronic trading at the firm. The Account Manager ("AM") is responsible to represent the firm to clients in a first class way. It is essential that the AM forge a strong relationship with clients to develop implicit trust in the AM and their ability to service client needs. Clients should view their AM as a trusted partner and key contributor to their success. AMs must be highly proactive and take initiative to provide excellent service to clients. The company's products, along with the service component, should be an integral and highly valued part of our clients' business. Responsibilities:  Serve as primary point of contact for clients for all Neovest related issues. Communicate with and regularly visit clients, understand their needs, and develop a strong relationship with them. Manage client relationship through their lifecycle with the firm: product demonstrations, pre-sales technical consultation, on-boarding process, implementation / training, on-going support. Identify opportunities to up- and cross-sell additional Neovest products, asset classes, or global markets within the client firm. Responsible for individually managed account growth as well as departmental support contributions. Assist in project management details related to overall company improvement.
requirements: RequirementsQualifications:  Required: Strong communication/team building skills. Required: Electronic trading software support experience. Required: Analytic software support experience. Preferred: Project Management skill sets. Preferred: Series 3, 7, 63 or equivalent licenses. Preferred: Experience with global equities and futures markets.  We strongly encourage all applicants to apply via our careers website where you are able join our Talent Network to receive customized vacancy notifications and ensure that your details are accessible by our global recruiting team - www.jpmorganchase.com/careers. 　 A quick link to this particular job posting can be found in this URL: http://jobs.jpmorganchase.com/ListJobs/ByKeyword/190027049/  Please note that only short-listed candidates will be notified. We thank you for your interest and wish you all the best in your career.  Yours Sincerely, Human Resources JPMorgan

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesHOOQ Content Team is seeking Senior Manager, Data Analytics Content. You will be responsible for providing insights into business performance and key drivers of the business. You will be an expert at extracting and analyzing data, have the ability to translate data into insights, can tackle multiple projects at the same time, likes to problem-solve and loves films and series. You will be instrumental in leading the use of analytics as a critical value driver and source of competitive advantage across our organization. If you are someone who thrives in a team environment and gains personal satisfaction when sharing knowledge and partnering with teams, then this is a great role for you.  The Responsibilities  Apply advanced analytics techniques (core statistical-modeling, data visualization, data mining, machine learning) to extract actionable insights through analysis of large-scale, high-dimensional data How can we optimize the content library for retention and maximal subscriber engagement? Is our content library serving every individual across our diverse subscriber base? How do we measure this? How do we ensure that our content recommendations are maximally relevant? How should we allocate our content budget for maximal subscriber growth? Is our user interface working well for every individual across our diversesubscriber base? How do we measure this? … and more. Analyze data to identify trends, support critical business decisions, highlight problem areas and elevate key insights to management Build and maintain periodic and adhoc reports for team members, giving transparency on content and user-behavior metrics over weekly/monthly/quarterly time frames Create custom dashboards in Tableau for efficient communication of key performance indicators tailored to team needs and objectives Compile thoughtful post-mortem analyses to derive insights into the performance of specific content deals or programming categories  A successful candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, able to pivot when necessary, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with astrong emphasis on organization and an unwavering attention to detail at all times.
requirements: Requirements Experience - 5+ years of experience performing big data analysis, preferably in OTT, film and/or television Start-up experience strongly preferred Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science or equivalent Demonstrated experience in driving business decisions with data-driven analyses Ability to think analytically, problem solve, and turn information into compelling stories and Executive-level presentations Required technical skills: SQL, Excel, PowerPoint and Tableau Outstanding verbal, written, and visual communication skills

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBusiness Overview  Perx Technologies provides a fully integrated solution that combines a next-generation SaaS loyalty management system and omni-channel marketing technologies to deliver revenue-driving digital customer experiences. The Perx Loyalty and Customer Engagement platform allows large B2C enterprises to drive meaningful digital customer experiences targeted at millions of customers. The A.I. enabled platform is trusted by the likes of UOB, HSBC, Central group, AXA, Prudential, Digi, among others in the South East Asian and European markets to drive revenue. We’re a company that understands that product innovation comes from people innovation, and that’s why we invest in cultivating leaders and HIPOs throughout the organization. If you’re passionate about creating and contributing to a top-notch culture and talent pool, join us! Job Overview  The Vice President, Data Scientist manages a team of data scientists within Perx Technologies to drive value for the business by leveraging on AI and machine learning. Work with product and engineering teams to define the problem statement and develop solution with advanced analytic techniques to address key business challenges. The role will champion and project lead the implementation of the Analytic Data technology stack and associated Data Models, Integration Patterns, Quality Frameworks and Governance Models. Essential Functions   Lead, guide, and manage the team of experienced data scientists and be accountable for the team’s delivery of data science projects that drive value for business Partner with business stakeholders to understand needs and identify opportunities to apply data science.  Evaluate, recommend, architect and build big data platform(s) solutions understanding the business needs. Oversee the process of data exploration & preparation, the conduct of experiments, review of model performance, and presentation of results to business stakeholders for their feedback Lead the presentation of key insights to management with actionable recommendations Manage the team to facilitate deployment of finalised solutions to production environment Lead the design, reviewing, implementing and analyzing of algorithms that will substantially impact the company’s understanding of its data Mentoring and managing junior members of the team as it grows, fostering talent development for the continued growth of the technology team in general. Work with the Chief Technology Officer, CEO and Product Manager to answer key questions and projects that will transform the business. Assist with the development skill set of a multi-disciplinary team to evolve from statistical services to key decision influencers  Expected Areas of Competence    Experience working with enterprise level data for multi-national companies in a hands-on role that will influence and shape how data is acquired, stored, integrated, transformed and consumed for all channels of the business and primarily the enterprise platform offering Experience building and managing Big Data SQL Database like MemSQL or Vertica and NoSQL Database like Cassandra or HBase, both a plus Direct experience with working within a modern engineering environment (Linux system architecture, Java (MapReduce), Python, PostGreSQL, multithreaded programming, Hadoop, etc) Experience with large-scale algorithm challenges pulling data from multiple, complex data sets and implementing solutions on AWS, in particular usage of AWS machine learning Possess strong Project Management skills to help in the successful guidance and direction to other team members whilst working hands-on delivering and implementation of data architecture solutions and ensuring stakeholder satisfaction. Possess complete expertise in your area of technical domain and act as a SME while working closely with other stakeholders within the Technology team. Demonstrated experience in architecting, building and maintaining big data platform / store to support enterprise level Analytic projects. Proven experience in creating, building and implementing data fabric, dictionaries, data quality and governance frameworks (open source frameworks like Puppet or Chef for deployment and configuration management is a plus) Hands-on experience with ‘Big Data’, data mining and predictive analytics Deep knowledge of traditional data structure, database design, data warehouses, and Operational data stores Hands-on experience with sourcing & architecting suitable EDW solutions (SAS, SAP, EMC, MySQL, SQL Server, Greenplum, Hadoop, MapReduce, HBase, etc)
requirements: RequirementsQUALIFICATIONS:  Bachelor’s degree in engineering, IT, Math, Sciences or technical discipline (MSC preferred) Candidates will have a minimum 10 years industry experience using acceptable technology and Tools working in a complex systems and development environment building and managing complex products/solutions. Ability to quickly prototype experimental solutions and develop robust, maintainable production systems Strong results driven personality, with a high level of enthusiasm, energy and confidence Ability to demonstrate flexibility and integrity: be able and willing to work hands on, independently or with a small team providing leadership Outstanding EQ and stakeholder management skills.   Ability to make key decisions and deliver results under extremely tight and high-pressure timelines in a highly ambiguous environment.  Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to interact with cross-functional teams at all levels. Experience, comfort and aptitude interacting with senior management both internally and with clients and partners. Must be self-motivated, resourceful, diligent, and adaptive. Superior analytical and quantitative skills with a strong understanding of data-driven decisioning and exhibited experience working with Data Science and statistical analysts. Strong organizational and project management skills.  Travel Requirements   On needs basis

job_title: Enterprise Data Management - Data Governance & Valuations Manager
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesREPORTING TO EDM Manager ROLE Part of a team responsible for data management.  Define, develop and enhance best practices for Data Governance & Valuations.  Execute adherence to data policies, compliance and audit. KEY RESULT AREAS  Develop, maintain and refine a data governance and valuations framework Adherence to a data governance framework for data policies, standards and practice. Proficient with pricing related activities such as tolerance level checks, stale prices, suspended securities, standard deviation checks, etc. Interact with key stakeholders to identify and execute on evolving data governance needs Design, manage and facilitate the data governance forum Proficient in the price governance of fair valued securities Key contributor to the valuation committee focus groups  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES  Be the central governing authority for ESI’s data framework Periodically assess the governance principles set-out in the data policy Assess new custom data requests Periodic re-assessment of custom data requests raised by the business Maintain artefacts of the custom data and ad-hoc meetings Work with the project team on new initiatives and define data ownership Ensure data governance meets regulatory, audit and compliance requirements Support in the analysis, documentation offair valuation, suspended securities and hard to price assets. Organize the data governance and valuation committee meetings and capture the artefacts as per the risk team’s guidelines Ensure all new procedures are documented and agreed. Maintain the business data definitions and data catalogue at an organization level, oversight and risk monitoring of data processes Resolve the tolerance level breaks for all prices within the Aladdin platform Identify the suspended securities for fair valuation Conduct independent verification for the suspended and hard to value securities Create fair valuation templates for Valuation Committee review Participate in the weekly/monthly valuation committee meetings Create valuation policies and procedures as required  ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:  Support the data team as a back-up for investment data related activities Work with the front office stakeholders on ad-hoc data queries Support projects
requirements: RequirementsEXPERIENCE / QUALIFICATIONS  10+ years in a Data Governance role working in financial services, ideally for an asset manager An excellent understanding of a wide range of tradable instruments Data management experience in large banking institution especially Investment Services sector Prior experience using investment platforms, previous experience using Blackrock Aladdin is desirable Knowledge of how data is managed in a database is desirable Good understanding of Front Office, Trade Lifecycle and Operations Working knowledge of data vendor systems such as Bloomberg, Reuters, S&P, etc. Fluency in Chinese, Thai, Korean or other languages will be a plus  GENERAL CANDIDATE ATTRIBUTES  A deep understanding of asset management enterprise data, its associated processes, systems, controls and deliverables. A strong ability to be hands on yet has a holistic strategic vision on data management A strong team player A performance driven individual Strong relationship management skills Strong analytical and communication skills Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively as part of the small team.  EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS  Degree in Computing / Business / Finance or related disciplines CFA Level I/II preferred

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesREPORTING TO EDM Manager ROLE Part of a team responsible for data management.  Data analysis, support and stewardship for the investment management process. KEY RESULT AREAS  Complete specialist tasks including maintaining data in internal repository systems, dealing with data queries relating to front office and other stakeholders. Data analysis and issue resolution for investment data related queries raised by Fund Managers, Dealers, Business Managers, internal and external stakeholders. Ensuring that the data quality is in line with the organisation’s data management governance process Supporting the progressive transition of the organisation`s new enterprise data function  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES  The Data Steward is responsible for the stewardship of investment data that resides in Aladdin and/or the Eastspring Data Management Platform (DMP), ensuring the data is complete, consistent, fit for purpose and ready for consumption for all end users. The daily review and validation of daily Aladdin Security Master / DMP Resolution of exceptions to ensure data integrity. Managing and monitoring controls to ensure data quality and consistency Set up and ongoing maintenance of new securities, portfolios, and benchmarks Sourcing and onboarding of new market data like market indexes and unsupported data from our partners Maintaining Eastspring specific custom information such as internal ratings, customized sectors. Continuous updates of standard operating procedures along with the new releases Provide data management input for the change requests/new initiatives raised by various business teams Provide input to requirement documents, use cases and other papers as required. Ensure all new procedures are documented and agreed. Identify and execute continuous process improvement and automation  ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:  Support projects and ad-hoc queries Support development of metrics and analytics
requirements: RequirementsEXPERIENCE / QUALIFICATIONS  An excellent understanding of a wide range of tradable instruments Strong analytical and communication skills Data management experience in large banking institution especially financial services sector, preferably in Asset Management Prior experience using investment platforms, previous experience using Blackrock Aladdin and/or GoldenSource is desirable Knowledge of SQL, R & Python language skills is a plus Good understanding of Front Office, trade lifecycle and operations processes Understanding of the data management governance frameworks Working knowledge of data vendor systems such as Bloomberg, Reuters, S&P, etc. Excellent customer focus and high level of accuracy, and attention to detail Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively as part of the small team Fluency in Chinese, Thai, Korean or other languages will be a plus    GENERAL CANDIDATE ATTRIBUTES  A deep understanding of asset management enterprise data, its associated processes, systems, controls and deliverables. A strong ability to be hands on yet has a holistic strategic vision on data management A strong team player A performance driven individual Strong relationship management skills  EDUCATION/QUALIFICATIONS  Degree in Business/Finance/IT or related discipline CFA Level I/II preferred

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are seeking an energetic and passionate Technical Manager with data analytics background to join our Citizen Products team who eat, talk, dream about delivering digital services and products that citizens want.   Be part of the team that collaborates with Government agencies and industries to understand citizens’ current pain points, their expectations so as to deliver personalized services that are anticipatory, relevant and easy to use.   As a Technical Manager with human touch from acquired soft skills honed over the years, you will be expected to be a great listener and communicator who can interacts well with government agencies, key stakeholders and solution partners. You will play an integral part in a team who create vision, plan with data and execute with heart.   What to Expect:    Well-positioned to operate the various citizen facing digital service products ranging from virtual assistant bot (Ask Jamie), web analytics (wogaa.sg) to citizen engagement platform (ideas.gov.sg) and more.   Effective in generating interest, explaining value proposition and onboarding of agencies to our suite of products that are used across the government.   Apply data analytics to obtain insights on customers’ behaviour in order to drive relevancy of our products’ anticipatory engine so as to deliver personalized services to our citizens   Use data to identify gaps and services of our products, seeking continuous improvement and constantly deliver useful product features   Use data to identify gaps and services of our products, continuously seeking to enhance our products’ features that are well-accepted by the citizens   Proactively support our onboarded agencies, through timely identification of arising issues and diligently follow through the resolutions to demonstrate high level of professionalism    Able to manage projects of various service delivery models from hybrid waterfall to agile and from in-source, co-source to out-source.   Manage relationships with stakeholders and vendors to ensure delivery of milestones on time      How to Succeed:    Driven by the desire to learn and to tap on the experience of industry experts to deliver high quality products   Be able to see our products from the perspective of our citizens and is passionate about serving them through our technological offering of meaningful and relevant digital services   Disciplines in Computing / Computer Engineers / Electronics Engineering or Information Technology   Experience in managing applications systems    Knowledgeable in project and product management   Minimum 5 years of experience as a project manager and/or technical capacity   Have experience at least 2 full scale project development life cycles   Project management related certifications such as CITPM, PMP, COMIT will be an added advantage   Experience with software design, application development, user acceptance test including network and system infrastructure will be favored

job_title: Office of Planning - Manager (Data Analyst / Scientist)
industry: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesYou will be part of a new Data Analytics (DA) Unit that is responsible to drive the following objectives  Undertake DA projects, in partnership with internal departments as well as other organisations, on students’ learning and outcome, staff teaching, policy formulation/changes, work processes improvement and strategic planning. Provide advice and guidance to other departments to undertake DA projects; Champion and promote the use of data analytics; Work with internal and external technical teams to ensure usability and integrity of data for DA work  As a Data Analyst/Scientist, you will have the opportunity to:-  Translate business requirements and objectives into data models and effective implementation/ dashboard solutions. Migrate existing excel-reports and design dashboards and reports using visualization tools such as Tableau. Adopt and apply suitable machine learning, predictive models or other relevant techniques on a variety of data to derive meaningful statistics, uncover new actionable insights and predictive analytics. Promote understanding of the ecosystem of Data Science/ Big Data tools including data extraction and transformation Collaborate with end users, software development and database engineers in the planning, development and delivery of solutions. Recommend and communicate data-driven findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.  Spearhead objectives of DA Unit in alignment to RP’s organisational mission.   Requirements:  Experience in working with visualisation tools such as Tableau and creating insightful visualisation and analytics. Ability to create optimized data models and dashboards to address the business requirements from data sources such as MS SQL, Excel and flat file formats. Excellent people skills — you’ll be meeting with stakeholders to translate business needs into technical requirements. Strong attention to detail, time management skills and ability to work under pressure Relevant qualification in technical field such as Information Technology or equivalent Minimum of 2 years in data science, engineering or analytics role. Less experienced candidates may be considered for appointment as Assistant or Deputy Manager. Experience in using Python, R, databases/ SQL, machine learning techniques and in Education organisations or Institutes of Higher Learning will be advantageous.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSynechron is looking to on-board a highly motivated individual for the role of a Python Developer in a significant project.
requirements: RequirementsWe are looking for a Python Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the server and the users. Your primary focus will be the development of all server-side logic definition and maintenance of the central database and ensuring high performance and responsiveness to requests from the front-end. You will also be responsible for integrating the front-end elements built by your co-workers into the application. Therefore, a basic understanding of front-end technologies is necessary as well.  Responsibilities:  Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server-side logic Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code Design and implementation of low-latency, high-availability, and performant applications Implementation of security and data protection Integration of data storage solutions and API Gateways  Skills and Qualifications  Strong proficiency with Python, JavaScript and REGEX Ability to build and consume API Understanding the nature of asynchronous programming and its quirks and workarounds Good understanding of server-side templating languages Good understanding of server-side CSS pre-processors Good understanding of front-end technologies, such as HTML5, and CSS3 Understanding accessibility and security compliance, user authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments Integration of APIs, multiple data sources and databases into one system Good knowledge in API Gateways and proxies, such as Axway, WSO2, Kong, Nginx, Apache HTTP Server. Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application Understanding differences between multiple delivery platforms, such as mobile vs. desktop, and optimizing output to match the specific platform Creating database schemas that represent and support business processes, knowledge in PostgreSQL Implementing automated testing platforms, unit tests, and CICD Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git, Bitbucket Understanding of container platform, such as Docker Experience in deploying on Cloud AWS (RDS, ElastiCache, EC2, Autoscaling, ALB/ ELB, ECS etc.) Familiar and working experience with Ansible, Jenkins, Terraform

company: ALEXANDER MANN BPO SOLUTIONS (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
job_title: FICC: AVP, Senior Python Software Developer, Global Markets Technology
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Bank of America Merrill Lynch:  Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 40 countries. In the U.S alone, we serve almost all Fortune 500 companies and approximately 59 million consumers and small-business customers. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading.                              Connecting Asia Pacific to the World Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 23 offices in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies. Bank of America Merrill Lynch is committed to attracting, recruiting and retaining top diverse talent from across the globe. Our diversity and inclusion mission is to actively promote an inclusive work environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve personal success and contribute to the growth of our business. Each of our global Employee Networks bring together employees, create dialogue and awareness in support of our Diversity and Inclusion mission. Bank of America Merrill Lynch is an equal opportunities employer. Position Description:  Background: CIRO (Complex Interest Rate Options) Asia Senior Quartz Developer. We are looking to hire a senior developer who will be responsible for close partnering with the business users and quantitative analysts to shape the design of the next generation risk and work flow platform supporting complex products. This role is part of a small but highly skilled development team building and supporting an in-house risk platform called Quartz. The team, while having a global presence, requires experienced, dedicated developers to ensure that CIRO trade population is correctly priced and risk managed. Given the complex nature of CIRO market, we seek a very hands-on, business-focused developer, who enjoys working through hard technical problems, has very good problem solving/analytical skills, and would be the key aspect to achieve success in the role. The successful candidate will be involved in all stages of the software development life cycle and will have daily interaction with traders/quants and support functions. As a Quartz developer, the candidate will be mainly developing in Python. The selected candidate needs to be have the right aptitude to manage rapid market driven changes in the APAC CIRO business. The successful candidate will be required to become proficient in the tools and methods leveraged by the team in a short period of time. The candidate is expected to make ongoing contributions to improving the design, performance and scalability of the overall solution within Quartz Risk/PL space. Key Responsibilities  Assist local Exotics trading desk with technology and analytics solutions Proactively identify areas where technology can bring in efficiencies Contribute to critical Quartz initiative to support the business (FO risk/Intraday Risk/OPAL Risks & PL). Required to explain and reconcile difference in Risk and PL metrics to the stakeholders.  Enhance core framework to continuously improve Risk/PL stability and achieve operational efficiency Perform various roles in delivering value to the business mainly, application programming/business analysis and integration of pricing models Migration of local downstream interfaces to source the data from Quartz repositories
requirements: RequirementsKey Requirements  The team works mostly in Python as it is the language of choice (Quartz) but we will consider candidates with very strong experience in C++ /C /Java 2-5 years of experience in Technology / Investment Bank Prefer excellent top-tier Engineering / Computer Science / Mathematical background Highly motivated willing to learn about Fixed Income markets and shows keen interest in learning new products Very strong analytical thinking and problem solving skills Very strong at business architecture, simplicity in technology design Very good people skills to navigate through Local / Regional / Global counterparts and stakeholders

Skills:  • Technical: Strong development skills - languages will depends on the entity but mainly python and Scala, Big Data experience (Spark, Hadoop Suite) Experience in Git, continuous integration and delivery. • Awareness on Data Management practices, including Data Lifecycle Management across Core IT & Big Data ecosystems as well as Data Privacy & Security constraints. • Knowledge in Data Modelling (including third normal form, star schema, data vault modelling methods). • Focus on end user and customer centricity, Strong oral and written communication skills, Passion for learning new tools, languages and frameworks, Fast adaptation to changing requirements, Strong problem-solving skills, able to work with minimal direct guidance, self-motivated and proactive, in a collaborative model, side by side with the business, Practical, hands on approach to get results. • Experienced in Cloud services & architecture. • Discipline in writing technical & non-technical documentation.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a Data Architect, you will work with our business teams to enable the design and build of repeatable analytics solutions, and to help drive innovation through proof of concepts and underlying capabilities. Accountabilities We seek an individual who will embody a collaborative approach in bringing both business and technology stakeholders together to deliver technology solutions that enable tangible business benefits.   What you will do...   ·       Own the definition of data architecture components for information management solutions to facilitate storage, integration, usage, access, and delivery of data assets across the enterprise. ·       Produce and approve architecture diagrams for enterprise data and analytics solutions including conceptual, logical and physical. ·       Architecting conceptual, logical and physical data models using data modelling approaches (e.g. 3NF relational, Kimball dimensional) in standard modelling tools. ·       Designing the data integration architecture based on solution requirements e.g. real-time, near real-time, batch. ·       Support, Define and manage work packages that deliver elements of an information management solution e.g. data warehouse, data mart, ETL service, operational data store. ·       Solve the challenge of integrating disparate sources of enterprise data and information to model and visualize their businesses and derive insight. ·       Develop and maintain long lasting relationships with senior stakeholders, both during and outside of project delivery. ·       Supporting a data design work-stream in an agile delivery or on a large-scale ‘waterfall’ delivery project for an enterprise data warehouse or reporting solution. ·       Lead the design of the architecture for an on-premises or cloud-based, data warehouse, or big data solution; this could cover several technologies, countries and lines of business. ·       Lead and Assist in the further development of our capability through proof-of-concepts.
requirements: Requirementskills You are familiar with... Data Integration & Federation: ·       e.g. SAP, IBM, Oracle, Microsoft, Informatica, Ab Initio, and data integration tools for Hadoop-based architectures. Data Repositories: ·       e.g. Oracle, Teradata, SQL Server, Netezza, DB2, Greenplum, Amazon Redshift, Cassandra, Hadoop.   EA License No. 14C7181 Reg No. R1222538

You will bring a vision of the big data solutions landscape for choosing optimal architecture components to use for these purposes as well as a set of data engineering skills for implementing enterprise data foundation. Develop real-time and batch data ingesting and processing pipelines to be used for used for analysis, dashboards, alerts and visualization to optimize the processes within a business function. Own the project plan's delivery on-time and in scope to the satisfaction of all stakeholders Perform periodic risk assessment and minimize risks through appropriate planning and escalation Maintain a comprehensive project documentation that is reusable You also play a supporting role to various departments across the business where you support and provide useful insights on the implementation of workflows, as well as the data warehousing department in the implementation of the data warehouse for the new big data platforms

Strong planning and organizing skills including the ability to manage several work streams simultaneously. Excellent communication skills with a capacity to present, discuss and explain issues coherently and logically both in writing and verbally. Good influencing and persuasion skills with the ability to enthuse and inspire multidisciplinary teams and build successful relationships at all levels. Good team player, self-motivated and able to work on own initiative. Clear decision-making ability with the facility to judge complex situations and assess when to escalate issues. Ability to balance conflicting and changing demands through prioritization and a pragmatic approach.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesIntroduction:  We’re seeking an experienced data scientist to deliver insight to us on a daily basis. The ideal team member will have the mathematical and statistical expertise you’d expect, but a natural curiosity and creative mind that’s not so easy to find. As you mine, interpret, and clean our data, we will rely on you to ask questions, connect the dots, and uncover opportunities that lie hidden within—all with the ultimate goal of realizing the data’s full potential. You will join a team of data specialists, but will “slice and dice” data using your own methods, creating new visions for the future. Job Description Responsibilities:  Provide business with meaningful data by using data mining techniques, including pattern detection, graph analysis or statistical analysis. Work with the business stakeholders to identify data requirements, model and frame business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact on critical business processes and/or decisions. Identifying important datasets out of tons of data provided to you based on retail domain knowledge and interaction with business stakeholders Manage mapping of data fields from Relational databases to NoSQL data bases Design data models in non-relational databases and migrate data from relational to non-relational databases Enable data validation frameworks to validate data migrated from relational to non-relational databases Ability to independently process, sanitize, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis Ability to enhance/optimize data migration procedures to include data that is relevant for building analytic systems Support reporting analysts in enabling the required data in flattened structures Work with IT teams to support data collection, integration and retention requirements based on the input collected with the business. Ensure that the information used follows the compliance, access management and control policies of the organization. Suggest ongoing improvements to methods and algorithms that lead to findings, including new information. Understand the use and ability to employ the appropriate algorithm to discover patterns.
requirements: RequirementsSkills and Qualifications:  Relevant years of experience i.e. minimum 3+ years of experience in data or statistical analysis, with mathematical and causal modelling skills Experience of analyzing data from relational data sources, Flat files, CSV files Experience of writing Advanced SQL (Oracle, SQL Server, MSACCESS), Hive Query Language (Hadoop) queries for Data Reconciliation, Data Completeness, Data cleanness, Data Transformation, Segmentation, Normalization and Data Quality tests. Good understanding of ETL Concepts and Data Modelling in RDBMS vs non-relational database Knowledge of working on NoSQL technologies like Hadoop, MapR, Cassandra etc. Working with data visualization frameworks for web applications such as D3.js, HighCharts etc. would be an added advantage Candidates with exposure in retail domain will be preferred Exposure in working in Agile environments Must be an individual contributor Engineering from premier institutes (preferably in statistics, applied math, or related discipline) Ability to come up with solutions to loosely defined business problems by leveraging pattern detection over potentially large datasets.

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities COMPANY DESCRIPTION  NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives.  RESPONSIBILITIES  The rapid adoption of technology and mobile devices have contributed to vast newflows of information which are larger in volume, faster in velocity, diverse in variety,and requires veracity of the information for use. This new type of information—broadly known as big data (and combined with tools and data platforms)—if utilised well, could radically improve business performance. As the organization embarks to become a data led group, significant decisions andvalue generation will be based on the data that we capture and deploy. The leaders of the Social Enterprises are keen to utilize the data to drive growth, deliver customer service, and create personalized experiences. The role of VP, Enterprise Data Warehouse will drive the overall strategy andexecution of how this data will be captured, stored, accessed, and deployed across these social enterprises. The role will devise a consistent data warehouse architecture strategy and a comprehensive framework for a single or hybrid datamanagement platform build on AWS, evaluate and deploy tools to access this data, deploy BI tools, set up data governance and transfer frameworks and protocols, and manage the inflow and outflow of this information. In addition, this role will work with all API developers to ensure our data flows are consistent, follow data privacy guidelines, and protects our information sharing procedures. NTUC group has 9 social enterprises and this leader will develop the enterprise data warehouse strategy, execution, and maintenance across ALL these enterprises withina central group analytics office capability. The group leader will have the following core responsibilities:  A complete enterprise DWH strategy and data architecture for all the 9 SE’s. The platform is already on AWS. ETL and data engineers to build, transfer, and maintain data into this platform. Data governance and data quality expert to build all governance and access principles. Business Analysts to act as strategic partners to each SE CTO’s.  The Role: As we embark on the journey of Data led enterprise, the role will be a combination of Data architecture, Data Management, Data Governance, and data visualization. The responsibilities will be as follows:  Define and set the standards for an enterprise wide framework for DWH management (on Amazon cloud), data governance, and utilization ofinformation as an organizational asset. Develop an overall data capture, storage, and dissemination framework for all the social enterprises defining central vs. local data framework. Build the ETL frameworks for each SE working with their technology and data leaders and enable a consistent data model for each of the enterprises inthe group CAO platform. Set data governance standards, data control processes, data policy standards, and effective usage frameworks for the enterprise and all the SE’s. Work with software vendors to deploy the latest BI, analytical and big data tools across the franchise. Lead the efforts with our digital platform managers to ensure our data flows and API’s have defined and consistent frameworks. Work with our customer experience teams, data science groups, and product managers to deploy tools and enable information access capabilities. Closely partner with our data product solutions team as we build NE into an insights driven platform. Work closely with SE CTO’s to deploy data towards payments, authentication, and insight solutions.
requirements: Requirements Must be highly technical/strong hardware and software engineering competencies. Focus will be on cloud based DWH architecture, latest DWH technologies, and CLOUD capabilities. Demonstrated experience of moving data from existing platforms to CLOUD architecture. Worked closely with BI teams, data science teams, and product teams to deploy the latest software including capable experience with latest tools like HADOOP, SPARK, HANA, TABLEAU, and other latest data tools. Must have worked on new e-biz enabled business models and how data is architected in these areas specially payments, authentication, and insights/search. Managed and rolled-out data governance standards, data protocols, data security, and privacy disciplines. Worked closely with business and data science partners, product vendors, and software firms. Managed significant budgets and put budgeting plans and financial disciplines in previous experiences. Critical to have strong presentation skills, communication and articulation to non-data partners essential. Strong strategic capability that has been proven by having built large data platforms for enterprises, e-commerce, and other digital ecosystems.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team of innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you’ll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. You’ll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you—and the products you deliver—will thrive. Working as an Architect, your passion for technology and thirst for innovation will help shape the future of global digital commerce, now and for years to come. Every day, you’ll bring critical day-to-day leadership and thinking to the table, working with teams of architects, aligning cross-functional projects, ensuring that they’re within reason, fiscally and technically. You’ll collaborate with internal teams and business leaders alike, creating strategically sound Target State Architectures. You will have a major say in budgeting, hiring, mentoring, setting priorities and fostering a client-centric environment where everyone learns and grows. At the end of the day, your work will have tremendous and positive impact, whether it’s in-house, in collaboration with technologists across JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s global technology community or in partnership with some of the most important tech firms in the world.  This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: •BS/BA degree or equivalent experience •Expertise in application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines •Fluency in architecture and design across all systems •Knowledge in at least one area of technical architecture •Strategic thinking and passion for business strategy and business processes •Experience in risk and risk control compliance •Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals •Implementation of enterprise grade solutions for technology data management •Technical expertise including data sourcing, ingestion, persistence and presentation capabilities •Deliverables are expected to adhere to code quality standards, test coverage, maintainability etc •Subject matter expertise in technology infrastructure (Compute, Storage, backup, network, cloud) and asset lifecycle management •Understand and deliver data modeling requirements – physical and logical data modeling •Drive data quality enhancements at scale to solve business problems in a prioritized manner •Build and support data flow integration between different products increasing the capabilities of our product and expanding its use across the firm •Ability to understand and deliver client requirements end to end for reference data and data lake aligned use cases •Ensure proper risk management process is adhered too, to mitigate risk exposure for the firm •Client centric focus – ensure a positive user experience by our consumers
requirements: Requirements Hard Skills / Requirements •Technology Infrastructure Expertise ◦Ability to understand in depth how technology products are delivered (e.g. virtual server infrastructure technology, block storage, industry leading cloud providers) ◦Ability to understand what data needs to be collected and how it can be collected to meet the firm’s requirements ◦Understand of disaster recovery (DR) requirements, how a technology organization would plan and assess readiness for DR scenarios – including technology products used to achieve DR readiness •Strong Data Architecture experience ◦Advanced understanding of reference data, data lake, and other information system solutions ◦Experience integrated multiple systems together to create an intelligent and resilient information system solution ◦Ability to use industry standard tools to create logical and physical data models for technology infrastructure and reference data •Information System Design ◦Experience delivering or supporting information systems using extract, translate, load (ETL) and publishing methods ◦Understanding the right technical solution to represent the data appropriately to meet the client requirement ◦Experience with performance tuning of information systems (e.g. streamlining ETLs to run faster) •Data Quality Experience ◦Understanding the core concepts of data quality–how to measure improve ◦Ability to analyze data for data quality gaps ◦Understanding what data quality issues pose the greatest risks to the firm’s operations and raising those to governance effectively Soft Skills/attributes required for this Role •Experience at a large multinational company •Collaborative personality – ability to deliver in coordination with many different teams •Strong communication skills – ability to provide clarity and focus to projects while working with both engineering groups as well as senior management •Strong presentation skills – ability to create professional presentations and present clear stories to large audiences •Self-motivated – desire to take on increasing responsibility over time •Autonomous – ability to understand their role in depth and make decisions independently   When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 20 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $10B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will are transforming the financial services industry.  At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity.  We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation.  If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.  A quick link to this particular job posting can be found in this URL: http://jobs.jpmorganchase.com/ListJobs/ByKeyword/190023344/ Please note that only short-listed candidates will be notified. We thank you for your interest and wish you all the best in your career. Yours Sincerely, Human Resources JPMorgan

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesYou will be a member of the Enterprise architecture team responsible for ensuring that applications developed or procured has data governance considerations baked into it. The end result of your effort will be applications that have lineage built into them to ensure minimal duplication of data and having a canonical data warehouse that simplifies management from an enterprise standpoint.
requirements: Requirements Knowledge of Enterprise Architecture Fundamentals; exposure to Reference Enterprise Architecture Ability to understand how the data relates to the current operations and the effects that any future process changes will have on the use of data in the organization. Ability to translate business needs into architecture requirements. Ability to maximize the data resources by reducing redundancy, enabling accessibility within security boundaries, fostering corporate understanding of the meaning of the data (meta data management). Must be able to understand and communicate the data requirements of any future infrastructure needs, working with the IT architects to develop an approach that fits the current and planned needs of the organization. Ability to develop standards for naming, describing, governing, managing, modeling, storing, cleansing, transforming, searching and delivering ALL data within the enterprise. Experience in data ingestion, data integration, data quality, data profiling and data conversions. Able to work with an enterprise architects to adhere to the latest development standards of the enterprise. Excellent skills in data management, data modeling, data services, reporting, and analytics as well as the tools used to support these areas. Knowledge of data management tools such as Informatica BDM, EDC, AVON, BDQ, etc.  Nice to Have:  Ability to rationalize data architecture design for new and legacy software applications platforms. Define data standards / reference architectures for use by project teams in developing technical designs. Prior experience in working with data governance team members across multiple projects. Knowledge of industry standards for baseline data models and translate them into use case development framework. Deliver well-defined data design documentation and data models that guide and inform project streams   Define performance and scalability requirements and validate based on performance and scalability testing. Perform technical design reviews to ensure vendors deliver be-spoke capabilities that wouldn’t result in a high level of technical debt in the data domain.  Work closely with various teams to establish and validate data design requirements. Work collaboratively with and across multiple development teams to align data architecture. Define and develop a data migration or bridging strategy for existing legacy systems that need to migrate to.  EA License No: 18S9405 Reg No: R1330864

Systems integration experience (e.g. ETL /  message broker) is a plus.  5+ years of relevant technical experience on MDM or PIM Products with minimum 5 project implementation experience, Informatica Customer/Product 360 is a plus.  5+ years of experience working with business stakeholders and other technologists in a project capacity . Experience in consulting companies as a solution architect for MDM and/or PIM implementation is an advantage.  Knowledge of architecture standard and industry best practices in MDM/PIM domains  Interested candidates can share their resume at recruitment@aryansearch.com or call at T +65 67087429 Ext: 212 for a confidential discussion.

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities Design, optimise/tune performance, maintain, monitor, diagnose, and troubleshoot the processes, data delivery, and other outputs and facets of the big data platform Prepare progress and activity reports on the platform’s status and health (e.g. SLAs, data quality) Develop ETL/architectural pipelines/packages/roadmaps for data migration/data collection across different databases and systems Analyse and create data elements/flows, dependencies and relationships, and physical/logical data models Collaborate and communicate with the data science team relating to business requirements Automate, productise, and document the parts of the data science lifecycle/workflow (e.g. training, testing, deployment) Design, develop, and deploy high performance, at-scale solutions/pipelines (e.g. batch, real-time) to process large volumes of varied data formats (e.g. structured/unstructured) Work on Agile/DevOps technologies, micro-services, and APIs Keep up with industry trends and best practices in data engineering and the telco business and share with the data science team
requirements: Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Management Information Systems, or related field 2-3 years of relevant working experience; candidates without working experience who possess the right skills/ competencies and eager to learn are welcome to apply Strong understanding and experience working in GNU/Linux environments Previous experience in designing and developing data models, multiple data source integration, ETL pipelines, and using data wrangling tools in EDW and big data platforms Experience in designing/developing at-scale, high-throughput big data/machine learning systems and applications Knowledge of software engineering practices and the software development life cycle (e.g. coding standards, review, control, testing) Experience and knowledge in distributed data processing, streaming, and computation frameworks (e.g. Spark, Kafka, Sqoop, Flume) Experience in/with:   DevOps automation, configuration, containerisation and orchestration (e.g. Ansible, Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins) Development using big data applications (e.g. HIVE, HBase, Impala) Object-oriented/object function scripting languages (e.g. Python, Java, C++, Scala) Relational SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g. Oracle, Postgres, Cassandra) Disaster recovery, backup, automated testing, migration, and deployment (e.g. on-prem, cloud) Utilizing web services, SOAP, REST, etc Development and collaboration tools (e.g. GIT, Jira) Managing and interacting with users and vendors   Familiarity with internet technologies and public clouds (e.g. SaaS, IaaS, PaaS, AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) Knowledge in the Telecom industry is an advantage Effective verbal and written communication with ability to write thorough and clear documentation

company: GROUPM ASIA PACIFIC HOLDINGS PTE. LTD.
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOverview of job You will support senior colleagues in achieving the efficient delivery of econometric analysis. Typical responsibilities and duties are the preparation of data (cleaning and performing required ETL operations), contributing to the building and interpretation of models and helping to write results and implications. Reporting of the role This role reports to the Project Manager 3 best things about the job:  Be part of a dynamic team, responsible for harnessing the power of data and technology to provide timely, actionable business insights to our clients Be part of a global Centre of Excellence and work for clients across the globe Learn and develop yourself in cutting edge technologies and platforms in the field of data and analytics  Measures of success – In three months:  Undertake data extraction, manipulation, formatting and analysis Analyze datasets to ensure that each KPI is understood and can be explained back to the team. Ensure that all tables, charts and other information produced by you or others has been checked for accuracy and formatted to the standards before passing on to senior project team. Provide support to more senior colleagues in data collection including the preparation and sending of data requests, chasing outstanding data and querying data with clients and agencies. Help the broader team in writing intermediate presentation decks, like data validation.  In six months:  Assist in the building of comprehensive econometric models according to the project specification. Validate models, identify areas of weakness, suggest and test improvements and ensure robustness and validity. Help to run scenarios required to answer client objectives.  In 12 months:  Actively seek more efficient ways of doing things for yourself and others and turn suggestions into actions including in service and product development. Demonstrate flexibility and work across multiple clients and projects at a time as directed by your project manager  About Singapore GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients and media owners. As the largest media investment management company in Singapore with over 41% market share (Recma) and over 650 employees, GroupM Singapore is the premiere organisation to join and develop a career in.
requirements: RequirementsEssential skills, knowledge and experience:  Excellent knowledge of Excel, common econometrics packages and PowerPoint. Strong analytical skills; ability to analyze raw data, manipulate the same, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations.  Desirable skills, knowledge and experience:  Experience manipulating and processing media and marketing data (i.e. GRPs, Impressions, Reach, Clicks) from a variety of sources. Skill in data visualization software such as Tableau, Datorama or Power BI etc. An advanced understanding of time-series econometric modelling. Knowledge in other relevant advanced software such as Access, VBA, Python (with pandas), SQL, R, SAS etc. Experience in the manipulation of Nielsen or IRI data

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities This is a technical position providing hands-on delivery role, working with the cross-functional teams, while ensuring excellent cross functional relationship. Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and Google ‘big data’ technologies. Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. Additional responsibilities include troubleshooting, maintenance, and optimization or enhancement of existing processes. Plans and conducts ETL unit and development tests; monitors results and takes corrective action, when necessary Plans, coordinates and implements security measures to safeguard data in information store / datawarehouse against accidental or unauthorized damage, modification or disclosure Analysis of business requirements document created by Data Architect team Create SSIS packages based on mapping document Work with stakeholders including the BSA, Report developers, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. Additional responsibilities include troubleshooting, maintenance, and optimization or enhancement of existing processes.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are the data people. Everything we do center around data. We manage data, use them and prepare organisations to transform their culture and operations towards a data and insight driven approach. And now, we are starting a Smart Buildings division. Our vision is to use data science to bring buildings into the 21st century. Our products and services aim to manage energy costs, generate insights for the facilities team and make every experience in a building seamless. We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our Product Development Team and spearhead all data science activities related to developing products for our software-as-a-service platform. Responsible for overseeing the data science team, the successful candidate manages the full lifecycle of the process of question formulation, design, research and development, implementation, and testing. The current team is comprised of 3 machine learning engineers who are keen to be led and mentored by the successful candidate.  The raw data can be a mixture between categorical and time series data with problems ranging from real-time optimization to analytics/descriptive product solutions. As a Data Scientist with Azendian, you will have a chance to make a global impact as the application of data science in this domain is still at its infancy.
requirements: Requirements Lead all R&D direction for product development Work with stakeholders to understand the business case and provide input Manage end-to-end lifecycle of building and validating models Identify desired/required dataset and data sources Provide input into the development of backend systems Guidance and mentoring for team members  Requirements  3+ years of experience in manipulating data and developing models and algorithms Experience in writing production grade algorithms Demonstrated expertise in Machine Learning and Optimization, especially time series data Proficiency in applying advanced statistical techniques  Demonstrated expertise in practical data processing, data mining and information retrieval tasks Experience working in cross-functional team environment Excited to gain knowledge in a new domain Strong intellectual curiosity and a passion for solving high impact real-world problems Excellent communication, leadership, relationship skills and a strong team player
