job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBusiness Process Re-Engineering Associate Job Description:-  The Process Reengineering Associate will work closely with Process Reengineering leadership and will be responsible for understanding and documenting the current business process; identify improvement areas/opportunities to drive in operational efficiencies; The incumbent  will be required to interact with the business/process/services/IT  stakeholders and related line managers to identify process gaps and recommend improvements using Design Thinking, Lean and Value Stream Mapping Frameworks. He/she need to effectively work through complexities associated with coordination across multiple entities, conflicting efforts, and limited resources. Manages multiple operational, financial, and compliance projects and support project team to achieve the scope, timing and objectives of each complex assignment. Utilize strong analytics, technical and communication skills as well as deep, broad understanding of the business to summarize key findings. Must have minimum 3 years or more experience with transformation, business process analysis, process re-engineering, statistical process controls, cost reduction techniques, and lean Six Sigma techniques Work Location: Based out of Singapore but may involve some travel  Key Responsibilities:   Process Improvements/Technical skills  Strong qualitative and quantitative analytical ability to draw sound conclusions and make appropriate recommendations to management Understand and document the current working process in details (review, document and assess critical business processes) Uses end-to-end mapping and analysis to identify opportunities for improvement that positively impact up-stream and down-stream business partners. Provides technical expertise for the planning, managing and implementation of enterprise-wide process improvement initiatives. Perform data manipulation and analysis (graphical and statistical) as required in support of performance metric reporting. Facilitating process workshops that involve eliciting process requirements and liaising with users to identify gaps and recommend improvements to deliver the artefacts, backlog of functions, coaching the Product Owner and Consulting during execution of Target-Operating-Model of Processes Develop metrics that provide data for process measurement, identifying indicators for future improvement opportunities Support project in validating the user requirements via testing    Project Support  Support multiple project backlogs which may have many internal and external dependencies, are complex in scope, have divisional and/or organization-wide impact, have multiple integration points, a higher level or risk requiring mitigation plans and are worked within multiple teams of resources. Develop reports, monitoring and evaluation activities of current projects and/or actions targeted to improve key metrics and customer insights. Responsible for design, development, implementation, and integration of people, processes, and technology needed for successful implementation of initiatives. Identify, communicate, and report significant deviations from project plan/quality    Relationship Management  Provides insight from a business perspective on the direction and continued utilization of continuous improvement methodologies. Works with all levels (leaders, managers, and associates) of assigned areas to identify opportunities for improvement, structure efforts to achieve the targeted improvements and establish measurement systems to monitor performance.
requirements: RequirementsMandatory Requirements  3 or more years of experience in the insurance industry (GI and or Life and Health) 2 or more years of experience in continuous improvement initiatives and complex projects and Process transformation using Design Thinking, Lean or Value Stream Mapping Workshops to create a transformative Target Operating Model-Processes Experience of working closely with Business and IT Leaders  Solid experience within at least two or more functional area (policy administration, claims, customer services and Underwriting) Experience in Continuous Improvement of the Processes using the CI Frameworks, Service Design Sprints, Kanban ways of delivering solution for Services Management Highly collaborative with a demonstrated ability to build strong, credible relationships and teams within all levels in the organization Good Communication skills High critical thinking skills to evaluate alternatives and present solutions that are consistent with business objectives and strategy  Added Advantage:  Familiarity with project management tools (Jira, confluence, MPP) Understand the ways ERP, BPM, CRM, RPA and Salesforce work and context of Process Re-Engineering Lean/Six Sigma certification Green Belt/Black Belt Project Management / Change Management certifications (e.g. PMP) Knowledge of Business Process Management

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBusiness Transformation team is responsible for managing the change and driving the transformation of the business, in support of key projects impacting front-office, in close partnership with the technology team.  We are looking for a Business Analyst with good knowledge of digital banking. This person will be responsible for non-technology aspects of the project with the support from the project team. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAvePoint is the Microsoft Cloud expert. Over 15,000 companies and 6 million cloud users worldwide trust AvePoint to migrate, manage, and protect their Office 365 and SharePoint data. AvePoint’s integrated cloud, hybrid, and on-premises software solutions are enhanced by 24/7 support and award-winning services. Organizations across six continents and all industries rely on AvePoint to ease transition to the Microsoft Cloud, increase IT administrator productivity, and satisfy governance and compliance objectives.  AvePoint is seeking a Business Analyst with enterprise software solutions experience to join us in our Client Services division. The Business Analyst analyzes business processes and applicable automated systems, and develops As-Is and To-Be descriptions. This individual leads requirements gathering and analysis activities, prepares and delivers written and oral communications, participates in testing activities, helps design methods and procedures for internal and external projects. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  Elicit requirements for software development using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analyses. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into detail, identify risks, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. Translate technical information into business language to ensure understanding of the requirements by both technical and non-technical audiences. Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements (Business Requirements Document), Use Cases, GUI, Screen and Interface designs. Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs. Operate as the liaison between the business units, technology teams, and support teams. Support the project manager and other team members in planning deliverables, scope, schedule, and other aspects of the project Supervise at least two junior team members, including conducting interviews, making hiring recommendations, conducting regular 1-on-1 meetings, drafting IDPs, and completing performance evaluations.
requirements: Requirements 3 years SharePoint experience at least; product manager experience SharePoint maintenance experience; SharePoint portal project experience; computing or software relevant bachelor degree Understanding of Microsoft SharePoint architecture, components, and configuration Understands Internet, Intranet, Extranet and client/server architectures Professional experience with analyzing and documenting complex business processes, software development requirements, and taxonomies. Professional experience with requirements gathering and analysis. Experience producing and analyzing As-Is and To-Be documentation. Experience preparing and delivering written and oral communications. Strong analytical and project management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Familiarity with MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint). Ability to successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. Experience supervising junior associates, including conducting interviews, making hire recommendations, and completing performance reviews.

You will be the first line of assessment and analysis for projects, change Requests and BAU/Issue management. The BA will need to be a self-starter and will work in conjunction with the project manager and program manager to ensure efficient delivery of the program’s objectives and priorities The BA will be expected to work closely with key stakeholders internally as well as work with, build and maintain relationships with external stakeholders and managers. The candidate will be responsible for;  Facilitation of requirements gathering sessions and workshops Documentation of requirements, process, activities and other key documentation Supporting Pre-UAT and UAT activities, through test case development and defect documentation and tracking Support user training initiatives Documentation of business cases for enhancements and change requests Documentation of process and procedures for handover to BAU support Coming up with new ideas and solutions to improve efficiency The candidate for this position develops operational efficiency, process controls and supports stream lining of program activities in both project and BAU.  He/she will support the senior leadership in creating developmental level innovations via the utilization of accurate data. This position is of utmost importance to the leadership team and the candidate is expected to offer data driven intelligence to enhance the internal and external business opportunities He/she will have experience of pioneering multiple projects & activities at the same time. He/she will be responsible issue understanding, documentation and resolution and will be a key person in the end to end delivery. The analyst is to organize and fulfill all business prerequisites and mentor and train personnel in analysis as often as necessary. Liaise with executive leadership to spearhead the organization in employing data-motivated decision making.

Outstanding skills in finding resolution to complicated problems while performing independently in a multifaceted and dynamic environment.

company: AUSTRALIA AND NEW ZEALAND BANKING GROUP LIMITED
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDescription     Exciting role available within Global Markets – Projects Team   Be the single point of contact for Projects on Information Security and Technology Assurance   Reports to the Senior Project Manager, Global Markets     About The Role Role Location: ANZ Singapore – 10 Collyer Quay, Ocean Financial Centre Role Type: 24 months fixed-term role   As an Assurance Business Analyst, you will be part of and work closely with the delivery teams on articulating and ensuring that projects are compliant with ANZ policies and regulatory framework and delivering within acceptable levels of residual risk as defined by ANZ Operational Risk Measurement and Management Framework (ORMMF).   You will perform and manage all assessments required by ANZ Information Security, In-Country Compliance Groups, Technology and Operational risks and demonstrate project adherence of applicable controls, while maintaining key relationships with all stakeholders and sign-off authorities.   You will work with project team to apply the Information Security, Technology Assurance, compliance framework and resolve conflict and ambiguity between policies, regulatory requirements framework and practical implementation, in alignment with the ANZ delivery framework in place.   You may also be involved in performing other analysis activities such as testing design and change transition and understand the technical, business and organizational context of the change.   Part of your role is to engage closely with the platform architects, platform owners, and interface partners to deliver successful designs and testing solutions.
requirements: RequirementsAbout You To be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following –    Proven experience performing risk assessments within the Banking industry   Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)   Experience in stakeholder management and in doing documentation for business   Knowledge and experience with relevant APEA regional regulatory frameworks and guidelines (e.g. Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) would be highly regarded   Knowledge of Operational Risk, Global Markets, Artificial Intelligence and Machine learning is preferred   Strong analytical skills and ability to influence and negotiate with both internal and external stakeholders     About ANZ At ANZ, everything we do boils down to ‘why’ – our purpose – to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We're just as focused on seeing our people thrive as well as our customers. We'll give you every opportunity to develop your career.   We are responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter the most, energising our people, eliminating waste and reducing bureaucracy.   A happy workplace is a thriving one. So in order to attract and keep the best talent, and say thanks for the hard work, we make sure all our employees are rewarded.   ANZ recognises the value of an inclusive and diverse work environment. We take pride in the diversity of our people and encourage applications from diverse candidates. Our recruitment decisions are based on the key inherent needs and requirements of each role, and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and characteristics.   We work flexibly at ANZ. Talk to us and let us know how this role can be flexible for you.   To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.anz.com/careers.   You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and search for reference number Taleo Job Code SIN006423.

Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe purpose of this role is to manage sprints for development of a workflow system. This includes leading sprint planning sessions, daily stand up meetings, demos and sprint retrospectives as well as reporting to management on project status. This role is not “pure Agile” but rather a mix of Scrum Master and tradition Project Manager tasks. The Scrum Master will be based in Singapore and will work with an offshore Business Analyst and offshore development and test teams as well as a mix of onshore and offshore business stakeholders.  Agile Expertise – Coach team members on agile processes, help the organization mature its agile processes. Project/Scrum Management   Produce and maintain status updates, velocity trackers, product backlogs, etc. as required. Lead daily stand ups, sprint planning sessions, retrospectives and demos as part of the sprint lifecycle. Provide regular updates to broader stakeholders on status of the sprint. Deliver sprints to schedule. Escalate issues and clear any blockers for the team promptly.
requirements: Requirements Experience with agile tools and methodologies such as burn down charts. Experience working with organizations that are transitioning to agile processes, as well as organizations with mature agile processes, preferred. Ability to lead daily stand up meetings, including resolving roadblocks through mediation and escalation as required. Scrum Master certification preferred. Can work in high pressure, demanding environments and deliver high quality results. Experience running sprints with offshore development teams preferred. Experience with agile/project management software preferred. Experience in the insurance industry preferred.

The role is expected to work with market risk control (PCG) users, tech Lead, system Analyst and project manager to implement Murex as the new Treasury system across the various asset classes. Thecandidate is also expected to lead the delivery of the market risk control streamensuring that all development and build are delivered and tested within the committed timelines.

job_title: Business Analyst, Vendor Operations Trust & Safety - Singapore
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Trust and Safety At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Gaining and retaining this trust is critically important to Google’s success. We defend Google's integrity by fighting spam, fraud and abuse, and develop and communicate state-of-the-art product policies. The Trust and Safety team reduces risk and protects the experience of our users and business partners in more than 40 languages and across Google's expanding base of products. We work with a variety of teams from Engineering to Legal, Public Policy and Sales Engineering to set policies and combat fraud and abuse in a scalable way, often with an eye to finding industry-wide solutions. Trust and Safety team members are motivated to find innovative solutions, and use technical know-how, user insights and proactive communication to pursue the highest possible quality and safety standards for users across Google products. The role: Business Analyst, Vendor Operations Trust & Safety - Singapore Google's brand is only as strong as our users' trust--and their steadfast belief that our guiding principles are what's best for them. Our Trust and Safety team has the critical responsibility of protecting Google's users by ensuring online safety by fighting web abuse and fraud across Google products like Search, Maps, Google Ads and AdSense. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic leader. You understand the user's point of view and are passionate about using your combined technical, sales and customer service acumen to protect our users. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google developers and Product Managers to navigate challenging online safety situations and handle abuse and fraud cases at Google speed (read: fast!). Help us prove that quality on the Internet trumps all. Additional Role Description: As a Vendor Operations Business Analyst you will help ensure the financial success of our vendor support operations. You will manage and report on all of the financials of Trust and Safety's global vendor business and provide analysis and business planning recommendations throughout the year. Additionally, you will work closely with each of the regional site leads to understand their current state and future strategy and needs and collaborate with finance teams and various Product teams to ensure their needs are met. In this role, you will continuously improve processes to ensure all related tasks are completed successfully. You will be comfortable working with leaders in the team in order to make these improvements. Responsibilities: - Oversee and drive efficiency in core finance-related processes (e.g., financial planning and performance reporting). - Identify business insights from financial data and present them concisely and clearly to leaders.
requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. - Experience contributing to operational improvement. Preferred qualifications: - Master's degree. - Ability to work across multiple locations and multiple products to create a coherent external partnership strategies and execute them. - Ability to understand, review and negotiate commercial agreements. - Ability to create and improve processes to ensure smooth and successful negotiations. - Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking, analytical, interpersonal and communication skills. - Experience in vendor management and/or risk and change management with the ability to successfully work in ambiguous environments.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Senior Business Analyst role is an exciting, varied and responsible one, representing the organization and ensuring our clients receive the very best of our services. We work on tough challenges and deliver results, relentlessly. The role is a client-facing one, requiring flexibility in terms of geographical location. There is also the opportunity for travel. Responsibilities:  Demonstrate the ability to co-operate with a variety of people and achieve results Follow through with commitments and foster mutual trust with peers and stakeholders Proactively initiate, develop, and maintain effective, collaborative working relationships with team members Build and maintain relationships with colleagues who are geographically distributed, and contribute to embedding them in the project so that physical distance is no obstacle to outstanding delivery Encourage fellow team members to make innovative contributions and embrace new ideas Mentor and steer more junior Business Analysts assigned to the same project Interface – and communicate effectively - with different groups such as stakeholders, product owners, users, developers, UI and UX experts and testers, ‘translating’ information and messages as required Execute effective stakeholder identification and analyses, using tools such as Stakeholder and RACI Matrices Develop and continue positive relationships with client IT and business stakeholders at all levels, manage their expectations, and resolve conflicts On small- and medium-sized projects: advise on a suitable analysis approach, bring others on-board with the proposal and then implement it, instructing more junior Business Analysts Define and manage scope across a variety of spheres and levels Identify and document the as-is and to-be, and define a road map of how best to move from the current to future state Identify, document, analyze and improve business and system processes, and user journeys Organize and drive the identification, prioritization, documentation, communication of - and commitment to - business requirements throughout the project lifecycle, using a variety of recognized techniques and tools Facilitate the development of business requirements through discussions, workshops, interviews, observation, GAP analyses and other appropriate methods and techniques Utilize a variety of methods to best document and communicate requirements, including wireframes, user stories, use cases and specifications Manage requirements throughout the project lifecycle, using a variety of methods including Agile product backlogs: Vision, Epics, Stories, Use Cases Proactively co-ordinate focus and activity to ensure the client’s requirements are met through delivery Review, assess and advise on project changes, especially when they impact agreed scope or requirements Develop accurate and complete user and business acceptance test plans, and test scenarios and scripts; and manage and facilitate UAT execution Support the client in developing and delivering end-user training Address end-user questions about process and/or system implementations, providing break/fix support Demonstrate understanding of project processes, such as RAID and change management Utilize tracking tools such as JIRA, TFS or Rally Basic wireframes/mockup skills including modeling tools experience: Balsamiq Modeling skills – business process diagrams (BPMN/UML) including modeling tools experience: Enterprise Architect, Visio Good command of English. Dutch and/or German are a plus
requirements: Requirements To be knowledgeable about IT-enabled change and delivery-focused Must have extensive experience of the Business Analyst role across all stages of the project lifecycle, in both Agile and Waterfall environments Must demonstrable expertise in a variety of pan-lifecycle business analysis methods and techniques Whilst able to draw on an expansive tool-kit of traditional analysis techniques and tools, should be able to innovate when called for – always ensuring that the analysis approach, methods and deliverables are adapted to - and suitable for - the scenario in-hand To be proactive, flexible and adaptable, able to acclimatize to new environments effortlessly To be energetic, confident self-starter, capable of acting independently or as part of a team Must have excellent time management, multi-tasking and organizational skills To be able to work under pressure to tight deadlines, maintaining attention to detail Must also have well-developed verbal, written and listening skills Must be skilled at - and at ease - dealing with stakeholders of all levels

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesQUOINE is looking for candidates with a strong background in Business Analysis who is capable of communicating clearly with a wide variety of program and project stakeholders. The candidate should have a strong track record of career progression and be able to demonstrate a long-term interest in the Business Analysis discipline. The Senior Business Analyst will work on Quoine initiatives and will be responsible for delivering high value Business Analysis services. Quoine programs are fast paced, high profile and dynamic. The BA will work with Product and Senior Leadership within the QUOINE organization, supporting decision making with high quality functional and/or technical specifications. The BA will have a passion for the value that a BA can bring to an organization and be able to articulate and demonstrate this. Key Responsibilities Successful candidates will be responsible (dependent on experience) for the following:  Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats. Studying system capabilities; writing specifications. Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications. Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures. Define project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elements; forming project team;  Maintain user confidence and protect operations by keeping information confidential. Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Conduct and coordinate financial, product, market, operational and related research to support strategic and business planning within the various departments and programs of the client group. Interpret, evaluate and interrelate research data and develop integrated business analyses and projections for incorporation into strategic decision-making. Plan and coordinate the development of primary and secondary market research studies in support of strategic planning and specific marketing initiatives, as required and presents findings of studies to senior management. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPosition Summary  Asia Collections Technology comprises several teams who are responsible for the development of real-time systems that collect data from stock exchanges in the Asia Pacific; this data is critical to hundreds of thousands of customers around the globe. The group makes 1000+ software releases each year to support the constant changes demanded by both customers and exchanges alike. The Senior Business Analyst Position entails becoming the market logic expert for assigned feeds, gathering and documenting business requirements, participating data validation process and support their application into our production systems. Role Responsibilities  • Review, analyse, and evaluate business systems and user needs covering multiple Refinitiv’s networks and products. The primary purpose is the collection, certification, and dissemination of stock exchange and contributed data.  • Work on multiple project types: additions, mandatory day-1 changes, modifications, enhancements, and removals for the entire Asia Pacific region • Constant and proactive review of the market place through research and vendor alerts/notices from stock exchanges/contributors. Advice whether new projects are required for the company and segregate into the categories listed above. • Work directly with programmers to recommend the development or modification of computer programs, database structures, and data dictionary content.  • Gather requirements from various business segments to create product specifications for developers, and build and execute the test cases (documenting the steps) which arise from them.  • Participate in cross-departmental meetings and cross-train with other team members. Work as a team to document, track, and produce reports for all projects pertinent to the group.  • Provide regular feedback regarding changes in scope to current project list with respect to changes that may impact client organizations.  • Ability to establish successful and results-oriented working relationships with a diverse set of personalities.
requirements: Requirements• Bachelor's degree or above (Finance, MIS, or Mathematics preferred). • CFA candidate preferred. • Minimum 3-5 years of experience in Financial Service Industry or IT consulting • Exceptional requirements gathering, clarification and documentation ability • Solid knowledge of Financial products, Software Development Life Cycle and Agile delivery • High attention to detail concerning data, analysis and testing • Strong verbal and written communication skills, and decision-making abilities.  • Computer and data input skills. • Knowledge of project management and systems analysis methodologies.  • Fluent in both English and Chinese • Interest in worldwide financial markets.  • The ability to manage multiple projects with shifting priorities in a real-time environment.  • Must grasp concepts quickly. Aptitude and interest in technical concepts essential.  • Relationship management and coordination skills a plus• Testing, data validation, and evidence documentation skills • Self-motivated and the capability to work without supervision.  • A wide degree of creativity, latitude and patience is expected.  • Experience with Production systems. • Experience in a high volume, real-time transaction based environment.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities The jobholder is responsible for planning, managing and driving the development and implementation of a Whole-Of-Government (WOG) HR and Payroll (HRP) system in line with Public Service Transformation key thrusts of delivering seamlessly as One Public Service. The jobholder is required to modernise the HRP processes, as well as transform service delivery. He/ She will also be required to design HR processes that will uplift productivity and increase organisation effectiveness. This role includes include working with a large, diverse group of agencies across the Public Service, and in collaboration with other PSD clusters, to conceptualize, design and develop suitable process and policy solutions which are critical for the next generation HRP system that will support the Public Service Transformation. He will need to keep abreast of latest technologies, carry out technology scan and assess new solutions for potential application in HR domain.  Ensuring alignment to the Solutions Architecture, and system design. Identify opportunities for productivity improvements, via transforming, streamlining and continuous improvement of work processes and policies. Establish and maintain scalable processes that ensure best practices in HR. To have a keen sense on how the eventual User Experience (UX) of all stakeholders should be like, and be able to translate these UX requirements into systems solutions. Develop strategies that enable the effective deployment of innovation and productivity tools in the context of the systems used in Public Service. Translate policy intent and directions into workable IT solutions, and where necessary, propose new work processes to ensure the most effective and efficient method for implementation. Work with stakeholders and consultants to develop and implement the overall change management plan for the project and ensure a smooth transition to the new HRP System. Evaluate new technologies and add-on applications to improve and optimize HR processes.  Requirements We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service. Work Experience & Competencies In addition, an ideal candidate should possess the following:  [Operations Excellence: Managing Projects and Initiatives] Strong planning and analytical skills to leverage the use of data and research to manage milestone projects and drive initiatives. [HR System Operations] Sound understanding of HR policy practices, preferably with 3 years of work experience in managing HR operational systems. [HR Systems Development and Implementation] Good strategic thinking, planning and analytical skills to incorporate competitive HRP strategies and plans into HR systems in relation to the strategic goals of the organization. Ability to examine issues from a strategic perspective to identify opportunities/gaps, and conceptualise and implement initiatives to address these. You must also be adept at exploring issues from a user-centric perspective. Prior involvement in transformation efforts at the organisation level in either the public or private sectors. Experience in the selection and design of tools used for business process re-engineering to drive productivity and innovation.  Personal Traits  Technically capable, effective communicator, and a desire to improve processes Able to proactively develop and manage relationships with key stakeholders Strong negotiation, conflict resolution, influencing, and stakeholder management skills Organised, meticulous and able to multi-task Good team player who is able to thrive in a fast-paced environment  Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within 2 weeks after closing date.Successful candidates will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance

Strong organisational competencies, skills in managing stakeholder relationships at strategic level, project management, interpersonal and communication skills, organizational savviness, business acumen, strategic thinking, resourcefulness, creativity and networking skills.    Education Requirements:  The incumbent should possess a Degree from a reputable university.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesUnder the direction of the Head of IT (China) the role will require the successful candidate to rotate through the China IT team to experience, fully participate, and support the following roles:  IT Delivery  Programme Management Project Management Business Analyst Project Management Office (PMO)   Direct Retail IT  Retail IT Management Retail Business Analyst Retail IT Infrastructure EPOS Support   IT Infrastructure  IT Infrastructure Operations IT Networks   IT Cyber Security  Cyber Security Operations   IT Service Delivery  Service Delivery Management IT Support Analyst    And with Dyson being a global company the opportunity to work alongside international teams is guaranteed, where daily conversations with teams located in APAC and the UK are common place, and for the right candidate there will be an opportunity for a 6-month international placement to fast-track the development of one specialist area ahead of settling into that chosen role full time.
requirements: RequirementsResponsibilities:  Report directly to the Head of IT (China), demonstrating your contribution, value, and learning on all levels as you rotate through the IT functions. Manage a varied and challenging workload that delivers to the very highest standards while working to very strict deadlines that will help drive the exceptional rate of growth in Greater China for Dyson. Play a proactive role in assisting function leads in their day-to-day roles, taking responsibility for technical delivery, business or technical analysis, customer engagement, project management and co-ordination, co-ordination of vendor resource – whatever is required of the role during the rotation. Support communication and cross-team working with IT teams based in Shanghai, Hong Kong, South Korea, South-East Asia, and the UK, as well as the Dyson (China) user base in the Shanghai and Beijing office, in the repair centres, and in the direct retail stores. Seek out and adopt improvements to ways of working across all of the IT teams. Develop and maintain supporting documentation, whether project management plans, analysis reports, PMO reports, or technical diagrams or guides. Assist in the management of IT budgets, ensuring adherence to agreed levels of spend at all times and contributing to monthly reports. Travel to sites across mainland China for the purposes of reconnoitering, managing solution delivery, or crisis management as necessary.  Personal Profile:  Have a very strong and proven track record of delivering work on-time and to a very high standard. Have experience of coordinating work and projects across diverse groups. An eagerness to work and function semi-autonomously while remaining an integral part of the Dyson China IT team as well as the wider Dyson Group teams. Demonstrate the ability to build and maintain strong and mutually beneficial working relationships within and international business. Understand the importance of managing user expectations and agreeing on timely yet realistic deadlines and solutions. Be comfortable with some travel, working outside of core hours as necessary, working under pressure, and be someone that thrives on change.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesTD Enterprise Information Management Building a World-Class Technology Team at TD We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway. TD Data and Information Management covers building, developing, designing, and implementing involved with tech data management solutions. Where do we begin? These experts analyze, design, develop and support TD's info management system; lead and support bank data curation; develop data road map and info management strategies; focus on complex data integration, and drive use of our data reference model. This area doesn't work in isolation. We love data and we feel the same about integration and our assignments prove it.   TD Enterprise Information Management Residing within Enterprise Information Management (EIM), the Enterprise Information Management group is responsible for the delivery and support of technology solutions for the Corporate function unit, including distributed and centralized applications. Examples of projects and applications currently serviced by the Information Services team include the Big Data Analytics, Hadoop, ETL and Data warehouse related projects. There's room to grow in all of it.   Main Duties and Responsibilities An individual contributor responsible for performing migration from existing scheduling systems to Autosys and to provide production & system support.  The candidate must work closely with Business analyst, infrastructure support team and will be responsible for complete code life cycle.
requirements: Requirements The basic responsibility is to migrate the Hadoop Jobs from the existing scheduling system to Autosys. Be an individual contributor and part of Autosys migration project team. Must have strong knowledge in Linux, Python and Pearl Scripting Must have strong knowledge in debugging existing scripts and get to the point of failure. Must have effective verbal and written communication skills, should be able to provide project related documentations. Able to understand the time complexities and proactively work along with the Autosys migration team that sits across Singapore, India and Toronto locations Should be flexible to work in shifts. Able to understand the requirements from Business Analyst, develop the scripts, Test and promote it to all environments and bring it to BAU Ensure high quality work and maintenance of standards within own area of responsibility Work on other project support initiatives as assigned. Willingness to perform Tier 2 support activities for the enterprise wide Big Data- Hadoop Platforms   Post-secondary degree: Computer Science, Engineering or similar degree preferred 5 to 8 years of strong hands-on experience in Linux (Commands & scripts) and Python. Application support experience and aptitude for support (eventually the team will merge with L2 support) team. Batch Design:  Ability to understand data flow / batch job design and best practices     Good experience on Level 2 application support, handling batch failures and investigation Knowledge of Autosys or Control M scheduling tool   Tangible experience with information technology;     Data and systems management Hadoop administration and utilities Java, virtual environments and   Knowledge of Hadoop eco systems is an added advantage. Working experience with Source Code Repository systems and data lineage standards is essential. In addition, ability to use revision control systems such as Git Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; uses strong communication skills to communicate complex issues in easily understandable terms. Experience with orchestration workflows and high-level configuration management concepts and implementations. Understanding of networking, firewalls and load balancing.  Interpersonal Skills  Strong verbal, written, presentation & communication skills. Demonstrated ability to manage and deliver on multiple tasks on time. Demonstrated history of being self-motivated, energetic, results-driven, and executing with excellence Quick learner, ability to learn TD Change management processes and other key skills

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBeMyGuest is one of the fastest-growing travel startups in Asia. It has won multiple technology  innovation awards and was named by Fast Company as one of the world's top 50 most innovative companies in 2016. BeMyGuest helps the attractions, tours and activities operators increase their online sales through a vast distribution network made of the largest Online Travel Agents in Asia. BeMyGuest also helps these operators to automate offline sales processes with SaaS solutions tailor-made especially for Asia’s unique experiential travel ecosystem.   As a Business Operations Strategist you will spend most of your time analysing data and coming up with recommendations to increase revenue opportunities between Online Travel Agents and the Suppliers of attractions, tours and activities products.    Key Areas of Responsibility   Analyse internal and external quantitative data (pricing, consumer behaviour, market trends, competition  and etc) to identify new revenue opportunities and threats.   Analyse operational processes internal and external to identify opportunities to increase efficiency and quality of service.   Develop innovative recommendations for Online Travel Agents and Suppliers to improve sales performance and product differentiation (specific market offers, exclusive bundles, unique promotions and etc).   Liaise with internal (tech, finance, supply, distribution, customer service and other teams) and external (partners, suppliers, distributors and etc) stakeholders to ensure your recommendation/ tactics/ campaigns/  strategies are executed in a timely and successful manner.    Regular reporting to measure the success,  failure and ROI of your recommendations/ tactics/ campaigns/  strategies.
requirements: RequirementsSkills and Experience   Minimum of 5  years experience in an e-commerce, digital/ performance marketing or data analytics role. Experience working in technology startups is a plus.   A start-up attitude - ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.    Entrepreneurial mindset - roll-up-your-sleeves attitude that’s not afraid to work independently. Fearless about testing new ideas and strategies, fail fast and recover faster.   A high achiever -  forward-looking, with a focus on results over process, can do attitude!   Excellent English verbal and written communication skills. Speaking additional Asian language is a plus.   Familiar with data analytics platforms such as TableAu, Google Analytics, Adobe or others.   Familiar with monitoring and optimising Conversion Rates, ROI, Pricing.      What’s on Offer   Full-time position at an award-winning and rapidly growing startup company.   Competitive package (salary, holidays).   Travel industry benefits and perks.   Fun, multicultural office environment.    This position is based in our Singapore HQ office.   Possibility of business travel around Asia.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesLead and manage a team of Business Analysts to work collaboratively with all other IT Departments to support the Change Management for Applications related to Life or common service (e.g. Risk/compliance/ Finance) and be the key integration between users of this division and IT. This includes planning on-going production support and new development for the common service  applications. PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES  Be the subject matter expert for users and IT Technical solution manager, developers on the changes required in the applications that it integrates to and the overall IT architecture development from the business perspective Drive the implementation of  BAU/projects / enhancements with Business stakeholders, IT, vendors Manage the stakeholders from IT and business departments (across various levels) , including:   Work with users on the yearly business plan, plan in budget to support business initiatives Chair and run quarterly prioritisation meeting to share cost and planning for the quarterly enhancements Managing users for ad-hoc / urgent change requests   Manage and monitors scope change requests of key activities for enhancements related to common services Manage and monitor the timeline/risk during implementation, responsible for Functional Testing of systems before release to UAT,  support User Acceptance Test Planning & automated and manual testing Manage & monitor the BAU incidents/problems and ensure a closure within the IPM framework SLA Conduct regular checkpoint meeting with vendors, BAs, solution managers, in-house development to ensure quality delivery of application systems. Manage the budget & Spend Management for enhancements / initiatives; ensure the enhancement and maintenance costs within approved budget; and engage business units to present transparent IT costs to help drive business priorities and outcomes Work with users on the yearly business plan, planning in budget Identifying and working with key vendors to ensure enhancements and production support are delivered on target and according to SLAs. Planning and executing as the Business Analyst Manager / Lead for the various IT projects To support the strategic enhancement implementation; provide IT Business Support Lead in the business change with users for the enhancements and projects including, planning designing and implementing of Systems and applications. Responsible for planning the BAU takeover for new initiatives with project team/ Competency manager before system go live to ensure a smooth transition; to set up BAU team to take over and support when system go live To manage a team of BAs, this include task assignment and monitoring, provide coaching and mentoring, motivate staff to maximize their performance and potential, building and develop the team member’s competency and skillset to support life business or any project initiatives. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Tookitaki Tookitaki is providing machine learning-powered enterprise solutions to address regulatory compliance problems in the financial services sector. Incorporated in November 2014 in Singapore, the company is led by a core team with cumulative 30-years’ experience in finance, AI and big data analytics. Backed by institutional investors such as Jungle Ventures and Spring Seeds (a subsidiary of the Singapore Government), the company’s accolades include:  We are among the selected 21 companies which got accreditation from the government of Singapore for their stringent technology, finance and operations due diligence (www.imda.gov.sg/industry-development/programmes-and-grants/startups/accreditation-at-sgd) We won the first place in the MAS FinTech Awards (Singapore SME) in the regulatory compliance space from the Monetary Authority of Singapore for our approach to make the workflows in AML and Reconciliation scalable and highly auditable (beyond ML based black box approach) (www.mas.gov.sg/News-and-Publications/Media-Releases/2016/Ten-FinTech-companies-recognised-for-innovative-solutions-at-inaugural-FinTech-Awards.aspx) We are voted as one of the top 21 AI start-ups focusing on the financial services space by medici (www.letstalkpayments.com/medici-top-21-ai-companies/) We graduated from Nomura's corporate innovation program in November 2017 where we successfully delivered our product – Reconciliation Management Suite – in a pilot environment (https://inc42.com/buzz/nomura-voyager-fintech-accelerator-voyager-demo-day/)  In regulatory compliance, we focus on anti-money laundering and reconciliation and our products – Alerts Management Suite (AMS) and Reconciliation Management Suite (RMS) – cater to these areas, respectively. The mission or goal is to achieve 40% operational efficiency with significant savings in infrastructure and operational costs. Tookitaki's unique selling proposition (USP) is in our approach where we combine our proprietary modelling technique with our complete auditable framework to make the process dynamic and highly explainable (moving out of the black box approach). Moreover, our flexible on-premise and cloud-packaging capabilities, along with the option of easy integration to existing core-banking applications (REST API endpoints), make the solution deployment faster with lesser barrier to entry. Today, regulatory compliance processes have become more complex and fluidic, increasing the chances for rule-based models to fail. Banks need to move beyond static rule-based systems and adopt a new approach to prevent financial and reputation loss. Tookitaki bridges the gap with its innovative software products – AMS, RMS and PMS.
requirements: RequirementsRole: Business Analyst Responsibilities  Assisting the Project Manager in preparing project schedule and estimates. Assisting the Project Manager in requirements/technical gathering workshops and documenting the action items and perform necessary follow up. Noting the points of discussion/minutes of the discussion, reviewing them with the Project Manager and communicating with stakeholders Creating functional specification documents as per the project scope and reviewing with necessary stakeholders for comments and signing off. Assisting the project manager in preparing Internal Project progress reports & resource utilisation reports. Following up with internal team on the shortfall activities for status and raising concerns to the project manager as necessary. Assisting the project manager to track the project risks and mitigation actions. Assisting the project manager to prepare and track invoices. Preparing client presentations as needed and reviewing them with internal stakeholders. Following the change management process for change requests (CRs), preparation and monitoring. Maintaining issue logs from various testing activities & following up with internal team for status and closure. Overseeing defect management process (JIRA), preparing internal report for no. of bugs raised/fixed and following up on fixes. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Senior OFSAA Technical Business Systems Analysts role will support our Risk and Corporate Applications Systems with responsibility for eliciting, understanding and documenting business needs to determine the most optimal solution as part of a Finance Transformation program where Oracle Financial Services Analytical Applications suite (OFSAA) will be integrated into the business' processes. This individual will be an expert analytical resource focusing on highly visible, complex and critical business priorities. This position will establish and support plans for defining, delivering, enabling and supporting significant information technology components into the organization architecture. Profile Description:  Serves as the highest level business analyst expert, lending finance experience and providing leadership to complex projects across multiple business areas, multiple platforms and/or multiple locations. Work with business partners toward the successful implementation and adoption of OFSAA. Makes informed and independent technical contributions to defining business and functional requirements for enhancements and projects. Provide consulting for the practices and methods for defining detailed business requirements. Fully support a finance transformation program bringing financial expertise as well as OFSAA and financial management product experience to bear on the entire lifecycle. Define/review/validate high level business requirements prior to developing detailed business and functional requirements. Document and refine requirements to describe the business needs to a functional requirement level without presuming a technical solution. Requirements should be verifiable and testable once a solution is defined. Work in execution of product development across all teams as part of the development lifecycle. Develop or modify processes to resolve moderate to complex business issues. Work with Project and Release Management to sequence/coordinate development activities within software development environment methodologies
requirements: Requirements Leverage understanding of high level system architecture/portfolio that supports the business process, and the key process areas supported by the IT systems to provide in-depth solution and problem solving. Operate at a high technical level for all phases of IT projects; ensuring broader business implications of proposed IT solutions are considered. Identify applicable technology alternatives to given business problems; reviews new products/services using pre-established evaluation criteria that include architecture standards and the standards to request proposals with outside firms.  Knowledge & Experience:  Experience with Oracle Financial Services Analytical Applications suite (OFSAA) Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in a directly related field Seven+ years of professional IT experience with leadership in technical and business analysis. Financial Services / Insurance Industry experience highly desired.   Required skills:  Enterprise Testing, Quality Standards, and software product knowledge including the Oracle Financial product set, i.e., Oracle Financial Services Analytical Applications suite (OFSAA) End to end business analyst experience Strong SQL skills to query SQL databases, ability to read pseudo code. Experience with Business Intelligence, Mapping Documents, Source Data, etc.. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Experience in data integration and data quality projects Expertise in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically with Excel, Visio, Power Point, Word, and SharePoint Software development environment methodologies (i.e. Waterfall, Agile) Excellent verbal and written communication skills across diverse audiences (Functional communication to technical stakeholders, Technical communication to non-technical stakeholders)

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout CrescoData  CrescoData is an exciting cutting edge technology start-up in the Commerce space. Headquartered in Singapore, it delivers Commerce-in-the-Cloud PaaS services to enterprise customers across the globe. Reporting into the CEO this is an important role in driving growth an exciting time to join a market-leading commerce PaaS business with an exciting tech stack to spear-head global growth. The ideal candidate must have a proven track record of delivering B2B sales, building SaaS sales teams and creating repeatable predictable sales models. They have excellent communication skills, a cross-functional business understanding and a deep understanding of the commerce eco-system and the growth strategies around them. Responsibilities: Responsible for all activities that generate revenue. The CRO works closely with all functions to ensure best practices are shared with the revenue managers to ensure revenue production is maximised. Owns the following revenue channels: new business, existing customer, churn, uplift and usage and new revenue streams Sales: Owns sales targets: Actively sources and runs your own pipeline, handling the end-to-end sales process. Actively engage and on-board Enterprise businesses . Leads the sales team and responsible for hiring new members for current and future opportunities Strategies: Owns and delivers the sales strategy. Creation of strategies to drive all teams to work cohesively, optimizing each to maximize revenue and reward appropriately. Develops and refines outreach strategies. Aims to sell to the most valuable segment with a focus on generating the most revenue possible. Works closely with the CEO, Product Manager and Marketing Manager to identify and segment customer target markets and defines the product and pitch for each. Identifies and evaluates new market opportunities and implements delivery strategies: geography, customer type, reseller, channel partners Customer Success: works closely with The Customer Success Manager to drive and grow existing customer uplift and usage revenues. Identifies and grow key high value customers, drives ex CSAT and maintains   Marketing: works closely with Marketing to ensure that marketing strategy matches sales requirements. Works closely with marketing to understand and build the MQL to SQL model. Trial, evaluate and identify channels that provide the most effective and profitable means of lead generation. Ensure expenditure on marketing and advertising activities must generate revenue and be analyzed and refined to isolate the activities generate the greatest ROI and convert to the right MQL’s. Financial: works closely with the CEO and Financial Business Analyst to set revenue targets, optimize existing revenue models, review pricing strategies, create new revenue streams and identify and evaluate key high value customers and create optimal product value with specific market segments Processes: Collaboration with different functions / departments to create processes that ensure efficiency and revenue maximisation e.g. pre-sales, customer lifecycle, off-boarding Modelling + Reporting: Delivers weekly/monthly reporting, analyses sales forecasts, call volume and pipelines for overall team and individuals. Builds an understands the SQL to conversion model. Customer and pipeline database: Owns CRM tool, ensures data is clean, accessible + usable
requirements: RequirementsSkills and Qualifications: Demonstrated tech leader with a proven track record in building and growing sales teams and revenues in the SaaS enterprise space. Degree qualified with 10+ years experience and connections in the commerce space.   Outgoing: You will need to be outgoing and comfortable dealing with C-level interactions Business Acumen: Ability to measure activity effectiveness and constantly improve tactics to improve results Data driven: creates accountability by setting the right metrics and tying performance and compensation to tangible results Results driven: commits to results and takes accountability for success Communication: proven ability to communicate strategy clearly to multiple teams and areas of expertise to ensure the right business goals are met Personal Skills: We’re looking for dynamic ambitious people who want to learn and make a difference, leaders, who can think on their feet, who are not scared to use their initiative and suggest or try new things. We want people who thrive in a fast paced environment. What we can offer   Fun and dynamic workplace   Ownership and opportunity to make a difference   Flexible working environment   Health   Please send your CV and a covering letter outlining your experience and why we should pick you, to jobs@crescodata.com

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities: ·         Reports to project manager and engage in the full life cycle software development and project implementation works as assigned. This may include design, develop, integrate, test and deploy application software, and involvement in the execution of product specification, system design, development and system integration ·         Involve in requirement analysis phase to determine the implementation feasibility of functional specifications and proposed solution. Highlight requirement gaps, disproportional construction efforts, technical challenges and any other issues to business analyst team ·         Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, code comments and clear code. ·         Implement solutions by designing system specifications, standards, and programming. ·         Engage customers to explain the rationale of proposed solutions, or other technical issues ·         Coordinate and collaborate with other project team members throughout the project implementation to meet project goals ·         Engage in the maintenance and support activities, which include troubleshooting and breakfix of software application systems when required ·         Improve operations by conducting systems analysis; recommending changes in policies and procedures. ·         Ensure compliance to best practices, approved frameworks and re-useable components are employed in the development project
requirements: RequirementsPre-Requisites: ·         Minimum 4-5 years of experience with core competencies in software development using: o    Core Java and J2EE (including JSP/ Servlets) o    Web MVC (Spring MVC, Struts) o    Object/ Relational Mapping frameworks (JPA, Hibernate, etc) o    RESTful APIs and Web services o    DHTML Javascript framework (Bootstrap, JQuery, ExtJS, Angular JS, DOJO, etc) o    ANT build tool ·         Experience in the setup and configuration: o    J2EE application servers (Apache, Tomcat, Jboss, Glassfish, IBM WebSphere) o    RDMS server: MySQL, SQL Server, DB2, Oracle or similar database ·         Experience developing web-based applications, data processing systems, and enterprise integration systems ·         Experience in full SDLC (requirement, design, develop, test, validate, deploy) ·         Experience working with and developing design and architecture documents such as entity relation diagrams, use cases, swim lanes etc. ·         Must be able to work independently on the assignment – including communicating with end users, requirement, design and development ·         Should be able to translate non-functional and functional requirements into design within enterprise context ·         Ability to multi-task, perform under pressure, and be a strong team player ·         Self-motivated with a positive “can-do” attitude, passionate on problem solving and willingness in picking up new skillsets   Knowledge in the following areas will be an advantage: ·         Mobile application (iOS/ Android, Sencha framework) ·         Web 2.0 portal (Liferay, Wordpress, PHP) ·         GIS and map technology ·         SOA, ETL tools development ·         Experience in application and data migration

job_title: Business Analyst, Senior Associate, Advisory - PI-Customer
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesIn a world of dramatic and fast-paced change, the ability to retain existing customers and attract new ones is critical. As a customer advisory professional, you’ll provide clients with a strong analytical framework to transform their sales and drive sustainable growth. Joining one of our high-performing, globally integrated teams, you’ll work closely with our clients’ marketing, sales and customer service functions, helping to ensure they interact effectively with their customer base.   Through our structured learning and development program, you’ll develop the skills, knowledge and experience to help grow our clients’ businesses. And with a network that stretches across the world, you’ll gain unparalleled insight and experience from different geographies and sectors. So whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.     Your key Responsibilities    Interact with business users/Product Owner and understand business processes and requirements Perform requirements analysis and solution design on product backlog items Collaborate closely with developers as part of an agile development team Perform functional testing and coordinate acceptance test with users    Skills & Attributes for success    Plan and conduct training to users as part of project delivery Provide solutions and options on operational issues encountered by end users
requirements: RequirementsTo qualify for the role, you must have:  Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems or related disciplines Minimum 3 years of working experience in Business Analyst or similar capacity Strong analytical, problem solving skills and attention to detail Strong written and verbal communication with emphasis on technical writing skills Basic knowledge of database query scripting (SQL) and UX/UI design concepts    Ideally, you’ll also have    Keen appreciation of client’s needs and strong interest in software delivery Knowledge of test automation will be an advantage    What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What working at EY offers  EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:    Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you      About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.   Join us in building a better working world. Apply now.

company: ASTEK SINGAPORE INNOVATION TECHNOLOGY PTE. LTD.
job_description: Roles & Responsibilities  As part of our IT development activities for our clients, and within our Delivery Center Run Services, the Senior Business Analyst is responsible of ensuring a good quality of service by supervising and making regular follow-up with Junior Business Analyst.  He/she conducts gap analysis on various functional banking domains, projects sizing, cost estimation and needs definition.  He/she contributes to project elaboration and execution through monitoring and relevant feedback on the progress, risk and challenges of the project with considerations for decisions and alerts. He/she is in charge of converting business requirements into IT solution,  handling change management, documentation and deployment.  He/she works in liaison with business stakeholders, project managers, IT teams and architects.  Analysis, development and evaluation activities: -        Ensure a good quality of service by supervising and making regular follow-up with Junior Business Analyst. -        Conduct gap analysis on various functional banking domains, projects sizing, cost estimation and needs definition. -        Understand business requirements and translate them into functional specifications. -        Support IT in  writing detailed specifications and contribute by providing workload estimates. -        Contribute in project realization and support clients throughout projects phases (testing, presentations…) -        Configure the core banking system according to specifications and perform project acceptance testing. -        Support the Project Manager to deliver the project plan and ensure deliveries are done on-time and on-budget. Communication, contact,  support activities: -        Produce and maintain settings documentation and product functional documentation. -        Support business in running User Acceptance Tests. -        Analyze incidents during pre and post implementation phases and support in defect correction. -        Use functional knowledges to propose long term solution. -        Provide 2nd level support to business users. -        Interact with other Business Analysts for transversal projects.
requirements: Requirements At least 4 years’ experience in business analyst role, ideally in Private Banking sector Banking and business analysis expertise, specifically in concerned business domain Solid knowledge of Private Banking and banking processes Project management knowledge Aptitude for team management Business analysis expertise Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) awareness Usual desktop and presentation tools Strong ability to analyze and solve problems Strong appetite for nonstop learning Good communication, writing and synthesis skills Versatility, flexibility and resistance to stress Dynamic, proactive, sense of initiative, autonomous Rigor and precision Interpersonal skills (interaction with clients and internal stakeholders) Adaptability in an ecosystem of various profile

Provide functional & technical expertise to business users, including prioritizing & validating business demands & initiatives, qualifying the requests, conducting impact assessment for requested enhancements by highlighting cross-departments dependencies as well as limitations, and propose end-to-end solutions prior to a project creation and leading to a project creation and kick-off.
