job_title: IT Business Process Consultant  /  Business Analyst
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesMavericks Consulting is a powerhouse of skilled IT professionals who love their craft. We solve complex business problems by applying agile software development practices and produce simple working solutions.   Mavericks collaborates closely with clients to achieve their business goals.  We provide consultancy advice, develop prototypes to experiment and validate ideas quickly.  We develop robust and reliable operational systems within weeks, not months.  We love to write code and we build systems that put smiles on the faces of our delighted users. We believe in sharing our knowledge, upskilling and growing with the tech community. We organise workshops and bootcamps to learn from each other. We share and have fun together in our continuous learning journey. We are looking for like-minded Mavericks to join us and multiply the fun and awesomeness at our workplace. To give a brief idea of what we expect from a potential Maverick : Your Role and Responsibilities  Understand the client’s story and formulate the necessary roadmaps and solutions that will support their business strategies and goals.  Be instrumental in the analysis, design and building of critical and complex custom-designed, business applications that use a wide range of the very latest technologies  Running inceptions and workshops with stakeholders of different levels of seniority or backgrounds  Collaborating with Senior and Executive Management to drive strategy  Orchestrate the collaboration between Product Owners, Stakeholders and technical experts by removing roadblocks and fostering communication  Manage and resolve conflict wherever necessary  Gathering business requirements, writing user stories, mapping out processes, pairing with various technical experts where necessary  Advocating for best coding and project delivery practices and standards  Participate in a culture of continuous learning within the team! Share knowledge of current and emerging technologies and products with the rest of the team
requirements: RequirementsProfessional Experience  A minimum of 4 years as a Business Analyst Managed at least one large-scale project and taken large scale truly Agile projects to production Acted like advisors to strategic personnel on the client side Run Requirement Gathering Workshops using game-storming techniques Experience with modeling business processes using a variety of tools and techniques Experience prioritising competing demands from stakeholders with ability to get buy-in and resolve conflicts Experience in mentoring and executing Agile, Lean, and Continuous Delivery best practices Experience with multiple agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban, Safe, XP, etc.) Experience with multiple agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban, Safe, XP, etc.) Experience with multiple agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban, Safe, XP, etc.) Experience with multiple agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban, Safe, XP, etc.) Battle scars from Agile enablement gigs :)  Personal Skills  Have an open and positive attitude, with a key focus on achieving Win-Win solutions Team leadership and management An understanding of traditional and modern development approaches, and the ability to compare and contrast benefits of each approach Able to work well in complicated client environments Able to articulate and communicate with clients on both technical and non-technical issues Ability to debate and discuss contradictory opinions and be flexible in your thinking Able to help clients make and arrive at key business solutions Willingness to jump into projects and situations with ambiguous details in multiple domains Able to build a strong network circle, establishing and maintaining good client relations

job_title: Wealth Management – Business Analyst – Assistant Vice President
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWealth Management With client assets of around EUR 300 billion (as at September 30, 2017), Deutsche Bank’s Wealth Management business is one of the largest asset managers worldwide. We offer affluent clients a broad range of traditional and alternative investment solutions, as well as comprehensive advice on all aspects of Wealth Management. As a trusted partner of wealthy individuals and entrepreneurs, family offices and foundations. We create lasting value for clients. We develop bespoke solutions for our clients around the world, for instance wealth planning across successive generations and international borders, asset management with individual risk management, loans and deposits. All this is possible thanks to our global network, our many years of experience and our close collaboration with the Corporate & Investment Bank and Deutsche Asset Management. We combine financial strength and stability with trustworthy partnership and forward-thinking in order to build sustainable and beneficial client relationships. Wealth Management Central Transformation As part of the WM Chief Operating Office structure, Wealth Management Transformation has been established to priorities, drive, and execute the Wealth Management strategic aspirations. This new global transformation function will cover discretionary and mandatory change and has been organized into three keys areas, namely: Central Transformation, Regional and product team and, the Global Change Practices. The WM Transformation function will drive sustainable change and organizational effectiveness through a one team approach, supported by the aggregation of “practice” expertise, regional empowerment and a strong central governance team. The team ensures prioritization of resources and implementation of best practice to ensure successful execution of our agenda to Protect, Transform and grow our business. The Role & Responsibilities  Manage and track change portfolio for WM APAC, working with business sponsors, partners and stakeholders to ensure alignment with business agenda and priorities. Create and administer central framework for change management with clear and agreed processes for delivering projects and change across the entire project lifecycle. Taking ownership for all items assigned, managing the delivery across the full project lifecycle including any interdependencies. Managing the communication and relationship with all the stakeholders and escalation of risk and issues to Program Management / STC as structured Key Responsibilities:  Managing the full delivery of change items within your area of focus. Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis to lead and develop detailed requirements and translate them into functional and non-functional specifications Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high level information into details, abstract up low level information to a general understanding and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs. All with the goal of providing input to the business and technical specifications are aligned to ensure the requirements are met. Analyze processes, root causes, business impacts, and identify opportunities for improvement. Think outside the box, always consider business need, and be prepared to challenge the stakeholders. Prepare and document clear and concise Project plans / project artifacts and ensure clear business requirements that can easily be tracked and understood. Accountable for the delivery across the full SDLC through to UAT and Business Readiness. Accountable for the process impact to relevant user teams and ensure any process changes are documents and fully understood/agreed by all parties. Managing both the dependencies and the interfaces between projects. Identifying risks and escalation to Program Management / Stakeholders Organize user acceptance testing, support and follow-up investigation of questions, issues, and defects Prepare training and guidance to support the transition to run-the-bank Ensure compliance with policies, standards and regulatory requirement Provide updates to the Business and Project Management on new and on-going projects
requirements: RequirementsExperience:  Strong interpersonal and communication skills. The ability to find ways of solving or pre-empting problems. Excellent verbal and written English and ability to tailor communication to various audiences. Experience in managing and working with delivery vendors. Proven experience of delivery of change projects within Wealth Management. Working knowledge and experience with Avaloq is a plus. Must be a team player; able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and meet competing/changing deadlines. Proficiency with MS Office Products: Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.  Desired Qualifications and Skills:  5 years’ work experience within financial services (internships/full-time) with an in-depth understanding of Capital Markets Trading & Operations, Finance, Regulatory Reporting, Product Control etc. Experience in regulatory reporting for at least one of the following MAS, HKMA, ESMA, CFTC, MiFID I&II, Dodd-Frank, FATCA, EMIR, Volcker Rules, MiFid I&II, BREXIT AG entity setup etc.   Experience analysing and breaking down problems and information using structured frameworks and methodologies Analytical thinking abilities and client facing communication skills Business focus ability Structured, organized and results oriented approach, demonstrating a high level of diligence and attention to detail and the ability to ensure high quality and consistency in the deliverables produced Ability to assess / analyze the business and financial impact of alternative options, and to make sound recommendations Strong communication skills, with the ability to use both written and oral communication to gain organizational support Strong interpersonal skills and ability to engage with senior stakeholders, and deal with potential challenge / push back Strong team player with high energy, drive and determination, and ability to manage and coach team of juniors  Deutsche Bank offers a challenging and rewarding career where your contribution is valued and rewarded. We have an inclusive and friendly working environment coupled with excellent facilities and benefits. Deutsche Bank is an equal opportunity employer who seeks to recruit and appoint the best available person for a job regardless of marital status, sex (including pregnancy), age, religion, belief, race, nationality and ethnic or national origin, colour, sexual orientation or disability. Deutsche Bank does not accept unsolicited curriculum vitae from third party vendors. To apply for this role, please go to https://dbcareers.db.com/psp/PRHCM91/EMPLOYEE/HRMS/c/HRS_HRAM.HRS_CE.GBL?Page=HRS_CE_JOB_DTL&Action=A&SiteId=3001&JobOpeningId=3190052&PostingSeq=1

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesABOUT TAIGER  Headquartered in Singapore, TAIGER is a fast-growing Artificial Intelligence (AI) company with a global footprint. Our mission is to help organizations optimize operational efficiencies by automating complex cognitive tasks. We are a market leader and the pioneer of Knowledge Work AutomationTM. The solutions we provide use natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision techniques (e.g. semantic analysis, concept-extraction, multi-language knowledge graphs, and object detection) to provide unparalleled accuracy in information extraction for industry leaders across the financial services, government sectors and more. TAIGER is recognized as a Gartner Cool Vendor. Find out more about us at www.taiger.com and www.linkedin.com/company/taiger  BUSINESS ANALYST We are building a team passionate about cutting-edge AI technology and the potential of TAIGER. You should be motivated by growth opportunities with your responsibilities expanding in scope. You can also look forward to be part of a dynamic start-up environment where your contribution matters. RESPONSIBILITIES  Lead and/or participate in the development of functional requirements and technical specifications. Analyse business and user needs, document requirements, and translation into proper system requirement specifications. Provide measurable insights and track timeline of deliverables with insightful analysis to clients or stakeholders. Collaborate with business partners to identify technology needs and ensure business requirements gathering are comprehensive and accurate. Develop and maintain a working knowledge of trends and best practices within TAIGER.
requirements: RequirementsREQUIREMENTS  At least 2 + years of business analyst experience preferred. Good to have consulting work experience. Strong experience in Agile product development methodologies - various SDLCs, including Waterfall or Agile (SCRUM, Kanban, etc) and/or Test Automation. Superior verbal and written communications skills (particularly in English, but another language is a plus!).  YOU WILL BE AT AN ADVANTAGE WITH THESE SKILLS  Passion for technology, Flexible, hands-on team attitude. Track record of delivering quality, on-time results. Ability to work effectively with clients and engineering staff. MSc, BA/BSc computer science or related discipline, or equivalent experience. Familiarity or interest in AI, Semantic Technologies, NLP and Search Engines.  In TAIGER we believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will result in a better workplace for our team and a better product for our clients. Join the growing team at TAIGER today!   *TAIGER does not engage any recruitment agencies for recruitment of talents into our company. All job applications should be submitted directly to TAIGER.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany UEN:    199700895N We are presently looking for a Temenos Triple A Plus BA for one of our banking clients in Singapore Client: A Leading bank in Asia Employment Type: Contract, Long Term (12 months Extendable)  Work Location: Alexandra Rd

Minimum 4-8 years of working experience in system delivery. Private Banking or Wealth Management domain knowledge Knowledgeable in Investment products Good understanding and experience in project management and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) are necessary. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesNetflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 140 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.   It's a great time to join our team and as Netflix grows globally, we continue to look for the best and brightest talent to scale with our rapid expansion in creating owned content.  We are the technology team at Netflix that manages the corporate ERP system along with many other financial/HR applications and tools. This position is based in the Singapore office and will report to the Manager, Finance Technology in the United States. The ideal candidate for this role is someone with a deep understanding of applications, systems and processes in the finance space. Visit our culture page and long-term view to learn more about the unique Netflix culture and opportunity to be part of our team.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Summary: Role: Business Process Analyst in Singapore Start: ASAP Duration: 6 Months Location: Singapore
requirements: RequirementsOne of our clients is looking for a Business Process Analyst, who is/are able to fulfill the following requirements:  Requirements: - With 5 Years Experience - Able to problem solve, absorb large amounts of detail and to see the big picture. - Resolve conflicting ideas and demands to provide clarity. - Works with little supervision and able to pick up new or unfamiliar concepts quickly. - Be able to work in a demanding development environment. - See opportunities to standardise practises, build knowledge transfer artefacts and perform knowledge transfer. - Be an excellent standout colleague, with the ability to influence others to achieve success - Domain Knowledge:    -> Authority on Physical and Derivative Deal Life Cycles for Oil or other commodities, including understanding of core concepts such as P&L, Exposure and MTM    -> Understanding of key commercial drivers and how market changes impact us on a wider scale - Systems Knowledge:    -> Deep understanding and experience of systems functionality core to oil trading or other physical commodities.    -> Deep understanding of the data flows between systems upstream and downstream of the Middle Office applications.    -> Experience of the full software delivery lifecycle - Good to Have Skills:    -> Deep understanding of business process, in particular relating to Commodity Risk/Product Control    -> Professional Scrum Master I (Fundamental) Assessment from scrum.org    -> Practical experience of operating in Agile development environments    -> Experience in toolsets for handling requirements, for example, JIRA, SharePoint, HP Quality Centre, Microsoft TFS, etc.  Roles and Responsibilities: - Support and deliver IT solutions for the reporting of Profit & Loss and Exposure for Oil Trading. - Diverse and multi-skilled business analysts, developers, testers and operational analysts all working together in a DevOps model, supporting global users. - Work in an Agile environment, and will be expected to engage in activities such as sprint planning, daily scrums, reviews and retrospectives. - Support the Lead Business Analyst in providing requirements elicitation, handling partner relationships, process change, testing, project delivery and service delivery. - Collaborate with our partners in Commodity Risk to analyse and prioritise our product backlog items. - Build detailed test scenarios, validating these with business change and product owners and work alongside other delivery teams on integrated changes to assess the impact of changes across our system landscape. - Serve as a trusted advisor across Global Oil, known for your deep commercial understanding of physical and derivatives trading. - Commit to the maintenance of Middle Office Technology intellectual property, and are expected to be an authority in relevant functional domains.   Please send your application to applicants@geco.asia with (JOB_000620) in Subject line and highlighting:  - Your relevant experience - Current/expected salary - Availability information - A latest MS-WORD Resume   **We regret that only short-listed applicants will be contacted.**  GECO Asia values the data privacy rights of our customers, associates, partners and prospective applicants. We have a privacy policy that governs our collection and use of personal data in place. In conjunction with the new PDPA act in Singapore, we have updated our Privacy Policy and Terms of Use to better clarify our collection and use of your personal information. The same can be found here (https://www.geco.asia/about/privacy-policy) Note: GECO Asia is a German IT Services company and provides specialist IT resources on project and permanent basis. We operate under a Comprehensive Licence offered by MOM Singapore. [GECO Asia Pte Ltd, Licence No. 07C4453] [2 Venture Drive, #10-18, Vision Exchange, Singapore 608526]

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesRoles and Responsibilities a. Work with multiple groups of business, technical stakeholders and vendors to act as the principal touch point between these groups. b. Understand current business processes and elicit business, system requirement and improvement needed to optimize business rules, workflow processes and batch jobs to ensure nimble and flexible system. c. Conduct analysis by reviewing source code and technical specifications with consideration of WINS tech stack and design principles. d. Propose TO-BE system interfaces and gain alignment with relating systems/modules. e. Document, validate, de-conflict and provide necessary impact analysis of system requirements supporting the business processes in user stories form for stakeholders’ signoff. Build narratives and acceptance criteria for the stories in all iterations of system development and manage the story backlog with stakeholders and product owner during build and test.  f. Defining interface and test specification with external systems for integration/interfacing. g. Work with vendors to interpret user stories leading to technical implementation. h. Work with vendors to develop data mapping and conversion strategy for migration of legacy data to the new system, verify and accept migrated data; i. Be the liaison between vendors and business to support testing of build system, validate automated acceptance tests, manages formal User Acceptance Testing (UAT) including tracking of defect rates and conduct system trainings. j. Support Product Owner and manage vendors to deliver product in an Agile development environment and ensuring various Agile ceremonies are conducted correctly.
requirements: RequirementsRELEVANT EXPERIENCE  Working experience in business analyst role  Working experience in managing vendors to deliver systems  Familiar with experience in AGILE development process and environments supporting continuous integration and continuous delivery  Experience in Oracle database, SQL scripting and Java programming will be an added advantage  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both verbal and written and the candidate must have experience in communicating with business users and technical development team.  Able to multi-task, take initiative and work independently with multiple stakeholders  Good analytical and writing skills  Good team player and meticulous  Passionate in championing the team to continuously improve in delivering quality software product

job_description:
Roles & ResponsibilitiesWINS PO is developing and implementing a new Work Pass Integrated Systems (WINS) using Agile software development methodology.
We invite interested applicants who are passionate about change and transformation to join WINS PO as UX Designer and take on the exciting and challenging roles of designing, developing and implementing our new WINS online service.
 
A.           Responsibilities:
As a UX Designer, you will:

Work with internal and external stakeholders and act as the principal touch point between them and the development and design team
Research and investigate user needs and processes, ideate and recommend improvement
Prepare mock-ups to communicate, test and refine concepts with stakeholders through an iterative process
Document, validate and clarify the system requirements supporting the defined business processes in user stories form
Improve usability, accessibility and interaction with the product to enhance user satisfaction.
Lead and support product show case and provide feedback to the development team
Support testing of build system, validate automated acceptance tests, manage formal User Acceptance Testing (UAT) including tracking of defect rates

 
B.           Requirements:

Have experience in Software engineering, IT and/Business/ Analysis, User Experience or Interaction Design
Have experience working with Agile development process
Good analytical, writing, communication and interpersonal skills
Be a team player and able to work in a fast paced and open environment
Have an eye for details and patterns 
Able to multi-task, take initiative and work independently with multiple stakeholders

Roles & Responsibilities- Responsible to gather, analyse and formalise user’s business requirements and processes, evaluate on feasibility of implementation and manage scope of project. - Gather, analyse and formalise user’s business requirements and processes, evaluate on feasibility of implementation and manage scope of project. - Prepare project documentation such as Requirement Specifications/Use Case Specifications etc Adhere to project scope, update requirement traceability matrix, inform and record out-of-scope issues. - Develop technical design specification and translate technical design into process/program specification. Involve in the design review session. - Make changes to configurable items, which include hardware, software, documentation, etc.  -  Participate in Coding and Code Review. - Assist in the integration testing, system testing, User Acceptance Test & implementation activities.   - Prepare user manual and operations manual, and plan & facilitate training of users and operators.  - Provide post implementation support (including production support and service requests). - Escalate and discuss critical issues such as scope creep with the relevant managers. - Conduct requirement gathering sessions. Conduct gap analysis of current business process to identify improvement opportunities.
requirements: Requirements- Typically 2-4 years IT experience - Familiar with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) - Ability to produce specifications for documentations and implementations -  Experience in IT business analysis techniques -  Degree Holder  -  Self-motivated with a positive “can-do” attitude, creative with excellent presentation, communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills including strong persuasive techniques.   Licence No: 12C6060

job_title: Senior Lean Six Sigma Business Analyst
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Standard Chartered  We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit.  It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Lean Six Sigma Business Analyst will be responsible for identifying impactful opportunities for operational improvements across end to end value streams in the organization. He/she is also responsible for building a Lean Six Sigma mindset and lead Lean Six Sigma initiatives across the organization.                                                                                             He/She is also responsible for creating an environment that promotes continuous improvement of business processes, increases efficiency, increases consistency, reduces pain points, reduce wastes in the processes and empowers team members to enhance the value of the service they provide to our stakeholders This is achieved by ensuring;  Stakeholder engagement Team Engagement Project/Program Management Benefit Realization  Responsibilities  Challenging the status quo, Thought Leadership and Lead Six Sigma Initiatives Coach and mentor teams and change leaders on Lean thinking, standard lean systems, tools, techniques, mindsets and behaviours  Enable implementation of Lean Six Sigma Initiatives across the organization Support change leaders through each phase of deployment, including the development of a process-specific plan for design, pilot, and sustain phases  Delivering change in a structured manner where all inflight deliverables are tracked, reported against, and delivered Senior Stakeholder Management, Program Management and Risk Management Able to use data to influence senior leaders and defend his/her perspective  Ensure the book of work is clearly articulated and delivered for each process work-stream Driving program / project working group meetings Adding valuable inputs into the overall scope of delivery Managing project budget where applicable Reporting project status into the program manager Coordinating workshops Benefit Realization  Key Stakeholders  Technology Services
requirements: RequirementsOur Ideal Candidate This role would require 10+ years of relevant experience in the following key capabilities:  Champion and Lead Lean Six Sigma Initiatives Extensive use of Lean Six Sigma tool and technologies Demonstrated ability to coach and train all levels of leaders  Usage of Minitab or any statistical tool MS SharePoint MS Project MS PowerPoint MS Excel  Knowledge and experience in the following areas would be a strong advantage;  Lean Six Sigma Certification (Black Belt or Master Black Belt)  The following soft skills and experience is also a strong advantage:  Experience operating at a group level of sizeable international companies, including engaging senior technology stakeholders. Experience in highly regulated environments, particularly banking/finance, with a strong awareness of security/risk principles, as well as the criticality of data control. Leadership qualities. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills: written and verbal, and being able to tailor content to both business and technical audiences. Multi-cultural awareness and sensitivity; able to interact with teams based in multiple geographies. Ability to build a strong network within Target; has the ability to leverage resources and relationships to get things done Passionate about leading process improvement and applying lean techniques in different environments to deliver greater value to the guest   Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.  How to Apply Click here ( https://scb.taleo.net/careersection/jobdetail.ftl?job=1900008096&lang=en ) to apply now and take the next step in fulfilling your potential You can search and view current opportunities across our organization and apply immediately by visiting www.standardchartered.com and selecting Careers. To help speed up your application, please note the following:  You will need to log in (or register if you are visiting our careers site for the first time) before you can apply for a specific role Some roles may require you to undertake an online talent assessment in addition to completing the application form (to facilitate this process it is preferable that you provide us with an email address as part of your contact information) We will ask you about your education, career history and skills and experience, it may be helpful to have this information at hand when completing your application  It usually takes 15 - 20 minutes to complete the application form; you can save your application at any time and return to complete it at your convenience. Diversity & Inclusion Standard Chartered is committed to diversity and inclusion. We believe that a work environment which embraces diversity will enable us to get the best out of the broadest spectrum of people to sustain strong business performance and competitive advantage. By building an inclusive culture, each employee can develop a sense of belonging, and have the opportunity to maximize their personal potential.

job_title: Internet of Things (IoT) Business Development Analyst (Thai Speaking)
industry: Events / Promotions , Information Technology, Professional Services, Sales / Retail , Telecommunications
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesIndustry Platform Pte. Ltd. Is a Singapore incorporated firm specialising in business matching via global, industry specific conferences. The firm places a strong emphasis on the production of quality content for our events. With strong networks in the energy & telecommunications space, we provide the best platforms for industry insiders to network and keep abreast of developments In South East Asia, Asia IoT Business Platform offers the region's most comprehensive event for solution providers targeting enterprise adoption Internet of Things Technologies. 25 editions of Asia IoT Business Platform have been held in various locations around South East Asia with over 6,000 participants involved till date. In 2019, Asia IoT Business Platform will be hosting our series of conferences in Malaysia, Thailand, Indonesia, Philippines, Vietnam and Myanmar. Reporting to the Managing director of the firm, the Internet of Things - Business Development Analyst is a role that will focus on business development activities for our Internet of Things Conference.  A confident team player, the IoT business development Anaylst should also be an independent project manager, demonstrating resourcefulness and attention to detail.  Responsibilities: •    Engage Global IoT stakeholders to drive Sponsorship and Delegate Sales for the Conference •    Manage Global IoT Stakeholders post conference •    Take the lead, working with editorial colleagues and the Conference Producer, on realising the potential of social media to drive awareness our events, and generate sales/sales leads. •    Other responsibilities as assigned.

job_title: AVP,  QA Lead, Middle Office Technology, Technology and Operations
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout DBS   DBS is the World’s Best Digital Bank. We put digital priorities at the heart of banking, designing and creating products and services to help our customers. Digital innovation pervades every part of the bank, from our consumer banking arm to corporate banking arm. With a strong culture of innovation, experimenting with new technology and collaboration with the FinTech community, we aim to simplify banking so we can help others Live More, Bank Less.   The Opportunity   We’re looking for technologists across varying levels all over the world to be part of a major transformation programme to reimagine banking.    Based in Singapore, you’ll be leveraging the latest technology to develop mission critical applications from scratch. You’ll design, develop, test and deploy new applications as part of the strategic transformation programme, using Agile, cloud technologies, microservices and Big Data.   Business Function     Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.       Responsibilities     Support Test Manager to oversee respective SG Finance and Risk applications testing activities Develop the test plan for the tasks, dependencies and participants required to mitigate the risks to system quality and obtain stakeholder support for this plan Document, implement, monitor, and enforce all processes for testing as per defined standards Lead the automation of the testing process in-sprint and during SIT using the right tool set – Licensed and Open source Responsible for developing and enriching Test Automation framework using Selenium, Junit, TestNG, Serenity, JavaScript & related technologies  Responsible for executing software Test Automation development from conceptual phase to testing phase.  Working with vendors and business analyst and End Users within organization. Responsible for mentoring junior testers/developers
requirements: Requirements 10-12 years of experience in the field of financial/banking applications testing and a broad experience in leading the testing on large complex projects/programmes as a lead or manager Strong experience in agile methodologies and TDD/BDD. Strong technical knowledge – able to code in one or two scripting language Experience in test automation and developing automation frameworks from scratch Experience automating testing in multiple technologies – Mainframe, web, Java/.Net. Experience automating through the UI, API and web services Advanced knowledge of test methodologies and approaches  Experience of using and implementing a variety of test tools, including tools for test management / planning, defect tracking, test automation, test data management Experience with Agile and Testing Tools e.g. Selenium, HPQC, UFT/QTP, OPTIM, JIRA, Confluence would be an advantage Experience working directly with and managing vendors and partners Pro-active, independent, resourceful and able to work in a team Experience of Finance and Risk domain and applications required.  Familiarity with Mainframe, modern 3-tier applications & related technologies (e.g. Java/J2EE, SQL/Oracle, UNIX) Experience with VB scripting, REST and MS Excel scripting would be an advantage    Desired    A Bachelor’s degree or higher preferably in Computer Science or IT Additional experience on developing service based application Excellent analytical skills; Proficient in MS Office and able to produce board-level documentation Fluency in written and spoken English; Good communication and interpersonal skills Self-starter who sets and meets challenging personal targets; Detailed person, with a big picture outlook Understanding of current technologies employed by Tier 1 Investment Banking Institutions Must be a team player

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Risk Division acts as a guardian of the Bank's risk appetite and provides effective independent risk oversight in the areas of regulatory and risk related systems and infrastructure as well as maintaining a comprehensive bank wide risk appetite framework including market risk, credit risk, operational risk and reputational risk. We are continuously strengthening the function by attracting, developing and retaining top talent and cultivating continuous learning throughout the organization. You will learn how to hone your skills and apply them in a fast-paced, risk oriented environment as part of a project team or one of our many Risk functions.
requirements: RequirementsTo apply for this role, you are in your final year of an undergraduate program (graduating between December 2018 – June 2019).   Credit Suisse is noted for the diversity of its employees, but seeks colleagues with a common set of abilities – highly motivated and creative individuals who have demonstrated academic achievement, and have the ability to work independently and as a member of a team. We’ll be looking at your potential, your ability, your academic background and your extracurricular activities. We’re looking to build future leaders who add fresh and diversity perspectives to our business.   Whatever your background, you’ll need to be:  A leader who engenders dedication, assumes responsibility and mobilizes others A critical thinker with excellent analytical skills An enthusiastic self-starter who achieves significant results A supportive and adaptable team member who can build strong relationships An articulate communicator who also recognizes the importance of listening Principled and committed to the highest standards of ethical behavior

for business Business Data analysis and definition with business Co-create connected data models for customer insights, data led design, operational use and potential monetisation  ACCOUNTABILITIES business and ensure smooth delivery of the toolsets Promotes business projects and value to the IT leaders and community Develops, shares, and leverages best practices across IT Deﬁnes, prioritizes, Looks beyond the obvious (decision quality, problem solving, business acumen) Self-Management - spends time on what’s important, eliminates roadblocks, can utilise resources to get things done Encourages collaboration, is a team player Priority Setting, Planning, Maintains Organisation and Peer relationships Business Skills – translation of Business needs to Outcome Customer focus Negotiations, Conflict management and relationship building Integrity and Trust Change agent Resourceful Analytical skills to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements Facilitation skills to lead requirements elicitation workshops Organizational skills to work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information An understanding of contemporary requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, verification, and management practices and the ability to apply them in practice; familiarity with requirements engineering books and resources Property domain knowledge is a plus

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWhat you will be involved with as a Business Analyst at SG Digital:  You will be working alongside Product Managers, Development Managers, Project Managers, Software Architects and Senior Software Engineers to shape the technology and product vision of the team that will drive forward our strategic product initiatives. Opportunity to work directly with the key business stakeholders and Product Owners The candidate will be skilled in defining and creating both functional and non-functional requirements and in supervising the conversion of these into Agile user stories for use by all members of a software development team.    Additional Information Why would you enjoy working with us at SG Digital?  Competitive benefits, an open and supportive environment as well as a modern and exciting workplace The opportunity to interact with global teams on a regular basis and the possibility to switch teams and projects as you and our business continues to develop and grow Tangible and genuine development - at SG Digital, you can take your career where you want it to go! Exposure to real work, business-critical projects and the chance to develop some of the world’s leading e-commerce sportsbooks whilst working on exciting client projects and interact with lots of code!  And if that’s not enough; you will get to enjoy a great work location and flexible working whilst we provide you with the guidance and development skills you need to progress quickly and enhance your career.
requirements: RequirementsKey Accountabilities  Create business requirements and define user stories for use by SCRUM cross-functional teams. Analyse results of product solutions and report on customer acceptance. Engage with customers and product managers to define new functionality and document this in user stories. Communicate with both business and technical colleagues and customers in an appropriate manner and using a range of techniques.    Key Responsibilities  Working with customers to extract business requirements . Evaluating business problems and proposing solutions to allow customers to meet these, either through software or changes to the existing processes. Training, walk-throughs and demos of our products and development to customers and how they may be used with existing business practices - else how business practices may be modified to work with our platform. Serving as a liaison by pro-actively communicating and collaborating with customers and SG Digital development teams to evaluate solutions to customer requirements. Reconciling conflicts if necessary in an effort to achieve the optimum solution. Providing excellent verbal and written communication skills whilst interacting with a diverse group of people, internally and externally.    Qualifications & Experience  7+ years’ experience as a Business Analyst role in an online industry Leadership experience Demonstrable experience in defining and implementing comprehensive product strategies for complex IT projects working in Agile environments, with a heavy emphasis on user stories and acceptance criteria  through to production deployment, also with focus on non-functional requirements. Experience in contributing to company strategic planning or responsibility for departmental strategy. Proven communication and presentation skills. Dealing with change on a daily basis; must be comfortable both with external factors driving this change as well as internals. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Should be opinionated but also data-driven and part of the team, especially about design and implementation of products. Experience of SAFe methodology will be considered a plus Experience working with sports betting systems and operators Good working knowledge of the sports betting market and trends

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe think bigger than an agency and more creatively than a consultancy with the power to integrate the whole system. We are IBM iX 2014 and 2015 Advertising Age’s largest digital agency network in the world, leader in Gartner’s 2018 Magic Quadrant for Global Digital Marketing Agencies and rated by IDC as Leader in Digital Strategy in Asia Pacific. We are renegades and realists who blend strategy, technology and creativity to tackle every client challenge. We imagine the businesses that will shape tomorrow’s world and help our clients make them real. We uncover insights from data that others can’t see and deliver progressive ideas through the use of IBM Design Thinking. We ground every strategy with a focus on delivering the ultimate experience – for customers, for employees, for shareholders. Everything we do drives measurable impact at scale. For more information, visitibm.com/ibmix.   IBM iX is looking to hire a leadership position to lead the Design team, stationed in Singapore. We are looking for a self-motivated individual who is passionate about Digital engagement and want to learn new skills, work in multidisciplinary teams, and deliver excellent quality solutions to leading companies. The work iX delivers ranges from mobile services to Web, interactive kiosks, wearables, and digital interfaces embedded in physical environments and objects.   Job Description   As the Design Lead you sit at the top of the Design pyramid within IBM iX. You are comfortable engaging with client stakeholders, strategists, designers and technology teams to workshop and define future digital experiences. You contribute your ideas and your deep insights of human behaviour, experience design, usability, digital product, etc. with established design systems such as Apple or Google. You are comfortable in a highly agile and iterative environment where you translate business concepts into journeys, screen flows and interactions. You will be leading a team of talented UX designers, UI designers and Interaction designers and inspire them to turn ideas into engaging and intuitively usable interactive experience concepts for omni-channel digital products and services.    This role will utilize a high-level analytical ability and creativity to address ambiguous, large, complex/new problems and projects and apply IBM Design thinking to determine priority, scope and relationships of existing and proposed solutions. Candidates in this role will lead discussions and presentations for both working and delivery purposes and effectively communicate process on all engagements and have measurable successful deliveries. A significant level of customer and stakeholder interaction is required across ASEAN and will require significant travel across ASEAN.   This role requires Subject Matter Expertise (SME) in the following capabilities:    Design Thinking and human-centric problem-solving. Service Design, Design Systems, Design operation Create visually compelling representations of the solution's high-level interaction, navigation, and organization design (i.e., concept models). Develop visual representations of the organizational structure, hierarchy, and relationships of screens in a site (i.e., site maps). Develop visual representations of the interactions between the user and the functional modules in the solution. Deep knowledge surrounding customer segments and behaviors across multiple industries. Conduct and analyze C-level stakeholder interviews to understand key success factors for a project or pursuit Customer segments and behaviors across multiple industries. Leading and organizing a team of user experience and visual designers across multiple locations. Practical experience of delivery, including running multiple cross-functional squads, overseeing design processes.    The role also involves  Provide thought leadership in the creative and design field, i.e. experience design, service design, digital products, etc. Knowledge of state of the art and emerging digital design trends, and how new technologies impact these trends. Extensive travel across ASEAN region.
requirements: Requirements 7-10 years of experience in the Core banking domain. Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline Worked with Clients with consulting/relationship-driven behaviours Ability to speak fluent Japanese is required as he/she needs to work with Tokyo offices Willing and able to travel as required Experience working in a complex matrix organization Experience delivery projects using Agile methods Experience in Robotics Process Automation projects would be advantage Agile certified and any Agile/DevOps support technologies (e.g. Jira) Lean / 6 Sigma would be an advantage

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThis role is involved in the end-to-end support of application systems; from requirement analysis, design, development, to system maintenance and support.  Liaise with end users to analyse and translate business requirements to functional specifications Assist in the collection and consolidation of required information and data Prepare configuration, test specifications and conduct testing to ensure system conforms to system specifications Maintain requirement, design, test specifications, user manuals and other system documentation Provide training and support to diagnose and resolve system issues
requirements: Requirements Bachelor's degree with at least 1 to 3 years of experience in the software industry Highly developed inter-personal skills and a high degree of self-motivation and innovation, together with a high standard of personal and professional integrity Ability to work under pressure High standard of personal and professional integrity Ability to work as a team member with a capacity to work in harmony with professional personnel Preferably with hands-on implementation capability, pre-sales support in proposal writing, good writing skill Good judgment, prompt decision-making ability, responsibility and accountability. Commitment to providing a high level of service Commitment to teamwork as both a contributor and a team player

company: THE CHINA NAVIGATION COMPANY PTE. LTD.
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesRole Purpose Responsible for the cross-functional analysis of the business requirements for improving processes and systems, applications support, and implementation of business systems and enhancements in line with business direction and needs. Role Accountabilities Strategic & Planning  Provide consultancy and expertise advice on matters of Application’s architecture and integration with other systems, including their feasibility. Responsible for partnering with business representatives to understand business processes and underlying informational and/or process automation needs, then translating those needs into formal, documented business requirements following methodologies and processes. Perform cross functional analysis of the company’s operations, business and functional requirements and recommend or provide application solutions. Performs investigational analysis and evaluation to determine application feasibility. Developing project feasibility reports and discussing them with business users with regards to future implementation.  IT Operations Management  Applications operational support including issues analysis and resolution relating to supported applications and interfaces. Documenting the specifications, design, features and operation of applications to a Functional /Technical specification which is used by the applications development team for translation into actual program code. Testing and debugging application systems and perform quality control checks before releasing the system for UAT. Data migration analysis to new applications as needed. Perform research, plans and propose a solution, recommend software or hardware components to ensure that the company’s business/ operational requirements are met. Coordinate and link-up various systems within the organisation to increase compatibility and improve information access and sharing. Work with 3rd party vendors for applications support and/or changes. Involve in monthly applications server windows patch testing.  Risk Management  Plan and conduct routine audits of systems and software. Prepare and maintain documentation, including procedures, system specifications, technical documentation and user manuals Manage all applications change requests and/or enhancements to ensure timely and accurate dispositions. Ensure that IT Request procedures are established and enforced. Providing IT support for regulatory and compliance activities.  Project Management  Support the analysis of business initiatives; provide input to the development of business cases and project measurement objectives. Support the development of cost and benefit estimates to establish project worth, including the development of alternatives and recommendations for new acquisitions or changes to existing applications or equipment. Prepare feasibility studies; recommends and establishes program objectives, priorities and schedules in conjunction with user and functional requirements and conducts end-user training, as needed, for assigned applications. Works with business stakeholders and/or vendor for project acceptance tests. Managing overall coordinate of IT applications development projects from planning through implementation. Including on setting up project scope, priorities and deliverable schedules in line with the business users. Facilitating discussions and consensus among various project stakeholders.  Safety  Take responsibility for the safety of myself and those around me by displaying safety leadership principles (i.e. Safety I’s & Accountability ladder). Challenging and stopping unsafe acts and behaviours or unsafe conditions. Comply with the Global Safety Standards, Polices and Operating Procedures.
requirements: RequirementsQualifications  University Bachelor Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or related field  Technical Skills  6+ years’ experience in general infrastructure and applications administration/support 2+ years’ of solid technical skills (SQL querying, scripting, database related tasks) Strong analytical, problem solving skills and attention to detail with keen appreciation of business needs and strong interest in business processes and process re-engineering. Sound knowledge in shipping processes. Full project life­cycle experiences in business analyst role 4+ years’ Project management  Professional Skills  Good understanding of networking infrastructure and general application architecture Strong debugging and analytical skills Able to work as part of an international team with people in different time zones and cultures Able to develop and maintain good working relationship with all levels of users and vendors Able to communicate complex information clearly and concisely Able to collaborate with business personnel to manage problem resolution effectively A team player who is self-motivated and possesses good interpersonal, collaboration and organizational skills. Results driven and has a positive attitude Resourceful, meticulous, detail-oriented, accountable and discreet with sensitive / confidential information Work cross-functionally and think both critically and strategically Proficient in, or can quickly grasp applicable business processes and functions. Experience in Shipping industry

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesMain responsibilities     Deliver fully tested source code complying with quality indicators objectives  Address technical aspects with architect and functional aspects with business analyst and user representatives  Liaise with business analysts for clarification and understanding of requirements.  Analyze technical constraints considering functional impacts with technical lead’s help  Organize and keep up to date detailed technical documentation  Provide macro or detailed estimation for development of solutions  Develop tests strategy in coordination with project manager / Business Analysts  Follow the user acceptance test and coordinate the prioritization with project manager  Support applications in production - analyze and resolve issues as they arise  Perform design and code review for other team members  Mentor junior and intermediate team members
requirements: RequirementsMandatory:     4+ years of experience in web and stand-alone application design & development with Java - J2EE technologies in Unix/Linux environment.    4+ years of experience in SQL / Oracle database design & development    Experience with Spring Framework, Spring batch, Spring Boot  Experience with RabbitMQ, Message Brokers and JMS  Experience with ELK, Spark or Scala  Experience with Tomcat/Jetty or other java based application servers  Good understanding of Hibernate/JPA framework.    Experience with consuming and developing REST / SOAP Web services  Good experience with web / mobile application development using Angular, React/Vue,  HTML, Bootstrap, SASS and JQuery    Strong knowledge & experience on Git.    Test driven mindset with strong skills in Junit, Mockito and other Unit testing frameworks  Good understanding of Container technologies like Docker, Kubernetis    Technical (Nice to have)   Practical knowledge on Jenkins, Nexus, Maven/Gradle or other CI/CD tools  Experience with UI testing tools like Jasmine, Protractar  Familiarity with tools like Grunt/Bower/Gulp etc  Experience with Apache or Nginx    Other Professional Skills and Mind-set   Ability and willingness to learn and adopt new technologies  Strong organizational and communication skills  Strong analytical and problem solving skills  Awareness of various software development procedures  Ability to follow defined procedures  Understanding and respect of cultural diversity

He/She involves in systems development process, contributes to defining technical product specifications and configures and tests products and solutions. Develops documentation and guides for the use of systems. Has a thirst for knowledge and is eager to learn and solve problems within the area of systems analysis. An active team player who forms relationships and communicates with others effectively to support the delivery of optimal solutions as a team.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAPAC Division FTB BA #113615 Credit Suisse Company Overview Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking and asset management capabilities. Founded in 1856, Credit Suisse has expanded to be a global force employing over 45,000 people in 50 countries. With new leadership, a new strategy and a streamlined global organization, we are set for growth. We partner across businesses, divisions and regions to create innovative solutions to meet the needs of our clients—and to help our employees grow. It is a high priority for us to continually invest in our employees by providing ongoing opportunities for training, networking and mobility. Join us and let's shape the future of Credit Suisse together.   Further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com  We Offer…      Finance Change works across the entire CFO division to ensure that we execute the strategic design and implementation of any major changes to our processes and systems. In partnership with our key partners, we work to build ground breaking business solutions using our deep functional expertise. We aim to deliver strategic initiatives using leading project management and business analysis as we pursue our goal of protecting and improving shareholder value through optimizing the use of our financial resources.   Perform business analysis on Liquidity reporting requirements (Regulatory or Internal business driven) and impacts of changes.   Develop business and functional requirements and obtain timely sign-off by all respective parties.   Handle and actively participate in and contribute to all phases of the project lifecycle.   Work closely with the Users, line management, and IT groups throughout the various phases of the project.   Apply project management methodologies including project plans, risk mitigation, issue tracking and communication plans.   Prepare and maintain all project related status reports, chair project meetings, engage other departments and groups, as necessary, and manage all issues and risks through to resolution.   Establish strong working relationships and build partnerships with the Line and IT partners.   Participate in test planning, preparation and facilitate user testing.   Document and assist in training of end users with automated Regulatory filing.   Work closely with the Group Finance teams and related CFO Change teams, and be involved in the execution of various initiatives planned as part of the Book of Work.
requirements: RequirementsYou Offer…   You have work experience of 6 to 10 years in either the financial services industry or consulting industry.   You have demonstrated capability of executing change in a Financial Services organisation.   Your experience of working in change for Financial Accounting, Regulatory Reporting or Risk Reporting systems and processes is preferred.   You have driven change management and/or process re-engineering efforts.   You have proven business analysis skills, including business and functional specification development.   You have strong attention to detail.   Experience in Liquidity reporting will be an advantage.   Experience in Axiom tool will be an advantage.   Experience in projects driving efficiency and innovation.   Experience with MS Project, PowerPoint, Visio and Excel.   Good management, planning and organizational skills.   You have deep knowledge of Investment Banking business processes – front to back involvement in managing change.   Experience in dealing with senior management.   You have strong Project management experience.   You have strong analytical skills.   EEO statement                                                         Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

job_title: Assistant Vice President, SAP Functional Business Analyst Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS)
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesYou will be a member of the HRIS team responsible to support the implementation of SAP Human Resources Management System (HRMS), Success Factor HR modules, quarterly change requests and HR Datamart. Working with internal users and cross-functional teams, you will develop and translate business needs into functional requirements.  On a daily basis, you will be expected to be able to trouble-shoot on the SAP and SF issues reported globally. As a functional business analyst of the project team, you will also be responsible for gathering requirements, design/review solutions, stakeholders communication, training, building test plans and executing test cycles. You will partner with internal IT and/or the outsourced systems integrator throughout all project phases, and continue to support and maintain the HRMS after implementation.
requirements: Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field. Minimum of 6-10 years’ experience in HRMS implementation or SAP/SF system support. Technical expertise in Success Factor HR modules (recruitment, onboarding, LMS, JAM) and/or SAP HCM, specifically in the modules of Organization Management and Personnel Administration is a must. Additionally, expertise in the Time, Learning, Payroll and/or Recruitment, Performance Management, Succession Planning modules will be an advantage. Proven ability to elicit user requirements, define project scope and develop process documentation. Experience in (a) working closely with multi-disciplinary teams, including external consultants and vendors; and (b) developing user requirements, specifications, and guidelines. Hands-on problem-solver and multi-tasker with sound analytical and decision making skills. Strong team player with the interpersonal skills to influence and interact well with stakeholders; an effective communicator with the users and project teams to ensure project success. Ability to operate under tight schedules to meet deadlines. Contract or permanent position to be offered (Depends on experience and qualification).

industry: Consulting , Banking and Finance, Information Technology, Logistics / Supply Chain
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAre you keen to pursue a career in a dynamic start-up environment with an expanding footprint in leading various digital transformation initiatives in the transportation and supply chain industry? Invicta Pte Ltd provides an agile environment where we work directly with multinational organizations on transforming their businesses through digitization and strategies designed specifically for the future of their respective industry domains. The selected individual will stand to gain frontline first-hand experience in various digital transformation projects in the supply chain, transportation and healthcare industry. The role of the business analyst requires the individual to be lead and design business process work, business analysis and play a pivotal role in transformation projects. This position is based in Singapore and could have some travel based in client requirements. The ideal candidate should be able to think out of the box and have a high sense of urgency and drive to turn fresh ideas into feasible, profitable business solutions for the organization. Key responsibilities  Design and document As-is processes through deep understanding of the client’s business processes. Suggest and ensure clear documentation of all client’s business processes. Perform in-depth gap analysis on existing business issues through the use of big data, business analytics, Kanban methods. Provide best in class consultation advice to clients to address critical business issues and process improvements Develop and use big data/business analytics/logistics exploratory solutions based on multi-layered analytics tools to identify trends that lead to cost reduction and revenue benefits. Work independently and comfortable to derive and articulate creative out of the box business solutions to key business problems Create solutions that transform raw data into meaningful and useful information to enable team to propose effective strategic, tactical and operational insights for effective decision-making. Execute, monitor and review output of company’s strategic plans.
requirements: Requirements Minimum degree qualification from a recognized university. At least 2 to 5 years of relevant working experiences, preferably as a business analyst or a related business process related role in supply chain and/or logistics and/or healthcare industry Excellent written/verbal communication skills in English Highly competent in a business model analysis, strategic planning and project management (Kanban, Lean etc) Technical (technology) skills and other key competencies Worked with BPM and workflow automation tools and understanding of BPNL and process language Process re-engineering (actual analysis to implementation) experience Experience Working with data-driven analysis to design and implement processes AI and Machine Learning experience is a huge asset Metrics and KPI development and actual implementation Cross-industry and vertical experience Digital and omnichannel process experience MS Visio, Lucid Chart, Process and workflow automation tools, RPA solutions and tools Able to travel as per business requirement. Knowledge or exposure to start-up organizations or venture capital organizations would be an advantage. Adaptable and effective as a team player and as an individual contributor

company: THE GREAT EASTERN LIFE ASSURANCE COMPANY LIMITED
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Purpose You will facilitate the requirements and development of Adobe Experience Manager web solutions. This position is ideal for a collaborative and creative individual who facilitates the design of web solutions. The Business Analyst is an integral part of the IT team and acts as a bridge between the Digital Marketing Team and the IT Development team. The Job  Interact with end users and identify business requirements and business processes. Understand stakeholders' business needs and priorities; Relate to others concerns and objectives, & accommodate into own work priorities. Facilitate communications between the various stakeholders and collaborate with internal cross-functional teams. Translate and simplify requirements formally e.g. Business requirement documents, functional specifications and other technical writing as per project needs. Understand test cases; Create test steps and expected test results based on test cases; Execute test and document results, and assign severity levels to defects to ensure all the deliverables are as per Business needs. Handles developers’ queries, analyzing data and supporting Business user’s queries. Investigate and resolve application functionality related issues and provide support and troubleshooting for the application. Provide subject matter expertise/analysis relative to application delivery.

Alternatively, Higher Diploma in the same discipline with at least 5 years working experience in software development environment. Minimum 3 year experience as Business analysis role, ideally a programmer previously. Knowledge and experience on web and mobile application projects; Candidates with Content Management system primarily AEM will be preferred. Able to apply application SDLC, good change & problem management knowledge. Excellent interpersonal, communication and process skills, tenacious, but diplomatic. A good team player who is able to work in a fast paced multi-cultural environment. Effective understanding and hands-on experience of latest web best practices and ability to recognize how to best apply them to drive user to success. Creative and resourceful, pro-active and solution-oriented mindset. Analytical sense, with proven ability to run and analyze problems. Self-motivated, confident, energetic and positive. Confident and able to manage end users. Passionate about business processes. Ability to work hands-on with technology for feature analysis and product demonstration. Testing experience will be a big plus.

job_title: Snr Assoc, Finance Business Analyst, Middle Office Technology, Technology and Operations
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBusiness Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.   Responsibilities     Support finance regulatory reporting projects & applications as business analyst Analyse the requirements, define technical specification, designing solution and perform technical / functional testing to ensure requirements are well met Translate technical issues, verify and explain technical/architectural complexities to project stakeholders Develop specifications, diagrams, and technical mapping documentations    Work closely with Scrum Master/Project Manager/Product Owner/business users/stakeholders on project schedule, issues and escalations Work closely with development team to transforms business requirements to quality product Guide / provide inputs to development & QA team for implementation and perform system testing.
requirements: Requirements A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or equivalent experience) At least 3 years of relevant work experience in banking industry related to Finance Regulatory Reporting and Finance data warehouse. Understand AGILE methodology and have worked in AGILE development environment Solid banking functional knowledge, data analysis and SQL skills Familiar with all phases of the project lifecycle, from requirements gathering through design, development and deployment Able to develop positive stakeholder relationships, through effective engagement and communications Proactive and able to work under pressure, strong problem-solving skills and positive attitude Ability to work effectively as individual or with a team to understand and interpret requirements leading to successful technical implementation. Should be self-driven and able to work independently  Strong articulation, liaising and facilitation skills. Ability to get things done.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCommon Purpose, Uncommon Opportunity. Everyone at Visa works with one goal in mind – making sure that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid, for everyone everywhere. This is our global vision and the common purpose that unites the entire Visa team. As a global payments technology company, tech is at the heart of what we do: Our VisaNet network processes over 13,000 transactions per second for people and businesses around the world, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. We are also global advocates for financial inclusion, working with partners around the world to help those who lack access to financial services join the global economy. Visa’s sponsorships, including the Olympics and FIFA™ World Cup, celebrate teamwork, diversity, and excellence throughout the world. If you have a passion to make a difference in the lives of people around the world, Visa offers an uncommon opportunity to build a strong, thriving career. Visa is fueled by our team of talented employees who continuously raise the bar on delivering the convenience and security of digital currency to people all over the world. Join our team and find out how Visa is everywhere you want to be. Job Description Position Summary Visa Inc. is searching for an Associate Business Analyst within our Operational Excellence team. As a key member of the team, you will provide direct support to multiple function lanes in DSOE to onboard and ongoing success of the teams to support our services and clients. You will leverage your strong collaboration skills and deep understanding of working structures within DSOE to ensure new or existing services are onboard quickly and on time. Working collaboratively with the stakeholders, you will lead the initial implementation issues and seeing ongoing improvement/enhancement efforts. Responsibilities  Strong analytical skills Proficiency in Excel and ability to build Pivot Tables and Macros Comfortable with statistical analysis using Minitab Strong project, organizational, presentation and interpersonal skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex processes to a wide audience across various time zones. Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and commitments in an environment which requires multi-tasking among concurrent tasks and projects. Work with process owners and stakeholders to re-engineer processes to be simple, nimble, repeatable, measurable, achievable and continuously improved Eliminate complexity in Technology's ability to deliver IT services, while meeting service level agreements. Identify areas of improvement within the Technology processes using metrics and Six Sigma, Kaizen or similar techniques and deliver improvements in process, tools and quality of adoption. Suggest comprehensive metrics that can be actionable and promote positive behavioral changes; Baseline, improve and re-measure success. Work with the Metrics team to deliver them and use for continuous improvement Manage relationships with other process management teams to provide a consistent delivery framework Work with the requirements, documentation and training teams so processes are implemented in the tools, documented and process users trained in their use Evangelize the virtues of IT process management and create a collaborative environment Work independently to research subject matter. Interact with IT development, operations, IT quality and product management groups to obtain and exchange information. Create and maintain project plans. Represent the team in planning and review meetings with IT project cross-functional stakeholders. Communicate status of project to team members, clients and departmental management Manage the projects, work with all stakeholders to ensure deadlines are strictly adhered to. Understand Business Requirements and be able to translate them into a Business Requirements Document
requirements: RequirementsQualifications  Bachelor Degree required. Experience providing operational support Lean Green Belt Six Sigma certified is a bonus Ideal if you have direct experience in communicating to mass audience and management Strong cross functional, global collaboration skills with an ability to work across all levels Self-motivated, results oriented individual with the ability to handle numerous projects concurrently Comfortable operating in a fast paced and complex environment, with an ability to handle numerous projects concurrently. Excellent presence and experience in communicating and presenting to all levels. Ability to articulate complex technical terms or processes into business language Working knowledge of payments industry a plus but not required.
