job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe business analysis specialist has a broad and deep knowledge of customers' business environments, operations, relevant regulatory, compliance and governance frameworks as well as industry standard processes, key trends, customer segments and lines of businesses. He/ she leverage this knowledge and experience to advise on, gather and define business and system requirements and processes that best reflect customer needs, based on product capabilities and best practices. You will act as a trusted advisor to the customer; Advise on, gather and define current and future business requirements that best reflect customer needs, based on product capabilities and best practices, ensuring high business value and influencing the interconnections between the business processes, technology, data and people.     You will lead the customer to optimal solution, see the overall picture while maintaining a level of detail appropriate to the context; Leverage deep business and technology knowledge and experience, using this experience and intuition to identify requirements, assess capability gaps and propose possible solution approach and/ or new capabilities that the project, iteration or work effort should deliver.                                                You will create strong relationship with the customer IT and business stakeholder group at the most senior levels of the organization and is familiar with customer IT plans, budget and business roadmaps.                                    You will lead E2E solution domain and take full responsibility for own work; Lead the work of other internal or external BAs and users (indirectly/ matrix); May provide quality review of BAs work to ensure that the business analysis work is of sufficient quality to meet solution objectives and deliver business value; Manage requirements traceability and prioritization.                      You will collaborate with project/ line / solution manager on the planning and estimation of BA activities; Monitor BA activities, develop and manage requirements management plan; and serve as the internal business analysis expert.                                       You will be responsible for developing and managing practices and standards and IP within the unit/ organization.
requirements: RequirementsComputer Science Degree or Industrial Engineering & Management - Information System ~10 years' of experience in telecom industry and/or IT, with at least 5 years practical experience in business / system analysis, working with customer on requirement and business processes definition, in a variety of complex situations.                                     Customer-facing experience: Ability to lead and facilitate sessions, resolve conflicts and present solution using various methods (presentations, demos, business processes etc.) Wide knowledge & experience in set of products & master in E2E Business processes at least in one, if not most business domains. Wide experience in stakeholder/ client management.  Please submit application via: https://jobs.amdocs.com/job/Singapore-Business-Analysis-Specialist-04/541563000/?locale=en_US

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a Business Process Analyst at the Company, you will specialize in bringing change to organizations through the analysis, design and implementation of business processes. You will be responsible for identifying the current state of processes, eliciting information about processes, documenting process models, and facilitating workshops with stakeholder groups to design or improve business processes. While conducting process analysis you will identify impacts and linkages to the business strategies, organization and its people, data and systems, business policies and business rules. You will also be responsible for developing deployment plans to enable the successful implementation of processes to enable manufacturing capability and competitiveness.   Responsibilities and Tasks  Apply the essentials of Business Process Management; develop macro level process diagrams, process operating models, collaborate with process owner to define the purpose and vision of the process and how it relates to the process enterprise model. Develop process documentation; process flows and document overviews, context diagram, responsibility matrix, metric model and alignment. Utilize elicitation techniques to design and improve processes and project objective goals. Facilitation, communication and team collaboration working with stakeholders globally and virtually. Conduct process analysis activities and identify issues with BPM technologies. Keep existing process models in compliance and up to date.  Define improvement approach to design and facilitate business process improvements through workshops and whiteboarding sessions. Work closely with project manager and workforce development to implement process, training and change management.
requirements: RequirementsQualifications   Excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively lead and present to small and large groups. Work collaboratively with peers and senior and mid-level management.   Peer leadership and relationship management skills, Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Highly organized and ability to remain flexible to the changing business needs. Exceptional customer focus with ability to projectized and prioritize deliverables. 	  Education: Bachelors in related field of engineering, business and/or social sciences

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities Supports the company’s business operations and support. Leads projects, product implementation and support. Works with the various departments on solving system issues for clients and providing consultation for system improvements.  Project Management The Project Business Analyst provides pre/post-sales support with system demos to potential and existing clients, as well as translating requirements into executable plans for system implementation. The analyst is in charge of scheduling, strategizing and implementing the project towards completion, according to deadlines; managing tasks such as various User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and System Integration Testing, and managing internal resources as well as external vendors of the project. The project analyst is to also maintain professional and technical knowledge on the industry’s best practice and new challenge, initiating, advising and coordinating improvements or development of new applications to maintain level of competence towards industrial standard.  The Systems Business Analyst provides the deployment and application support to the project team, ensuring that all applications are ready for testing, including User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and System Integration Testing (SIT). The analyst is responsible for ensuring the project is ready for deployment and is required to ensure time line is adhered to for quality and timely delivery of the project. He/she needs to work closely with the Operations Support team to ensure all issues found are looked at and rectified in a timely manner, ensuring all Service Level Agreement (SLA) are kept to.  Product Management All Business Analysts are the bridge between understanding end-users and market requirements, which include business processes, platform, concept, technical and functional specifications, strengths and weaknesses of existing system/product; documenting and channelling the above information to the R&D team for a desired solution, conducting technical and feasibility studies and coordinating in full software development lifecycle including analysis, prototyping solutions, design, testing and documentation.
requirements: Requirements Min. Diploma At least 2 years in managing inventory or chain store application Preferably with experience in POS, F&B or Retail industry Preferably with accounting knowledge Knowledge of SQL is not mandatory for Project Business Analysts. Knowledge of SQL is mandatory for Systems Business Analysts. Good command of spoken and written English and preferably spoken Mandarin to liaise with associates. Ability to multi-task and work on tight schedules. Great teamwork spirit yet have the ability to work individually when required.  *Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOperations Operations provides support for all of Deutsche Bank’s businesses to enable them to deliver transactions and processes to clients. Our people work in established global financial centres such as London, New York, Frankfurt and Singapore, as well as specialist development and service centres in locations including Bucharest, Moscow, Pune, Dublin and Cary. We process payments in excess of a trillion euros across the bank’s platforms, support thousands of trading desks and enable millions of banking transactions, share trades and emails every day. A dynamic and diverse division, our objective is to make sure that all our services are executed in a timely and professional manner, that risk is minimised and that the client experience is positive. We are proud of the professionalism of our people, and the work they do. In return, we offer excellent career development opportunities to foster skills and talent. Group Architecture  Enterprise Architecture (EA) is key to enabling Deutsche Bank’s IT Strategy. As guardians of the firm’s Architecture Designs and Practices, members of Group Architecture are rewarded with the opportunity to work on initiatives that span strategy, digital transformation, architecture and solution delivery. With a mandate that extends to all businesses and infrastructure functions, Group Architecture uses EA as the basis on which to manage data, application, technology and business services in a consistent, re-usable framework. As part of the Group Architecture operating model, the Architecture Tooling (AT) workstream aims to design and develop solutions that meet the strategic needs of executives, strategists, architects and engineers.  Role Description As the Head of Business Analysis, you will lead a team responsible for managing the demand on Deutsche Bank’s Architecture Toolset.  Partnering with new and existing stakeholders, the successful candidate will work to clarify and document functional requirements, assess strategic fit against tooling strategies and prioritise the development roadmap. The role will require close partnership with GA resource across Germany, London and Pune. With a portfolio comprising Open Source, In-House and COTS/Vendor products, members of the tooling team are provided the opportunity to contribute toward an effective, multi-functional toolset. Working toward the delivery of the Architecture Tooling Vision, you and the business analysis team will play a lead role in qualifying demand and aligning functional requirements with the strategic capabilities of each tool.  Your contribution will be a major factor in ensuring the tooling vision becomes a reality and that our stakeholder’s needs are provided for by the right tool. A key objective will be the consolidation of existing resource globally and development of the AT Business Analysis Service – a service to be provided to the Group Architecture function as well as the federated architecture teams across the organisation.  The successful candidate will be responsible for establishing the team including role profiles, org structure and procurement of budgeted resource.  Building relationships with our engineering/development service will be key to ensure a common and consistent practise is established throughout the tooling change lifecycle.  Profession The Lead Business Analyst is responsible for guiding Business Analysts in the review and analysis of requirements from the business as well as identifying and assessing change needs.  The Lead Business Analyst supports the link between the business divisions and the solution providers for all aspects of identifying, implementing and maintaining solutions. Roles and Responsibilities:  Management of the Business Analysis capability within the Group Architecture function including operating practices, resources and associated line management Responsible for defining business requirements in partnership and collaboration with the business and obtaining sign-off Responsible for managing stakeholder demand and aligning with the programme meta model and the target functionality of the solution Ensures the creation of supporting documentation e.g. Terms of Reference, Demand Management Process, Business Requirements and Test Management Liaises with programme / project managers, clients, and other stakeholders as appropriate and acts as the business/functional counterpart to assess, agree and prioritise solution design and build Reviews business case(s) outlining cost impacts and value drivers of proposed solutions Reviews feasibility studies and estimates Responsible for defining testing requirements together with the QA & Testing Team as well as the clients Supports the design and conceptualization of new business solution options and articulates identified impacts and risks Responsible for backlog refinement, release planning and other recognised agile ceremonies Works with Business Analysis Specialists/Managers to ensure consistent implementation of processes  People Management  Actively supports the business strategy, plans and values, contributing to the achievement of a high performance culture Personally contributes in an environment where people development is the number one priority Takes ownership for own career management, seeking opportunities for continuous development of personal capability and improved performance contribution Acts as a role model for new employees, providing help and support to facilitate early integration and assimilation of their new environment Highlights performance issues within the team, where appropriate, to drive for high performance
requirements: RequirementsSkills & Qualifications:  Relevant experience in Business Analysis and Financial Services Has previous experience of working in Asia and Europe Broad knowledge of related business solutions in the marketplace Management experience and ability to lead and coach Maturity and persuasiveness to engage in business dialogue and support stakeholders Knowledge of Quality Management tools and techniques (JIRA, Confluence, Jama) Well-developed analytical and problem solving experience Ability to work in virtual teams and in matrixed organization Ability to work in fast-paced environment Excellent communication skills Fluent in English (written/verbal) Advanced knowledge in MS Office products  Deutsche Bank offers a challenging and rewarding career where your contribution is valued and rewarded. We have an inclusive and friendly working environment coupled with excellent facilities and benefits. Deutsche Bank is an equal opportunity employer who seeks to recruit and appoint the best available person for a job regardless of marital status, sex (including pregnancy), age, religion, belief, race, nationality and ethnic or national origin, colour, sexual orientation or disability. Deutsche Bank does not accept unsolicited curriculum vitae from third party vendors. To apply for this role, please go to https://dbcareers.db.com/psp/PRHCM91/EMPLOYEE/HRMS/c/HRS_HRAM.HRS_CE.GBL?Page=HRS_CE_JOB_DTL&Action=A&SiteId=3001&JobOpeningId=3189706&PostingSeq=1

job_title: Wealth Tech - Lead Business Analyst - AVP
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPrivate & Commercial Bank Deutsche Bank's newly established Private & Commercial Bank (PCB) corporate division combines the bank's expertise in private and commercial banking with Postbank in Germany and Wealth Management in one corporate division. Both in our home market of Germany and internationally, PCB offers our clients high-quality advice and a wide range of financial services from a single source. These range from comprehensive services for retail clients, to solutions for demanding clients in Private Banking and Wealth Management, to business and commercial client coverage. The distinct brands of Postbank and Wealth Management, together with Deutsche Bank’s private and business clients business, make for a strong pillar at Deutsche Bank: a modern advisory bank distinguished by its capital markets and financing expertise, its strong global network and cutting-edge digital services. Overview: The Lead Business Functional Analyst covers the whole analysis phase of a project(s) and is able to design optimal target state business processes, including aspects outside own area of responsibility to ensure target processes are designed and aligned front to back. The Lead Business Analyst is also responsible for guiding the team in the review and analysis of requirements & functional specifications, and testing / support to ensure quality of deliverables. Roles and Responsibilities:  Analyze requirements specification, plan & design solutions, support project estimates and provide planning input regarding solution engineering and development. Collect business and techno-functional requirements in collaboration with the business area as well as with interfacing applications and document these Review and validate business requirements on Core banking platform as well as any impact to upstream or downstream systems within short timelines Supports the design and conceptualisation of new business solution options and articulates identified impacts and risks. Identify potential impacts of new change on existing process through analysis and highlight any associated risks/issues. Liaising with multiple vendors involving multiple interfacing systems of the Core Banking System Participate in the creation of supporting documentation e.g. Terms of Reference Defines testing requirements including test plans, test cases, test-data and review of interface testing between different applications. Execute test cases and resolve functional issues arising from user acceptance testing. Support and co-ordinate UAT, defining (and executing) testing requirements together with the QA & Testing Team as well as the business area Ensure adherence to application and technology related architectural standards and development policies Perform data analysis to support tasks as required Providing hands-on, functional post go-live support to users Identify risks/issues and escalate to Program Management accordingly.
requirements: RequirementsExperiences and Skills:  Fluent in English (written/verbal). 8-10 years of experience in Business Analysis Experience working with business requirements through to system level functional specifications (Must have) Experience in financial domain - Wealth Management (Must have) with experience working on cross asset projects Domain Expertise in core business processes and products in the Wealth Management portfolio Good knowledge in at least 4 to 5 of the business domains - Portfolio Management, Equity, Fixed Income, Funds, FX, MM, Alternative Investments, Derivatives and Structured Products. Experience in Wealth Core banking systems - Avaloq (Preferred) / T24 / Others. Excellent presentation and communication skills with clients and colleagues Advanced analytical and problem solving experience and ability to identify issues independently, grasp new concepts, provide insights and solutions and oversee their delivery. High degree of accuracy and attention to detail. Strong planning and highly organised with ability to prioritize key deliverables across several work streams. Excellent communication and documentation / presentation skills. Self-motivated and flexibility to work autonomously coupled with ability to work in virtual teams and matrix/global organisations including appreciation of different cultures during collaborating and sharing. Advanced knowledge of methods and tooling for the Business Functional Analysis Profession. Advanced knowledge of MS Office products. Broad knowledge of related business solutions in the marketplace.  Education/Certification:  Degree from an accredited college or university Business Analysis certification (and/or relevant work experience). Avaloq Certified Professional (Desirable)  Deutsche Bank offers a challenging and rewarding career where your contribution is valued and rewarded. We have an inclusive and friendly working environment coupled with excellent facilities and benefits. Deutsche Bank is an equal opportunity employer who seeks to recruit and appoint the best available person for a job regardless of marital status, sex (including pregnancy), age, religion, belief, race, nationality and ethnic or national origin, colour, sexual orientation or disability. Deutsche Bank does not accept unsolicited curriculum vitae from third party vendors. To apply for this role, please go to https://dbcareers.db.com/psp/PRHCM91/EMPLOYEE/HRMS/c/HRS_HRAM.HRS_CE.GBL?Page=HRS_CE_JOB_DTL&Action=A&SiteId=3001&JobOpeningId=3188876&PostingSeq=1

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Title: Trading Business analyst for Chemical Product Job Description:  Business process reengineering for chemical trading industry with new solution (Trading management system SAP ERP, Work flow, RPA) evaluation and system requirement definition Description: 1.      Current Business process analysis a.       Draw down general business process of chemical trading business using trading management system and SAP ERP system b.      Interview on current business process with client’s coordinators, vendors and customers in Singapore and Japan   2.      ToBe business process design a.       Design streamlined business process based on selected system solutions such like workflow system, RPA, and SAP b.      Discuss standardization of business process with key stakeholders 3.      System requirement Definition/solution selection a.       Evaluate selected system solutions based on defined business process b.      Make system requirement for selected system solutions c.       Create a document “Request for Proposal” for system vendors d.      Evaluate system vendor’s proposals with stakeholders
requirements: Requirements Certificate in SAP sales and accounting module Certificate in IT engineering Must have experience of creation of RFP for system solution and solutions selections Must have knowledge of Business process in chemical trading business using trading management system and SAP ERP system Must have both knowledge of business process and IT solutions in order to design solutions for business issues and to define system requirement to realize the solutions Must have JPLT level 1 or business level of Japanese language to communicate with senior management, and stakeholders in Japan Must have the ability of facilitating meeting Must have the ability of logical thinking with business process reengineering

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are looking for a business analyst with experience gathering requirements with customer from different regions around the world / communicating our needs and organizing tasks to our developer team. The position requires strong analytical skills, ability to liaise with multiple parties involved in each project to define functional requirements. The position is to be filled in Singapore and may involve business trips abroad. Our technology stack uses Laravel 5 (PHP), NodeJS + hosted on an AWS environment (using multiple services to deploy and manage applications, services…).  Responsibilities:  Gathering functional requirements, developing technical specifications and liaising with the technical team for implementation / review. Plan and organize tasks for development teams considering deadlines of all projects. Build documentation of system and processes with assistance of technical teams when needed. Evaluate, test and recommend new opportunities for enhancing systems and processes. Review timelines and ensure these can be met. You will be reporting to the CTO and Project Manager of each assigned project.
requirements: Requirements 3+ years experience developing web applications / managing small teams 3+ years experience as a Business Analyst or role involving gathering requirements with customers Insurance web project experience is a plus. Solid communication skills / softskills Detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive Organized with strong time-management skills Experience in data segregation and protection (compliance) Familiar with AWS or other cloud hosting providers Experience with Laravel 5.x / NodeJS welcomed Experience in insurance related project / company would be an advantage Strong understanding of the Software design/architecture process Eager to learn new technologies and acquire new knowledge

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities Determine database structural requirements by analyzing functional specification, applications, and programming; reviewing objectives with Business Analysts and Developers Develop database solutions by designing proposed system; defining database physical structure and functional capabilities Design and deploy high availability MariaDB databases in cloud environment (Azure or AWS) Maintain database performance by identifying and resolving production and application development problems; calculating optimum values for parameters; evaluating, integrating, and installing new releases; Able to remotely diagnose functional and performance issues related to database by requesting appropriate monitoring data Work closely with Functional Technical Lead and Business Analyst to prepare and understand Column/Data mapping documents for RFCs and enhancements. Design and Model database objects in accordance with Technical Specifications and able to understand the mapping documents in order to develop the PL/SQL blocks and procedures. job_title: Local Regulatory Reporting APAC Finance Change BA / PM
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesLocal Regulatory Reporting APAC Finance Change BA/PM #119396 Credit Suisse Company Overview Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking and asset management capabilities. Founded in 1856, Credit Suisse has expanded to be a global force employing over 45,000 people in 50 countries. With new leadership, a new strategy and a streamlined global organization, we are set for growth. We partner across businesses, divisions and regions to create innovative solutions to meet the needs of our clients—and to help our employees grow. It is a high priority for us to continually invest in our employees by providing ongoing opportunities for training, networking and mobility. Join us and let's shape the future of Credit Suisse together.   Further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com  We Offer…      Finance Change works across the entire CFO division to ensure that we execute the strategic design and implementation of any major changes to our processes and systems. In partnership with our key stakeholders, we work to create cutting-edge business solutions using our deep functional expertise. We aim to deliver strategic initiatives using leading project management and business analysis as we pursue our goal of protecting and enhancing shareholder value through optimizing the use of our financial resources.  Perform business analysis on regulatory requirements and impacts of changes. Develop business and functional requirements and obtain timely sign-of by all respective parties. Manage and actively participate in and contribute to all phases of the project lifecycle. Work closely with the Users, line management, and IT groups throughout the various phases of the project. Apply project management methodologies including project plans, risk mitigation, issue tracking and communication plans. Prepare and maintain all project related status reports, chair project meetings, engage other departments and groups, as necessary, and manage all issues and risks through to resolution. Establish strong working relationships and build partnerships with the Line and IT staff. Participate in testing and facilitate user testing. Document and assist in training of end users with automated Regulatory filing. Work closely with the Group Finance teams and related CFO Change teams, and be involved in the execution of various initiatives planned as part of the Book of Work.
requirements: RequirementsYou Offer…  Work experience of  8 to 10 years in either the financial services industry or consulting industry. Demonstrated capability of executing change in a Financial Services organisation. Experience of working in change for Financial Accounting, Regulatory Reporting or Risk Reporting systems and processes preferred. Driven change management and/or process re-engineering efforts. Proven business analysis skills, including business and functional specification development. Strong attention to detail. Experience in Axiom tool will be added advantage. Experience in projects driving efficiency and innovation. Experience with MS Project, PowerPoint, Visio and Excel. Good management, planning and organizational skills. Strong knowledge of Investment Banking business processes – front to back involvement in managing change. Experience in dealing with senior management. Strong Project management experience. Strong problem solving skills.  Soft Skills:  Consulting and project delivery experience. Strong communication skills and superior attention to detail. Highly motivated with excellent interpersonal skills. Experience and confidence dealing with all levels of management. Demonstrated work ethic and possess independent self-starter quality. Proven team player with a flexible approach - Self-starter. Experience in building and managing teams.  EEO statement                                                         Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success.

job_title: AVP, Finance Analyst and Business Management Support
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBusiness Function   Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.   Responsibilities   (a) Cost Management     Track Group Infrastructure Costs and delivery of savings as committed under various initiatives. Consolidate and ensure timely and accurate cost forecasts.   Track status of initiatives, EOS in terms of schedule, budget, outcomes and benefits as outlined in the business cases. Consolidate Group TS view for initiatives, EOS. Consolidate Group TS budget and business plans.  Support transition to Platform Model in terms of cost reporting. Work closely with Finance team.        (b) Chargeback Methodology and Pricing     Support technology infrastructure cost chargeback methodology and pricing review.  Perform volume and price analysis for TS Infrastructure services. Ensure data accuracy for monthly chargeout Align cost and consumption data capture and chargeout to Platform model        (c) Workforce Strategy & Tracking    Track actual and forecast workforce across the region. Participate in project to automate workforce approvals and integrate this with workforce contract management process. Work closely with HR and Contract Mgt teams.
requirements: Requirements At least 5 years of experience preferably with exposure on technology, finance and cost management. Good interpersonal and communication skills. Able to interact with all levels of management/staff.  Hands on, detailed and meticulous with good analytical and problem solving skills with experience in presenting detailed information and numerical data in a way that is simple and easily understandable.  IT savvy, proficient in MS Excel and Power point skills.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesStarHub is seeking an innovative, insightful and results-oriented Lead Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Finance Data and Analytics team. In this role you will be working with massive amounts of data, in order to develop Machine learning and predictive analytical models to provide strategic, value-add insights to the business. Responsibilities: '• Work with Information Services to ensure end to end operational efficiency on data preparation, extraction and transformation • Drive execution of data and analytics strategy, supporting infrastructure requirement • Conduct data quality assessment & design solutions to detect and improve data quality problems, include identifying root causes & provide recommendations to address data quality issues, and implement tactical fixes such as cleaning and pruning source data to minimize disruption to data analysis/mining activities • Engage & provide support to various finance advocate teams in the design/implementation of various data visualization dashboards for various data explanatory or exploratory purposes; • Preparing data visualization presentations, to summarize the business situation/context & provide actionable business insights or recommendations • Lead the development and maintenance of Executive Dashboard for centralized reporting of key performance business statistics for Mobile, TV, Broadband and Fixed Products Businesses. • Perform proof of concepts & identify opportunities to adopt new prescriptive or predictive analytics tools & techniques in complex data environment • Design and develop models to support projects across various business verticals. • Design effective analytical approaches taking into consideration performance and scalability to large datasets, adhering to best practices for model development, and perform unit and system testing to validate the results of the analytics models. • Participate and contribute to stakeholders’ requirement gatherings sessions, co-creation workshops to size up stakeholders’ problem statements and formulate best approaches to analytic solutions and models. • Develop new analytics models and innovative techniques/algorithms to enhance capabilities in supporting finance business intelligence • Work with Finance and Business teams to conduct quantitative analysis, draw qualitative conclusions, and transform data sets into value-added information useful to the business
requirements: Requirements• Knowledgeable in different data acquisition techniques, in both traditional & new methods; appreciate the advantages & limitations of different technical solutions in meeting data analytics/visualization needs • Keen eye for opportunities for value creation with applied data science • Bachelor in Statistics/ Data Analytics/ Mathematics/ Computer Science/ Computer Engineering/ Information System and equivalent. • At least 5 years’ experience, preferably in team lead capacity in data analytics and data mining work. • Able to work with large amounts of data (facts, figures, and number crunching) to discover patterns and trends • Utilize in-depth knowledge of modern data driven methods and fuse with industry domain understanding to deliver data driven, value-add business insights • Analytical mind and business acumen with ability to look at the numbers, trends, and data and form conclusions based on findings • Transform business requirements into mathematical and statistical models for analysis and solutioning • Data Intuition: Ask the right questions – recognize what things important and what things are are not important • Proven ability to handle multiple projects concurrently • Excellent communication and presentation skills • Knowledge of R/Python and, SQL is required. Knowledge of Tableau, Microsoft Access, Power BI, Azure, Anaplan, Lava storm (or Infogix Data3Sixty), etc. will be an added advantage *We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Business Planning and Operations Analyst, Greater China
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesFacebook is seeking a Business Planning and Operations Analyst to join the APAC Global Business Planning and Operations team with a day to day focus on Greater China. The mission of the Business Planning and Operations group is to maximize business performance by being the objective, trusted partner to the sales organization – through strategic planning, cross-functional collaboration and operational excellence. We also identify and drive critical projects and strategic initiatives to support revenue growth. This is a full-time position and is located in our Singapore office.
requirements: RequirementsResponsibilities  Operating cadence / Rhythm of business - Partner with sales teams with planning and operational requests e.g. annual planning, monthly and quarterly business reviews;  ;Business partnership with Sales Leaders and key XFN partners – Support sales leadership and partner with key XFN stakeholders on operational and strategic issues to optimize resources (opex and headcount) to drive revenue growth in focused markets;  ;Business insights - Manage data pipelines and dashboards. Provide insights through revenue and product analysis. Identify key levers for driving revenue growth;  ;Strategic projects and initiatives - Translate global initiatives to regional level and help drive corporate alignment. Develop projects at regional level that have potential to scale at a global level. Drive operational excellence in the Sales organization through process improvements.  Minimum Qualifications  Bachelor's degree from a recognized institution; ;5+ years work experience in a consulting firm, investment banking or private equity firm or a similar role in a tech company;  ;Knowledge of online ad business would be a plus;  ;Demonstrated problem solving ability with experience providing practical business insights from large, complex data sets; ;Strong communications and presentation skills especially with stakeholder management; ;Strong project management and influencing skills, ability to lead and influence stakeholders at all levels of an organization; ;Ability to work independently and cross functionally (sales, finance, product marketing, business intelligence/IT, ads integrity) and manage multiple concurrent projects  ;Advanced SQL and Excel skills.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPrimary Responsibilities: 1.       Gather, analyse and formalise user’s business requirements and processes. 2.       Evaluate feasibility of implementation and manage scope of project. 3.       Prepare project documentation such as Requirement Specifications / Use Case Specifications. 4.        Adhere to project scope, update requirement traceability matrix, inform and record out-of-scope issues. 5.       Develop technical design specification and translate technical design into process/program specification. 6.       Involve in the design review session. 7.       Make changes to configurable items, which include hardware, software, documentation, etc. 8.       Participate in Coding and Code Review. 9.       Assist in the integration testing, system testing, User Acceptance Test & implementation activities.  10.   Prepare user and operations manual. 11.   Plan and facilitate training of users and operators. 12.   Provide post implementation support (including production support and service requests). 13.   Escalate and discuss critical issues such as scope creep with the relevant managers. 14.   Conduct requirement gathering sessions and gap analysis of current business process to identify improvement opportunities.
requirements: RequirementsJob Requirements: 1.      Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or any related disciplines. 2.       Efficient in development languages and tools such as: Java, Spring Framework, Javascript, AngularJS, REST API, MySQL, Bootstrap, Linux, HTML5. 3.       5 years’ experience of full project development/management life cycle. 4.       Experience conducting requirements gathering sessions, documentation of business processes, testing of internal controls and documentation of testing results. 5.       Familiar with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). 6.       Ability to produce specifications for documentations and implementations. 7.       Experience in IT business analysis techniques. 8.       Self-motivated with a positive “can-do” attitude, creative with excellent presentation, communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills including strong persuasive techniques. 9.       Innovative and flexible in technology.  10.   Effective oral and written communication skills. 11.   Knowledge/experience in public and private cloud. 12.   Ability to lead, develop and maintain respectful and trusting relationship; 13.   Proficient in written and spoken English 14.   Able to travel as required

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDevelopment role: - Identify and analyze the stakeholders involved in the requirement process; prepare and lead requirement gathering activities - Gather, analyze and formalize user business processes & requirements; verify & validate the requirements and document them into functional and non functional specifications. - Perform screen mockup and prototype to confirm requirements, understand the project scope and ensure requirements adhere to project scope. - Analyze and consider the integration between modules and interfaces with other systems. - Perform requirement traceability, identify out of scope requirements and escalate scope creep; review, identify and resolve conflicting, incomplete and inaccurate requirements. - Review requirements with stakeholders and seek timely approval, participate in negotiation of out of scope items. - Develop technical design specification and translate technical design into process/program specification     Support Role - Provide post implementation support including production support, user query and change requests. - Perform workaround and problem resolution.  - Analyze and classify issues, queries, user request and perform impact analysis. - Lead investigation of reported issues, identify root cause, implement workaround and fixes to resolve issues. - Track all reported request, issues, etc. to closure and within SLA.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesActing as a Business Coordinator and Cross-Functional Business Stream Lead on the implementation of trading system and business process solutions for our Treasury centres, your key responsibilities will encompass:   Responsibilities : • Develop the business case for proposed system, module or product implementation and oversee its review and approval by senior management until the official project kick-off.   • Analyze business requirements and requests and drive the delivery of the Requirements Specifications while ensuring that the business workflow processes (existing or target) are considered end-to-end.   • As a business stream lead, coordinate the cross-functional team members and activities for one or several business work streams while ensuring all business requirements are addressed within functional specifications and report the progress to the Project Manager accordingly.   • Ensure and accountable for user acceptance tests as per requirement deliverables including UAT test and conversion plans, test scripts.   • Provide analysis and issue resolution to all cross-functional teams throughout the solution development and implementation lifecycle.   • Responsible for process and system change management within the Global Treasury and relevant support units which include the planning of training activities for the introduction of new systems or processes as well as the delivery of the required documentation.   • Maintain a working knowledge of business processes and solution design. Perform gap analysis where known business requirements are not met.     Position : 2 year contract

Good understanding of the trade lifecycle from front to back office.   • Experience and in-depth knowledge on Murex Treasury Version 3 platform is required especially in the areas of front office and middle office functions.  Knowledge on back office modules is an advantage.    • Prior experience in a function of Business Analyst, Project Manager or Middle / Back Office Team Lead in conversion projects with a proven track record is preferred.   • Excellent communication skills, able to handle multiple projects and priorities concurrently and manage business expectations accordingly.     Position : 2 year contract

Work with development team to understand data model & prepare mapping logic Ensures completion of documentations and filings to facilitate software development. Study business requirements, evaluate and provide implementation approach/proposal

Trained in Agile Project Delivery methodology & use of one of the agile delivery method like Scrum or Kanban.  Experience in handling complex finance or risk projects is a plus

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAllegis Global Solutions is the exclusive Contingent HR services provider for one of the world’s leading banks. At Allegis Global Solutions we’re proud to be the leader in global talent solutions. We draw upon decades of industry expertise to develop innovative tools, products, processes and strategies focused on outcome. Moreover, we’re incredibly proud to have built a culture that empowers our people to make their mark while making deep connections that will last a lifetime. With our passion and culture for talent, we are truly transforming the way the World acquires talent.   Our Client is one of the world's most international banks with over 1,100 branches, offices and outlets in 67 countries. They operate in some of the world's most dynamic markets and have been for over years. More than 90 per cent of their income and profits are derived from Asia, Africa and the Middle East. Their brand promise, Here for good, underlines their distinctive approach.
requirements: Requirements  To support the Business lines with Cyber Security and Resilience, we are establishing a dedicated 1st line Information and Cyber Security (“ICS”) Centre of Excellence (“COE”). The COE will improve framework, controls, services and products and continuously improve cyber security resilience and support the Business via their Heads of ICS.   The global utility will be established as a ICS COE to maintain sustainable processes for all Business and Function ICS requirements, covering Change and Business as Usual (“BAU”) aspects. It will also be pivotal in  Sharing of best practice across the Business lines to urgently reduce risk Facing off to the Business / Function / Regional Head of ICS (“HICS”) in support of their agenda across all ICS capabilities and requirements    ICS is a top priority and this role offers the opportunity to contribute and learn in a fast paced and evolving environment.   This is a new role will report directly HICS, COE, will support the HICS community to manage the following ICS capabilities:    Reciprocal Due Diligence  Centrally coordinate the completion of inbound due diligence requests regarding ICS Maintain the standards for acceptance and completion Produce and maintain standard proforma response packs Continuously improve the content in line with the ICS TRP improvement initiatives being delivered across the bank Maintain an inventory and regularly report status of inbound due diligence requests Agree SLAs and regularly report status. Face off to Business HICS, provide regular status reporting Interface with all service providers including STS, T&I, CISO TPSA, Resilience, CISO in order to accurately and efficiently complete due diligence reports Escalate slippages accordingly   Other new / emerging ICS capabilities where applicable     Strategy    Ensure prioritisation and assisting the HICS community with oversight and remediation Identify changes required in terms of additional components, reprioritisation to anticipate and respond to changes emanating from the ICS drivers    Business    Maintain strong stakeholder engagement with CISO, STS MT, T&I MT, Risk & Compliance, and Group Internal Audit and COOs to ensure alignment across stakeholder groups Escalate appropriately to ensure necessary decisions are made in a timely manner    Processes    Drive continuous improvement across all ICS processes        Risk Management    Support the identification, assessment, monitoring, controlling and mitigation of ICS risks Adopt an anticipatory approach to risk assessment  Governance    Assist with timely and accurate reporting to appropriate risk committees    Regulatory & Business Conduct   Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group’s Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Lead the ICS COE team to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank’s Conduct Principles: Fair Outcomes for Clients; The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters.    Key Stakeholders  Global Head Operations – Cyber, Data, Privacy and Automation Global Head ICS Head ICS, COE Accountable Executive, ICS TRP Head of Investment Delivery Assurance, ICS TRP Chief Operating Officers Security Technology Services MT Technology and Innovation MT Global Head Governance & Change, CIO Chief Information Security Office Head, Operational Risk Information Security Group Operational Risk Head, Audit – Information Security & Cyber

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a Senior Business Analyst at Skyscanner, you will draw from your practical experience to produce highest quality data analysis, business insights and recommendations to be used by the business to inform decision making and guide strategy for business optimisation and growth. To do this you will work as the dedicated analytics partner within a business team using your skills to interpret large volumes of data across a wide and varied range of sources including Google Analytics, Tableau and our internal databases. What you can expect as a  Senior Business Analyst:  You are deeply numerate, passionate about discovering what the data says and have a solid business sense You will thrive in the world where data, code, analytical methods and business overlap. When you are not crunching data you are spotting trends and sharing actionable insights You excel at articulating and communicating analytical conclusions to team members and stakeholders at all levels of the business You communicate and influence using data, producing convincing business cases and recommendations to your stakeholders You pride yourself in earning the trust of your team members, stakeholders and internal customers through the consistent quality and contribution of your analysis, interpretation and guidance Upskill your colleagues enabling the wider team to be self-sufficient in performing analysis and deep dives
requirements: RequirementsExperience you can bring:  Mathematics, Economics, Business, Computer Science, Data Analytics or Data Science or similar background/degree Demonstrable track record delivering high quality analysis by distilling large and varied data sources to produce actionable business insight Using analytical tools such as SQL, Excel, Tableau, superset, etc Working effectively as contributing and guiding member of a team Ability to proactively manage and prioritise workload in a deadline driven environment with multiple internal customers Owning projects and driving for successful business outcomes based on agreed metrics/KPIs First class English written and verbal communication skills Working experience in either a business/management or analytical role Ideally, you’ll also bring the following experience, but it’s not a must have – 	 Experience of applying analytical methods/techniques to deliver reliable conclusions when faced with imperfect or incomplete data Experience of App/Web analytics and the consumer internet sector R or Python for data analysis Experience of applying statistics in a business context Creation and timely production of high quality reports and dashboards MBA or equivalent

job_title: AVP, Technology Business Analyst, Investment & Trading Technology
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's capital position, as well as "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings, is among the highest in Asia-Pacific. DBS has been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by The Banker, a member of the Financial Times group, and “Best Bank in Asia-Pacific” by Global Finance. The bank has also been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for seven consecutive years from 2009 to 2015. Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.  Responsibilities   Act as Business Analyst for the FX space within Investment & Trading Technology. Gather and validate requirements, facilitate requirements workshops to engage various stakeholders such as Front Office, Back Office, and downstream application users. Lead and manage issues during UAT/Sprints, and ensure all requirements have proper traceability. job_title: Senior Associate, Technology Business Analyst, Investment & Trading Technology
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDBS is a leading financial services group in Asia, with over 280 branches across 18 markets. Headquartered and listed in Singapore, DBS has a growing presence in the three key Asian axes of growth: Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. The bank's capital position, as well as "AA-" and "Aa1" credit ratings, is among the highest in Asia-Pacific. DBS has been recognised for its leadership in the region, having been named “Asia’s Best Bank” by The Banker, a member of the Financial Times group, and “Best Bank in Asia-Pacific” by Global Finance. The bank has also been named “Safest Bank in Asia” by Global Finance for seven consecutive years from 2009 to 2015. Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.  Responsibilities   Act as Business Analyst for the FX space within Investment & Trading Technology. Gather and validate requirements, facilitate requirements workshops to engage various stakeholders such as Front Office, Back Office, and downstream application users. Lead and manage issues during UAT/Sprints, and ensure all requirements have proper traceability. Leverage the subject matter experts in T&O in delivery of structured and well-thought through solutions. Work with the team to manage the product backlog. Become an effective “bridge” between users and technology.  Identify risks and issues early, plan mitigating steps and communicate these to stakeholders in a timely manner
requirements: Requirements At least 8 years working as a Business Analyst. Understanding and experience working on different aspects of FX Trade Cycle is a must.  Familiarity with ECN in the FX space is an advantage. Experience in large scale migration project is a strong plus. Possess strong business and technical subject matter knowledge.  Experience in writing user stories/requirement specs/ functional specs. Experience in Agile delivery will be an advantage. Must be organized, able to work with minimal supervision, flexible to switch and work on different projects and manage them in a timely manner Experience working on Jira, Confluence will be an advantage.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Technology Solutions and Innovation team within KPMG Information Technology Services is dedicated to creating and delivering value to our business by leveraging on IT technology. The team is responsible for delivering customer-focused solutions and high quality IT services internally to enable our business. In this position, you will be working with internal business and functional units. In the course of work, you will be: •       Initiating iteration zero discussions with business teams to formulate early realistic technical designs against business visions. •       Working with the business teams to elicit and gather business and functional requirements. •       Collaborating with innovation and design teams to rationalize user flows as part of system design. •       Designing, developing, and implementing software solutions to meet business requirements. •       Working with the technical lead to translate these requirements into work packages for offshore development. •       Evaluating relevant technologies and out-of-the-box solutions to meet business needs •       Leading and managing projects from initial requirements gathering to implementation phases, and transitioning into operations & maintenance. •       Prioritizing and rationalizing the implementation of functionalities in an agile environment. •       Conducting training for end users on various applications and tools. •       Enhancing existing software systems for additional functionality and features. •       Supporting users in the usage of tools, and managing new or change requests. •       Managing vendors and contracts to ensure projects are successfully delivered. •       Ensure all work is delivered to meet risk and quality compliance requirements.
requirements: Requirements•       A Degree in Computing Science/Information Systems or related areas •       A minimum of three to five years of relevant working experience •       Working knowledge and experience in Software Development Life Cycle •       Have conceptual knowledge of DevOps, if not actual working knowledge •       Strong analytical ability and project management skills •       Good interpersonal, communication, decision-making skills and a responsible attitude •       Strong in documentation, quality processes and project execution •       Knowledge and working experience with web-based technologies and common databases (MS SQL, MySQL and etc.) Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by KPMG Talent Acquisition team

Execute test cases and resolve functional issues arising from user acceptance testing. •                     Support and co-ordinate UAT, defining (and executing) testing requirements together with the QA & Testing Team as well as the business area •                     Ensure adherence to application and technology related architectural standards and development policies •                     Perform data analysis to support tasks as required •                     Providing hands-on, functional post go-live support to users •                     Identify risks/issues and escalate to Program Management accordingly.

Portfolio Management, Equity, Fixed Income, Funds, FX, MM, Alternative Investments, Derivatives and Structured Products. •                     Experience in Wealth Core banking systems - Avaloq (Preferred) / T24 / Others. •                     Excellent presentation and communication skills with clients and colleagues •                     Advanced analytical and problem solving experience and ability to identify issues independently, grasp new concepts, provide insights and solutions and oversee their delivery. •                     High degree of accuracy and attention to detail. •                     Strong planning and highly organized with ability to prioritize key deliverables across several work streams. •                     Excellent communication and documentation / presentation skills. •                     Self-motivated and flexibility to work autonomously coupled with ability to work in virtual teams and matrix/global organizations including appreciation of different cultures during collaborating and sharing. •                     Advanced knowledge of methods and tooling for the Business Functional Analysis Profession. •                     Advanced knowledge of MS Office products. •                     Broad knowledge of related business solutions in the marketplace.   Education/Certification   •                     Degree from an accredited college or university •                     Business Analysis certification (and/or relevant work experience). job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPosition Overview Are you looking for an exciting job that allows you to explore and learn?  Do you thrive in an environment where you can work on real, challenging issues? Autodesk is looking for a SAP Finance and Controlling Business systems analyst with configuration and hands on S/4 HANA experience, to support enterprise applications . We are a Digital Platforms and Experience organization building engineering platforms that integrate with our customer- facing products. Our engineering culture will empower you to make effective decisions, work collaboratively, and take accountability for engineering projects at the core of the company. Responsibilities  Works with business stakeholders to understand, interpret, and evaluate the business requirements and translate them into functional and non-functional requirements Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources and reconciles conflicts Dissects high-level information into details and can communicate details in a manner understood by relevant audiences Investigate existing programs or formulate code for new systems, identify code for procedures, prepares flowcharting, may perform configuration, tests, and roll-outs to business users and customers Tests solutions and ensures they meet business requirements and are “fit-for-purpose.” Presents and validates solutions with business partners. Creates and executes test plans Collaborate with other members of the agile team viz. Product Owner/Architect/ Developers for successful execution of the project Participates in software estimation process, such as Delphi and Agile estimation techniques Balances business requirements with technical feasibility. Recommends changes in business process, development, maintenance and system standards. Be part of the Agile team and participate in all Agile activities (standups, planning, validations, Retrospectives, etc.) Keep your ear to the ground and help us incorporate industry best practices and important developments into our products  Follow the organization’s Engineering fundamentals which includes but not limited to Continuous Integration & Continuous Delivery, Product Quality, Technical Debt Management practices, etc.    Be part of & sincere adapter of organizations cultural beliefs which includes Innovative, Accountable, Pragmatic, and Adaptable.
requirements: RequirementsMinimum Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree in Accountancy or MBA or equivalent At least 8 years’ experience in SAP FI/CO Configuration Strong subject matter expertise in SAP S/4 HANA, ECC 5.0/6.0 Knowledge of integration with SAP BW, BPC, SD, MM is desirable Understanding of Disciplined Agile Delivery (DAD) methodology and process Experience in working on Software Systems which are built using ERP/CRM and other frontend consuming technologies with middleware Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills  Preferred Qualifications  Being able to articulate and communicate in both written and oral forms to various types of audiences (developers to managers to business owners) Ability to drive things and as well work collaboratively as appropriate in a dynamic project environment Mature directness to communicate honest feedback on technology, process, and approach--putting in efforts to improve them Self-navigating learner who is eager to learn new skills Bias the action and strive to get things done as a team Action oriented.  Strong problem-solving skills and experience in both process and solution identification Exposure to cloud-based applications using platform-as-a-service providers such as Amazon Web Services or other platforms Ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a BI Analyst at Indeed, your role is to be an expert at understanding Indeed's data. We expect you to aid various teams in drawing insight from our data. This includes creating dashboards, visualizations, algorithms, and business tools for use across the organization. If you're passionate about technology, love to learn, enjoy collaborating cross-functionally, and are excited to work with massive amounts of data, this is a great opportunity to grow your skills and contribute to a top-tier web site.
requirements: RequirementsWhat you need to do this job  * Excellent oral and written communication skills, and comfortable presenting to everyone from entry-level employees to senior vice presidents * Ability to explain complicated or technical information in a simple way to non-technical audiences Sensitive to clients' needs and able to develop warm client relationships * Curiosity and passion about data and data visualization * Creativity to determine the best solution for a real-world problem with quantitative data * Experience with descriptive statistics, probability, and cleaning big datasets * Willingness to question the validity and accuracy of data * Knowledge of programming, preferably in Python, R, and/or Java * Enjoys collaborating with others in team environment * Eager to learn in a fast-paced environment  What we'd love to see (but isn't required)  * 3+ years of relevant experience in a data science, business analytics, business intelligence or comparable data engineering role, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques and technology * Knowledge of Python (particularly Pandas and Numpy) is a huge plus Understanding of advanced statistics, such as ANOVA and regression Knowledge of SQL to write complex, highly-optimized queries across large volumes of data * Knowledge of ETL and data warehouse processes

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDepartment Overview The Test Centre of Excellence is a group focused on providing QA expertise for large projects and programs within TD Securities Technology Solutions. The TCoE group is structured to leverage the follow the sun model, implement standardized QA process across projects, a maturity model and test automation. Job Overview As a SDET (Software Development Engineer in Test), you will play a key role in both the key QA specific deliverables throughout a project's lifecycle as well as contribute towards the automation tooling initiative to support accelerated test execution. You will be required to provide research, analysis, design, execution, maintenance and / or support of testing solutions that are appropriate to the application, solution and project as assigned. You will report to, and take direction from, the QA Manager. You will interact with business stakeholders, business analyst teams, development teams, and senior management. Responsibilities  Create test plans, test cases and traceability matrices based on complex business requirements documents and system design documents. Contribute to and maintain team’s automation tool set. Create and / or maintain automated test data sets as well as validate test environments. Organize and prioritize team's needs within given automation toolset to ensure execution is as effective as possible. Take an active role in all testing phases, receiving direction from the QA Manager and offering advice to the QA Manager when needed. Contribute to and maintain team’s internal knowledge base. Work with JIRA for automation deliverables, test case management, defect management, test reporting, and other functions. Participate in defect triage. Report testing progress and defect metrics to the QA Manager. Review and provide feedback on high-level automation requirements, business requirements, and testing documents.
requirements: Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent Overall 5 to 8 years of prior experience as a QA Test Analyst with 3 to 5 years in Investment Banking Domain. Experience in Behavior Driven Development, TDD approach Automation experience in Selenium Webdriver, JAVA, Maven and ANT. Experience in HPE Unified Functional Testing (UFT) or any other proprietary Test Automation Tools Experience in writing SQL (data retrieval/update/inserts) on DB2 / Oracle / MS SQL Server. Good to have, knowledge on SQL server Integration Services Packages Experience in using source code control systems GIT / Subversion Experience in implementing continuous integration using Jenkins or TeamCity Experience in working with Atlassian JIRA. Experience in working in an Agile environment. Knowledge of QA methodologies and best practices.  Education/Accreditations:    A candidate with a post graduate/graduate degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering is preferred.

job_title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY PROJECT MANAGER - ENGAGEMENT MANAGER
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout us PALO IT is an innovation & agile development company. From Design Research to DevOps, we are in the business of end-to-end development of breakthrough digital experiences. As a community of innovators and developers, we also aim at renewing the way organizations operate, promoting sustainable business agility, user-centricity and open collaboration while having fun doing it. Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices in Singapore, Australia, Thailand, Hong Kong and Mexico, we are looking for our next superstar to join our exciting team in Singapore. At PALO IT, our employees are not widgets. They are in the center of all our projects and successes. We offer an exciting and creative working environment, with endless opportunities to develop your skills, travel and take your career to the next level. Get in touch to find out more! Your profile & role on the project YOU:   Thrive on challenge. When was the last time you failed?   Are curious & always learning. What are you up to right now?   Can deal with constant change. When were you last surprised?   Have mastered at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it. What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats?    Responsible for the whole of a project, from inception through to completion and will be the team member responsible for the full delivery A hybrid of Project Manager / Business Analyst / Implementer roles that would require a very high level of flexibility to adapt to the different parties involved, from the development team to the tech leads, to the scrum master, POs, business and technology stakeholders Be able to objectively look at the constraints and pain points encountered by both our team and clients in order to steer the project into the right direction. The delivery lead should be able to shield our team in order to create the most optimal environment for them in terms of productivity (quality before quantity) but should also be able to push the team to deliver within the timelines established while still adhering to our Palo way of doing things (values and delivery model) Work hand in hand with the account manager to leverage on their knowledge and relationship with the clients to best handle the delivery objectives (on time, on budget). Work hand in hand with our business development team to ensure our clients have a deep understanding of our delivery model and that our approach is well explained / detailed in our proposals / project team structure Touch base on a regular basis with the different hive masters / tech leads at Palo to keep the deliver model / engine up to date with the best practices specific to each stream Help the different hives to adopt our delivery model by establishing the awareness and helping out with the training plans
requirements: Requirements Have a good understanding of Scrum - understand all the ceremonies, the different roles so as to be support the client and team in their constant inspection and adaptation cycles Have a good understanding of DevOps / QA / Test Automation fundamentals Have a good understanding of the development best practices Have a good understanding of the challenges a Digital / Agile transformation would mean for our clients and be able to assess at a high level their maturity

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities At least 6 years of experience in Java/J2EE application development  Solid understanding and experience in software development life cycle models, including both Waterfall and Agile (Kanban, Scrum) Collaborate and provide technical consulting to Business Analyst and Business Users to understand and address user requirements Collaborate with other IT Stakeholders to design and develop technical and integration solutions, including infrastructure, middleware and security needs
requirements: Requirements Hands-on experience in designing and developing server-side applications with at least 1 of the following languages and frameworks: NodeJS, ExpressJS, Spring Boot, Java, SQL / NoSQL, Hibernate Hands-on experience in in designing and developing front-end with at least of the following languages and frameworks: HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, ReactJS, Redux, AngularJS, jQuery, Ajax  Experience in Web Services like RESTful APIs/JSON, SOAP/XML  Experience in developing automated unit testing with JUnit

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesEnuit seeks to hire an Energy Business Analyst/Technical Consultant. As an Energy Software Consultant, you will participate as a team member or as an individual consultant on a software product implementation with our customers throughout the globe. Description of the Opportunity:  Contribute in initial product implementation, additional enhancement, and/or integration projects for Enuit clients in installing, configuring, testing and supporting such projects either onsite or remotely. Provide Entrade pre-sales support/demo and training to the client. Design business processes that match client requirements and that are easily configured in Entrade, communicate objectives, and deliver the solution in an efficient manner to the client. Resolve issues and perform troubleshooting. Communicate with client to understand desired results and assist in the design and testing of user acceptance test cases to validate project delivery. Provide system and project documentation to the client. Ensure clear communication to development, technical and support resources, and with project management to assist in managing deliverables and expectations.
requirements: Requirements Minimum of bachelor’s degree in Business, Management Information Systems, Computer Science/Engineering or related field One year’s experience or commensurate completion of college-level coursework related to database administration and design, and SQL is desirable. A self-starter with proven troubleshooting skills. Superior analytical skills with acute attention to detail. Excellent oral and written communication skills in English/Japanese. Dynamic presentation skills and the ability to train others. Ability to write and analyze SQL queries. Extensive travel may be required. Good Energy Industry Knowledge would be a plus. Native Japanese would be a plus.

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities- The RPA developer will focus on the development and testing of RPA process workflows components and solutions, ensuring quality assurance of RPA codes and maintenance of RPA code.  - Regarded as the subject matter expert in process automation development to assist our Business to achieve greater efficiency in their daily operations and optimize processes to reduce overheads and cost. - Should ideally have strong configuration experience with relevant toolsets including RPA and Machine Learning to plan and execute automation sprints - Collaborate with process owners/SMEs and technology teams on process automation opportunity identification. - Develop and implements appropriate quality control and testing procedures, troubleshooting and training of automation robots - Analyze and solve complex business problems with speed and efficiency, develop technology solutions to these problems and manage configuration project deliverables through the automation lifecycle. - Collaborating with other members to ensure configuration priorities are aligned to overall strategy and business need. - Support the creation of Process Design and Solution Design Documents - Support Business Analyst during the process assessment, process analysis and user acceptance tests.
