job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSTRATEGIC    Serve as the focal point of contact for the customer's Regional Offices, and develop & maintain strategic multi-level relationships with those responsible for the various freight and logistics functions of the customers Be the internal consultant and coordinator for all aspects of business relationship & development with the Key Accounts teams in the region Facilitate sharing of know-how about the Vertical Markets Be the regional point of liaison with the key customers on all business related matters pertaining to overall business process & implementation, including new potential business, commercial issues, scope of agreement, business improvements, & ongoing performance Manage regional account relationships with the Key Account to ensure excellent, long-term               business relationships at all levels throughout the region  Responsibility for account development and growth throughout the region, including strategy                                                        mapping, account penetration, customer relationship management and business                             improvement initiatives including:   Responsible for establishing and continuing leadership of a functional account                             management team in all the region and countries / locations, in co-operation with the VMM, GAM & local P&L’s     Regional coordination role in the annual KAM budget and development planning process     Gathering information to provide a clear orientation of the customer's value chain within the region     Identification, detailing and evaluation of business opportunities in the region     Review (regarding general feasibility) and tracking of opportunities     Co-development of strategic thrusts in the region, together with the GAM (by product,  Geography and so on)    White spot identification (matching of top-down potential and current DB Schenker turnover => "white spots") and their economic evaluation     Maintain an overview of account status in the region at all times and report as required     Strategically partner with all pertinent internal country organizations, divisions and Business Units to ensure aligned business development, and consistent service and growth     Internal communication to key DB Schenker management to ensure clarity and alignment of all resources and infrastructure     Assist in the implementation of Key Performance Indicators and benchmarks; use of these indicators to monitor and report on performance, as required    TACTICAL    Respond to complex and sensitive logistics issues and questions; create innovative and profitable solutions in tandem with specialist departments within DB Schenker   Involvement in pre-RFQ process   Assist in the provision of a schedule of forthcoming tenders     12 month forward tender planning Regular updates to be provided (minimum 4 weeks’ notice required for each RFQ launch)     Involvement in RFQ launch:  o Ensure “quick scan” is completed including business intelligence and strategic value o Assist in proving "higher" interest in case PM / BU rejects tender  Act as regional case owner for contract issues as defined in the SOP     Involvement in post-RFQ process:  o Assist post mortem analysis for all tenders (won, lost) o Support the implementation of new business won  Arrange & participate in Business Reviews with the customer and regional and country  operations and business leaders  Interact with the Key Account to proactively drive business development through regional  meetings, workshops, sales calls, and other means
requirements: RequirementsStrong leadership skills are required to establish strategy and direction, including developing a vision for future business with the account, developing strategies for producing the changes required to achieve the vision, aligning and influencing people, motivating and inspiring the account team, the internal people responsible for the success of the account, and the Key Account contacts  Exceptional relationship management & communication skills to assist with planning &  budgeting, organizing & staffing, controlling & problem-solving  Key Account Management at a regional level Strong business acumen with the ability to influence outcomes across multiple locations Leadership and people management abilities & effective communication Project management experience preferable Excellent financial and process analytical skills Ability to work effectively in a customer driven deadline environment Ability to work in a cross-functional, matrix & virtual environment

job_title: SIS - Assistant Professor of Information Systems (Education / Practice), SCPS
job_description: Roles & Responsibilities(1) Analytics      (a) Capable of designing and delivering undergraduate and master level courses in Data Analytics.            (i) For example, courses such as:                - Consumer Analytics & Applications                - Social Analytics & Applications                - Text Analytics & Applications                - Machine Learning technology & applications                - Visual Analytics & applications        (b) Deep experience in applying data analytics to real world problems in one or more industry sectors.            (i) Examples are hospitality, travel and tourism; retail, supply chain & logistics;     e-commerce; telco & Information services & health science delivery; banking & financial markets; government and public sector.         (c) Extensive hands-on experience with designing, implementing and applying data analytic solutions using leading commercial off-the-shelf enterprise software packages and/or open source software.            (i) Using commercial analytics software packages such as SAS (including Enterprise Miner), IBM Business Analytics, SPSS, Revolution R, Oracle Business Intelligence, SAP Business Intelligence.            (ii) Using open source analytics application tools            (iii) Experience with the large-scale data management tools required for analytics applications.        (d) Familiarity with state-of-the-art and emerging "next practice" trends in Data Analytics.            (i) Familiarity with the fusion of numeric and text data, or more generally, with the fusion of structured and unstructured data; increasingly real-time and on-line applications of analytics; working with continuous input streams of data; using machine learning for ongoing of assumptions, models and parameters.   (2) Information Systems and Computer Science       (a) Capable of designing and delivering undergraduate and master-level courses in Information System and/or Computer Science.             (i) Examples include:                 - Interaction Design and Prototyping                 - IT Solution Architecture                 - Enterprise Systems                 - Cloud Computing                 - Product Management                 - Software Engineering                 - Security Policy and Management          (b) Deep experience in designing, implementing and managing IT solutions in industry using custom or packaged applications.    More information on this opening can be found here: https://sis.smu.edu.sg/about/careers-opportunities/faculty-openings/education-practice systems
requirements: Requirements(1) We are continually on the lookout for outstanding faculty candidates at all levels:       - Fresh Ph.D.s       - Postdocs looking for a faculty position       - Ph.D.s who are currently in industry but want to return to faculty and research      work       - Mid-career or senior faculty   (2) Highly qualified candidates who have Master or PhD qualification can apply for a faculty position at the level of lecturer or senior lecturer. Education and Practice-Track Assistant/Associate/Full Professor appointments require a PhD degree in a closely related discipline from a well-recognised university, as well as a commensurate track record of education or practice scholarship. (Related disciplines include Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems, Statistics, Management Science, Marketing Analytics, Computational Physics, Computational Engineering or Science.)   (3) A passion for learning and teaching   (4) Posses outstanding communication skills.    Prior experience with consulting, training, or teaching is a strong advantage.   Interested applicants should submit a cover letter, curriculum vitae, research and teaching statements, contact details of 3 referees and 3 samples of published work. Please submit electronically to :    SIS Faculty Recruitment Email : siscv@smu.edu.sg

job_title: Software and Applications Developer and Analyst Nec
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs part of the Finance Systems/Applications team, this IT professional will support reporting and business intelligence requirements for Oracle ERP Fusion Cloud via finance reporting developments, enhancements and maintenance. At least 5-6 years of relevant working experience from Oracle space. Problem solver with hands-on approach and strategic thinking. Accustomed to work in a busy and dynamic start-up environment.   Description:  Systems/Applications implementation & enhancements- support team lead to coordinate all aspects of Finance and Procurement Applications projects including prioritisation, planning, management and execution of all project phases including design, development, support, deployment, support, deployment, support, deployment and effective integration of financial accounting systems. Analyze & support systems change requests to ensure the business needs are clearly understood and the technology implemented meets the needs and expectations of the business. Review finance systems administration to ensure proper corporate governance over user access profiles & matrices. Ensure that all products & services support the appropriate business processes and have the appropriate support and maintenance processes in place. Support the FP&A and Accounting teams in support of systems reports to enhance develop and measure the business processes, month end reporting package, budget and forecast reporting. Support the Regional and Country Procurement teams on matching Application's report capabilities to their day-to-day operations. Development or technical support for regional financial systems. Influence other functional areas of the business to achieve business objectives or key results.
requirements: RequirementsRequirements:   Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology / Business Information Systems 5-6 years of working experience, preferably worked with Oracle space and applications. At least one year Oracle ERP Fusion Cloud OTBI/BIP development required. ITIL knowledge / certified a plus. Active Directory knowledge (On-Prem/Cloud) preferred. BI system / SQL scripting knowledge is a plus. SQL server management knowledge and experience a plus. Excellent communication and presentation skills. Proficient in establishing working relationship with all levels of management & financial executives in the region. Enthusiastic, versatile and can-do attitude is essential. Hands-on attitude and approach. Team player. Problem solver / Result oriented. Strong communication skills & resourceful. Able to work in a fast and dynamic environment.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDubbed “The Most Innovative Streaming Video Service” by Forbes, Rakuten Viki is the world’s leading platform for Asian entertainment and lifestyle, where tens of millions of people watch their favorite TV shows, movies, and influencer videos and engage with the content. With more than a billion words translated into 200+ languages by a community of avid fans, Viki brings global entertainment to fans everywhere. Soompi, also part of Rakuten Viki, is one of the biggest global K-pop news sites and the longest-running fandom community. From innovative engagement features to original content and social shopping, Rakuten Viki and Soompi are pushing the boundaries of user engagement and social viewing. At Rakuten Viki, our Engineering teams utilize leading-edge technologies to build a world class product. You will join a diverse and talented team with great ambitions to change the digital entertainment landscape. The current team is responsible for the API and business logic modeling and is currently working on lots of exciting stuff. Some current projects include Migrating to GCP, Intelligent recommendations and Smarter Notifications. We are looking for top talent to join our Engineering team as a Senior Platform Engineer. Your primary responsibility will be tactically and strategically managing the services that power our API and business intelligence, as well as driving architecture changes to scale them. You will also work closely with the Web and Mobile teams to provide users with best experiences and CMS team for designing workflows. Essential duties and responsibilities also include managing operational workflow, mentoring juniors and empowering the team to take critical technical decisions. You need to be able to take ownership of features and systems and take them to the next level while working with stakeholders around you. If this excites and inspires you then take up the opportunity and come be a part of our Rakuten Viki team in Singapore.
requirements: RequirementsResponsibilities We don't require experience in any particular technology, but you should have the ability to chew through difficult technical problems and gain insights from them. A good foundation in understanding of practical operating system concepts around linux/unix and grasp of basic networking are essential. We are using Go/Golang, Node.js, Ruby, Python, PostgreSQL, RabbitMQ, Redis and AWS/GCP and experience with them is desirable but you could also have worked on other technologies. We believe you should have the knack for learning whatever languages and technologies come your way. Past experience in scaling systems or working with high scale systems is a must.

job_title: Data Sciences & Analytics Engineer (Data Engineering Track)
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe have multiple junior and senior data engineering positions available. The data engineer is responsible for designing and developing robust, scalable solutions for collecting and analysing large data sets in the cloud and on-premises data centres. Also in creating and maintaining data pipelines, data marts and business intelligence dashboards to be used across Singapore Airlines. Responsibilities:  Understand business processes, applications and how data is stored and gathered.  Develop and manage streaming data pipelines at enterprise scale.  Build expertise on the data. Own data quality for various data flows.  Design, build and manage data marts to satisfy our growing data needs.  Support data marts to provide intuitive analytics for internal customers.  Design and build new framework and automation tools to enable teams to consume and understand data faster.  Use your expert coding skills across a number of languages like SQL, Python and Java to support data scientists.  Interface with internal customers to understand data needs.  Collaborate with multiple teams and own the solution end-to-end.  Maintain infrastructure for our data pipelines.  Any other ad-hoc duties.  This is a sole contributor role.
requirements: Requirements BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field. MS or PhD degree is a plus.  More than 2 years of advanced Python or Java development is necessary. Scala or Kotlin experience is a plus.  More than 2 years of SQL (such as PostgreSQL, Oracle, AWS Redshift, or Hive) experience is required. NoSQL experience is a plus.  More than 2 years working with Linux OS. Knowledge of networks and cybersecurity is a plus.  Experience with modern MapReduce/workflow distributed systems, especially Apache Spark. Experience with Apache Kafka is a plus.  Experience working with infrastructure-as-code systems like AWS CloudFormation. DevOps experience is a plus.  Experience in custom ETL pipeline design, implementation and maintenance.  Experience working with visualization tools like Tableau or Apache Superset.  Ability in analyzing data to identify deliverables, gaps and inconsistencies.  Ability in managing and communicating data mart plans to internal customers.

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities“There is no love sincerer than the love of food.” - George Bernard Shaw Do you love food and convenience put together? Then you will definitely love foodpanda! foodpanda (small ‘f’) is the world’s favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it’s getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again. However, this doesn’t happen without some really awesome people. We are looking for a Software Engineer, based in our exciting Singapore office to support our growing regional Engineering team that is based in Singapore. You will be part of an international team of highly talented and motivated people. We're looking for a talented Software Engineer to join our highly skilled software development team based in Singapore, working collaboratively with the wider projects department to solve real-life problems for our restaurant partners and contact centre. We are developing a new Competitive Pricing product which extracts information from competitive sources and provides business intelligence metrics. You will be responsible for back-end development of the engine. Skills   As part of Competitive Pricing Engine team, develop and extend feature to pull prices from different sources   Experience building systems using relational and non-relational databases such as PostgreSQL or MySQL or MongoDB is plus   Experience in Python is preferred but experience with Node.js (ES6+), PHP is also relevant   Experience in web crawler and end to end testing framework is plus   Participate in technical design and planning sessions   Implement new features for the company's platform/applications   Perform code reviews, bug fixes, etc   Knowledge of using Docker or Serverless is plus   Experience in writing unit test and integration test   Flexible and open-minded personality   Excited to learn & try out new things   You firmly believe in lean and agile development (Scrum, Kanban)   Familiarity with source control using Git   A “can-do” attitude towards change and ambiguity
requirements: Requirements  At least 2 years of experience in web development or API development   Relevant engineering degree from a reputed university or relevant work experience 	    What We Offer   A dynamic and challenging working environment   An extra steep learning curve   Responsibility from day one in a fast growing and global company   A vibrant and international team with a diverse background   Regular company and team events

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSabre is a technology solutions provider to the global travel and tourism industry. It offers a broad range of technology solutions including data-driven business intelligence, mobile, distribution and Software-as-a-Service solutions which are used by travel suppliers (airlines, hotels, car rental outlets, railways, cruise lines and tour operators) and travel buyers (travel agencies, travel management companies and corporate travel departments) to plan, market, sell, serve and operate their business. In 2013, Sabre’s technology processed over $100 billion of estimated travel spending and more than 1.1 trillion system messages. Headquartered in Southlake, Texas, USA, Sabre employs approximately 10,000 people in approximately 60 countries around the world. We serve our customers through cutting-edge technology developed in six facilities located across four continents. The company operates three brands/businesses: Sabre Airline Solutions, Sabre Hospitality Solutions, and Sabre Travel Network.  Under direct supervision, responsible for developing, implementing and/or maintaining one or a combination of general accounting systems. Prepares journal entries, maintains and reconciles ledger accounts. Provides record of assets, liabilities and other financial transactions. Balances books periodically and prepares profit and loss, income and balance sheet statements. Maintains receipts and disbursement reports. May prepare federal, state, and local reports and tax returns. May interpret reports and records for managers. Assist with analysis of non-complex ledger accounts and resolve issues. Post entries to general ledger and assist with month end close process. Prepare account reconciliation. Assist with special projects as needed.
requirements: RequirementsEDUCATION:  Bachelor's degree in Accounting will be a plus.  Good Communication skills.

job_title: Associate General Manager- Digital and Analytics
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesVacancy is to lead the data stream for HCL's Digital and Analytics practice. It’s a regional role – based out of Singapore and will need the candidate to travel to our key geographies – Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines and Hong Kong. The role is to understand customer’s requirement related to data streams (right from traditional data warehouse to big data solutions encompassing facades of data science, data governance, business intelligence and analytics). It will also require candidate to draw up solutions for customer’s requirements and work with HCL’s partner ecosystem to ensure solution covers an end-to-end data proposition. For this role candidate will have to work with multiple streams within organization namely Sales, Delivery and HCL’s Center of Excellences. HCL envisages that candidate must have a strong knowhow of data related technologies and good interpersonal skills to work as productive team member.
requirements: RequirementsTechnical / Professional Skills 1. At least 14 years of collective experience in Information Management stacks ( ODI, Informatica, Talend etc) and modern data platforms (CDH,HDP, spark etc)  2. At least 4 years of experience in setting up data and analytics solution on major cloud Platforms (Azure, AWS, IBM, Oracle  etc)  3. At least 10 years of experience in Business Intelligence(IBM Cognos, OBIEE) and data Visualization (Tableau, QlikSense, PowerBI etc). 4. At least 6 years of experience in Enterprise Performance Management(Cognos TM1, Cognos Controller, CDM, Hyperion etc). 5. A proven thought-leader who delivered complex data and analytics projects across various domains BFSI, CPG, Telecom, Healthcare etc.   Non-Technical / Soft Skills 1. HCL is looking for a experienced data & insight Practitioner to develop & deliver ASEAN market strategy.  2. He/she will support defining the go to market platforms, services, offerings and capabilities to drive business value for clients.  3. He/she will provide consulting to transform clients towards modern data driven organization by leveraging cost effective solutions ~ Cloud first, hadoop data lake, Mobility etc.  4. He/she will orchestrate Client PoC's, manage RFI/RFP's and engage in customer presales activities. 5. As well as understanding and providing thought leadership on data solution strategy, best of breed technology platforms(for Big data, DW, BI, EPM, Visualization etc) as per client use cases.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur Technology Risk services are designed for the dual purpose of strengthening internal controls and, in so doing, helping to improve IT and business performance. In addition to assurance-related engagements such as financial attestation and ISAE 3402 engagements, our IT risk advisory services focus on IT governance and effectiveness; IT program management and assurance; security and controls of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) implementations; and business intelligence and information analysis.   The opportunity You will develop skills that you will value for your entire career. You will also work with tomorrow’s business leaders and gain hands on best practice experience.   Your key responsibilities As a Senior Associate within the Technology Risk team, you will participate in and supervise multiple client engagement teams and other related activities. Engagements focus on the assessment and/or evaluation of Information Technology (IT) systems and the mitigation of IT-related business risks. Engagements may be either assurance (attestation) and/or risk advisory in nature, and vary considerably in size and complexity. You will serve as a fieldwork leader to assist clients in employing proper information systems, resources, and controls to maximize efficiencies and minimize risk. You will work with client personnel to analyze, evaluate, and enhance information systems facilitating the business internal control process, and will assist clients and other Technology Risk professionals in performing information technology control and security engagements. Skills and attributes for success   Collaborate with other members of the engagement team to plan the engagement and develop work program timelines, risk assessments, and other planning documents.   Work with the engagement team to document the business processes dependent on information technology   Serve as a fieldwork leader by directing the daily progress of fieldwork, informing supervisors of engagement status, and managing staff performance   Demonstrate and apply a thorough understanding of complex information systems   Use knowledge of the current IT environment and industry IT trends to identify the engagement and client service issues, and communicate this information to the engagement team and client management through written correspondence and verbal presentations   Demonstrate and apply strong project management skills, inspire teamwork and responsibility with engagement team members, and use current technology and tools to enhance the effectiveness of deliverables and services   Manage a portfolio of assignments as project lead
requirements: RequirementsTo qualify for the role you must have  A recognized university degree in accounting, business, information technology, or other relevant discipline with 1 year of working experience Willingness to travel on overseas assignment as the need arises Significant experience in applying relevant technical knowledge in at least one of the following engagements: (a) financial statement audits; (b) internal or operational audits; (c) ISAE 3402 Attest engagements; and/or (d) ERP security and control reviews (Oracle, SAP, PeopleSoft) (e) SOX integrated audit  Project management skills Strong written and verbal communication skills and presentation skills Leadership, teamwork and client service skills Demonstrated integrity within a professional environment  Ideally, you will also have  CPA, CA, CISA, CISSP, CISM, CBCP, CIA, CIPP, CGEIT certification     What we look for Highly motivated individuals with excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to prioritize shifting workloads in a rapidly changing industry. An effective communicator, you’ll be a confident team player that collaborates with people from various teams while looking to develop your career in a dynamic organization.   What working at EY offers  EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. We are committed to being an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. Plus, we offer:  Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you    About EY As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2020 a reality.   If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Join us in building a better working world.   Apply now.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResearch Fellow National University of Singapore   Description:   The National University of Singapore invites applications for the position of Research Assistant/Fellow in the Department of Information Systems, School of Computing (SoC). SoC is strongly committed to research excellence in all its dimensions: Searching for fundamental results and insights in consumer behaviour based on online data, developing novel computational solutions to a wide range of applications, building large-scale experimental systems, developing theories and policies for effective management of information systems in organizations and improving the well being of society. We seek to play an active role both internationally and locally in the core and emerging areas of Computer Science and Information Systems.   The Research Fellow will be responsible for working closely with the Principal Investigator and lab members on one or more research projects. He/she should possess experience or interest in at least one of the following research areas:  Business Intelligence Electronic and Social Commerce Healthcare Information Systems IT-Enabled Service Innovation
requirements: Requirements A PhD degree in a relevant area; Good publication record; and Good written and verbal communication skills in English.

industry: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Description Embark on a journey of success at Republic Polytechnic. Discover a people- and family-oriented culture, where every person is transformed towards greater heights. Here, you can achieve the best version of yourself and nurture future generations. If you are passionate and qualified, we welcome you to apply! You will be part of our HR family to support recruitment and employer branding for RP’s organisation needs and will be involved in:  Developing and implementing recruitment strategies (sourcing, assessment, selection and on-boarding) Interpreting and conducting benchmarking to ensure the total rewards strategy is aligned with organisation’s employee value proposition to drive high organisation performance and promote retention Establishing and articulating RP’s unique identity by developing ongoing communication/engagement plans to ensure that employees and other stakeholders experience the organisation as an employer of choice   You may also be assigned other duties, which include:  Involvement in HR digitalisation and HR analytics projects to improve operational efficiency Contract tracking and renewals of staff Procurement of goods and services relating to recruitment and branding    Requirements  At least 5 years of experience in HR preferred. Must be IT-savvy, preferably familiar with HR Enterprise systems (e.g. SAP, Peoplesoft, etc) Must be social media savvy and have a creative flair and with good designing skills Advanced Photoshop skills and video editing skills would be an advantage. Strong communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong working relationships at all levels. Resourceful, with proven problem-solving, analytical and influencing skills. Proven ability to multi-task, with strong planning and organising skills. job_title: Associate Director, Business Intelligence and Investigations
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesKroll’s Business Intelligence and Investigations (“BII”) practice is world-renowned for our trusted experts, global resources, local insight, and actionable results. As the originator of the modern, independent internal investigation, over our 45-year history Kroll has conducted thousands of investigations worldwide. Clients have entrusted us with assisting them to resolve some of their most difficult and business critical challenges. Our investigative services include financial, internal, and regulatory investigations, asset searches, brand protection, forensic accounting, dispute advisory services, litigation support, business/market entry intelligence, transaction intelligence, proxy contests, intellectual property infringement and product counterfeiting, and regulatory or court-ordered monitorships. Kroll’s BII practice is staffed with a multidisciplinary team of professionals who include former prosecutors, law enforcement officers and journalists, as well as certified public and forensic accountants, data analytics experts, and certified fraud examiners. Summary of Position As Associate Director you will assist in the BII practice by enhancing Kroll’s current data analytics capabilities, providing clarity around prospective clients, resource identification, competitor intelligence and Kroll’s overall abilities to enhance market presence. You will also be responsible for conducting research and analysis, structuring projects and managing resources and preparing conclusions for clients. This role requires an imaginative and creative thinker with the ability to work to tight deadlines often balancing a significant and varied caseload.
requirements: RequirementsResponsibilities:  Provide expert, reliable and robust analysis of complex situations and data for clients Development and management of projects, throughout the life and the engagement: meeting with client to discuss needs, preparation of commercial and technical proposal, agreement of engagement, development of working plan and budget, allocation of resources, direction of project team members, delivery and quality assurance and project invoicing Act as client contact throughout projects and contribute to management of the client relationship Exercise good judgment demonstrate innovation and adapt working strategy based on results obtained Take ownership of project and deliverables and manage workflow and costs effectively Ensure ethical conduct, quality of services, use of best practices and compliance with policy and SOPs in each project Identify project risks and effectively manage them Contribute to the professional development and evaluation of junior project team members Demonstrate excellent judgment, be commercially-focused and be driven by professional excellence and a commitment to the Kroll brand.  Requirements:  Strong academic background, preferably in the fields of Finance, Journalism, International Relations, International Business and Political Science, Law or Security Studies 4-6 years of relevant work experience in project managing investigative/research cases and/or investment advisory Prior experience in Risk Assessment and/or Forensic Accounting Proven ability grasp client needs and to analyze large data sets in order to deliver readily understandable executive reports and dashboards Strong team, project and client management experience, along with strong interpersonal skills Proficient in a broad variety of investigative methods Proficient in MS Office. Ideally also proficient in investigative analysis tools

job_title: Business and Operations Manager, Google Cloud - Singapore
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany overview: Google is not a conventional company, and we don’t intend to become one. True, we share attributes with the world’s most successful organizations – a focus on innovation and smart business practices comes to mind – but even as we continue to grow, we’re committed to retaining a small-company feel. At Google, we know that every employee has something important to say, and that every employee is integral to our success. We provide individually-tailored compensation packages that can be comprised of competitive salary, bonus, and equity components, along with the opportunity to earn further financial bonuses and rewards. Googlers thrive in small, focused teams and high-energy environments, believe in the ability of technology to change the world, and are as passionate about their lives as they are about their work. For more information, visit www.google.com/careers. The area: Google Cloud Google Cloud helps millions of employees and organizations empower their employees, serve their customers, and build what’s next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. And our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. The role: Business and Operations Manager, Google Cloud - Singapore Google Cloud teams work with schools, companies, and government agencies to make them more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You help fellow sales Googlers by performing budgeting, planning, and analysis activities — and through your passion for the magic of Google products like G Suite and Chrome. Not only do you provide invaluable financial and budgeting input, but you also devise new ways for us to communicate with potential leads and bring them into the Google fold. Your insight means you excel at customer segmentation, acquisition, and retention. You combine clean communication with strong analytical skills and a solid commitment to providing customers with a Googley customer experience. You also peer into the future for us; you examine and analyze statistical data to forecast marketing trends and to identify potential new markets for Google Cloud. Additional Role Description: The Google Cloud Customer team helps customers transform and evolve their business through the use of Google’s global data center and software assets. As a Business and Operations Manager, you will partner with Sales leadership to provide actionable insights and use a data driven approach to sharpen decision-making and drive deep understanding of our fast growing business. Combined with the resources of a dedicated sales force, our insights translate directly to accelerated growth and improve Google’s ability to serve its Cloud customers at scale. In this role, you will help drive and develop the performance and strategy our Japan and Asia-Pacific (JAPAC) Cloud business, ensuring rapid and long term sustainable growth for our Cloud offering. Responsibilities: - Provide thoughtful leadership and influence executive level decision making through deep analytical insight and core business decisions. - Structure and communicate complex, ambiguous, and potentially challenging business issues to advise the Google Cloud Customer Japan and Asia-Pacific (JAPAC) Leadership team. - Build a network across Sales, Operations, Business Intelligence, and Finance, in JAPAC and across the globe, to address a wide analytical and operational questions. - Shape the vision and trajectory for the JAPAC business, partnering with leadership to run regular business reviews and keep the business on track with both our short-term and long-term goals. Delivering strategic insights and targeted action plans to address specific areas of risk and opportunity, leveraging the support of Global teams. - Enable regional teams with at-scale insights, analyses, and common processes and tools. Support and communicate effectively with English speaking clients.
requirements: RequirementsMinimum qualifications: - 5 years of experience in strategic planning, consulting, investment banking, or similar role. - Experience with SQL and other database, scripting, or business intelligence tools. Preferred qualifications: - MBA or other relevant Master's degree. - Ability to construct simple and impactful messages from complex analyses. Ability to influence business leadership. - Ability to take initiative and work in an unstructured environment. Ability to navigate ambiguity, providing clarity and structure. - Ability to create and grow effective cross-functional networks and manage without authority. - Excellent business judgment, analytical, and written and verbal communication skills. - Ability to speak and write in English fluently and idiomatically.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob Title: Senior Product/Market Manager   SWIFT provides the platform, messaging, standards, and products & services to over 11,500 customers in 212 countries and territories. It is the lifeblood of the global financial community, facilitating payments, securities, trade finance and FX transactions. We operate a global financial network, with interfaces and integration software footprint at client premises, enabled by a fast growing services business. Financial crime compliance and business intelligence is a new and growing part of our product portfolio.   Our employees are the foundation of our success. If you are motivated by being part of a dynamic, growing and engaging work environment, in a firm obsessed with creating value for its member community, SWIFT is a good fit for you. We value expertise, integrity and customer focus.   This role is part of the APAC Commercial organisation. You will be part of a team of pre-sales solution architects for one or more sub-regions, providing technical expertise and partnership to our clients as they solve their pressing business needs.
requirements: RequirementsResponsibilities: Your responsibilities will be to:            Define, develop and/or validate improved/new product/ market concepts and/or business solutions based upon customer needs.         Define and develop a mid to long term marketing plan to inform internal/external parties about strategic product/market development.         Ensure and/or produce detailed product definitions and associated business cases for new and renewed products, within the framework of the overall business strategy. Coordinate the approval for business cases, provide IT with customer/product requirements and act as an interface between product development and commercial divisions.         Initiate, drive and control product launch projects to ensure timely delivery of agreed specifications. Manage all aspects of the marketing plan (product/pricing offer, promotion, training of commercial teams and customers and the development of user documentation).         Keep abreast with trends in the industry and share information with other divisions/departments.         Manage a product portfolio through their life cycle by defining yearly sales targets, continuously monitoring P&L and ensuring continually product improvements or renewals.         Liaise with other divisions/departments of the company, customers, vendors, regulatory bodies and industry associations and make presentations.         Provide advice and guidance to less senior product/market managers.     Qualifications: Do you have what it takes?  University degree in Business, Marketing, Computer Science or related fields, or equivalent experience.  Minimum 5 years of experience of as product manager.   Minimum of 10  years of experience in the financial operations, product or services in project development and planning.   Experience in SWIFT products, services and standards messaging solutions   Experience in market infrastructure (e.g. central bank, stock exchange, clearing house, central securities depository) systems or operations would be advantageous.    Able to work in a multi-cultural and multi-country team environment   Fluent in English written or spoken     Ability to lead a team with strong, analytical and customer orientation skills Knowledge in modern integration techniques and technologies.

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities    Recruitment Consultant - Job Overview   Job Overview:   The Recruitment Consultant will work in between the Sales Team and candidates.  They will work in partnership with the Sales team taking control of managing the recruitment process from candidate generation through to candidate placement.  Recruitment Consultants will work within a vertical market specialization having direct touch points to a network of mid, senior candidates and niche junior level candidates, SearchElect’s internal team members and client contact. They will develop a deep understanding of the various research tools to come up with a ‘Talent Map’ of the market and own candidate control through the entire recruitment process.  In addition to working on various recruitment processes, the Recruitment Consultant will also be at the forefront of market activity. Therefore an important source of business intelligence to feed back into the SearchElect organization and adding value to ensure that the organization remains competitive with a leading edge and capitalizes on market trends and opportunities. Activities: Overview   Research Stage: Create search criteria from qualified job forms in order to execute a candidate search and if necessary, collaborate  with the Business Support and refine searches to improve results.   Marketing Stage: Share market knowledge and inform the marketing team with the latest trending topics relevant to the technology industry in order to create brand awareness to target business customers and candidate registrations.   Align marketing activities and efforts towards recruiting and sales objectives. Feed back any ROI to marketing.   Creation of Talent Pools: Organise candidate CRM and social media  lists and tagging methods of active and passive  candidates within the target area’s of the SearchElect specialist markets.  Collaborate with business support to provide search criteria for ‘watchdogs’.   Intelligence gathering: Generate market intelligence from Candidates. Upload references as Contacts to the Applicant Tracking System. Generate information from potential Clients and Candidates via reference checks for active Candidates. Meet active candidates to learn market intelligence and gain potential leads as well as referrals of new candidates. Increased interaction with our internal database.   Recruiting - Submission’s: Standardise job forms for external advertising. Execute candidate search process against planned path depending on urgency and job scoring criteria. Qualify shortlist of Candidates using SearchElect policy and procedures around red flags, risks, ABC techniques. Collaborate  with the sales team from strategy to follow-up’s pending from the client. Prepare candidates for sendouts.    Recruiting -  Sendouts: Use talent pools and hiring manager distribution lists to cross market ‘hot candidates’ to target hiring managers.  Sendout shortlist of candidates to hiring managers or HR.   Recruiting - Interviewing: Control entire interview process from the hiring manager request, coordination, candidate and where possible hiring manager preparations, feedback exchanges using the ATS process and policy. Collaborate with sales accordingly. Ensure that Sales team is equipped with all possible red flags and concerns from a candidate perspective to prepare and inform client and eliminate challenges on closing as early as the interviewing stage. Meet and prepare the candidate by stimulating in them the right mindset when they have the interview.   Recruiting - Placement’s: Pre-close the Candidate using the ABC method from first contact. Follow the SearchElect process and policies throughout the lifecycle of the search processes from first contact to offer and counter offer discussions. Ensure proper adherence to the SearchElect red flag procedures to maximise successful placements and reduce the risk of ‘drop offs’.   Recruiting - Post-placement: Follow the SearchElect post placement process and periodically meet with placed candidates for after service and account support activities.   Recruitment - Account Support: Identify potential opportunities within the Company/Client for current or future purposes. Put this down as task or job lead for the sales team to follow through.   Experience required:     People-oriented mindset - able to understand and appreciate other perspectives   Realistic thinker and able to overcome objectives pragmatically   Understands the difference between IQ/EQ and able to identify the differences between these and how to work with the different balances individually and with other people   Identifying ‘redflags’ and business risks.   Online data mining – Social Media, websites etc.   Building and structuring internal CRM and systems   Working with customers in B2B within a professional capacity   Experience relating to recruitment or talent acquisition in an agency or in house environment   Good written English to update records   Strong communication skills to speak with internal and external people.     Skills required:     Interviewing   Market research – Business directory search and build   Deep Social Media – Linkedin, Facebook , Twitter, Blog etc.   Data research – based on clients   Organization   Fluency in English both written and spoken   Data organization   Business Intelligence gathering   Spreadsheets     Personal attributes:   Communicative (able to build rapport)   Influential   Problem solver
requirements: Requirements  People-oriented mindset - able to understand and appreciate other perspectives   Realistic thinker and able to overcome objectives pragmatically   Understands the difference between IQ/EQ and able to identify the differences between these and how to work with the different balances individually and with other people   Bachelor's Degree or Diploma

job_title: 2019 Full Time Campus Analyst - Engineering Division
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base that includes corporations, financial institutions, governments and individuals. Founded in 1869, the firm is headquartered in New York and maintains offices in all major financial centers around the world. ABOUT ENGINEERING Our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible.  Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas.  Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients.  Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action.  Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets. ROLES Software Engineering Transform our business and work across all areas of the firm to design and implement high-quality, scalable and smart solutions. Leveraging both internal and open source services, we design and develop applications capable of building, maintaining, and processing large & complex data sets. Ensuring we have the most up-to-date and actionable information, we constantly strive to boost performance and exceed industry standards in order to meet our clients’ evolving needs. We look for ways to improve our operations and enhance our client offerings through internal and external platforms as we build and expand the capacity for data mining, anomaly detection, and business intelligence. Financial Modelling We look beyond the numbers and find the trends. As a member of our team, you will extract meaningful information to engineer advice and solutions that have real-world implications for our clients and the firm.  This level of expert analysis involves large, at times global, data sets – both structured and unstructured – to build predictive models that are relevant to specific business centers and account for market variables. These quantitative techniques then inform effective and accurate cross-asset trade and portfolio ideas for our clients. In collaboration with your team and others across the firm, you will build and enhance advanced quantitative and analytical methods, utilizing software to design risk modeling systems and develop machine learning algorithms. Specifically, your role will focus on providing APIs to clients helping them generate alpha, risk calculations and business metrics. This valuable information will allow them to build and challenge risk models that identify and quantify market and liquidity risk and modeling vulnerabilities. Infrastructure Engineering Infrastructure Engineering is a multi-faceted role that allows you to explore data center design, networks, storage, cloud computing, big data, application messaging, databases, communications, market data and software languages. Make things possible for our clients and the firm as you design and build our compute and data infrastructure. You will put your expertise to work in a variety of challenges, from identifying internal hardware needs, to implementing public and private cloud-based solutions to providing seamless, on-demand scaling of our applications.  We provide a robust testing platform that involves the best standards, solutions and tools to ensure uninterrupted operation of all of our lines of business. You will have the opportunity to use data mining techniques to identify and react to problems in the firm’s infrastructure and platforms. A role on this team allows you to use your experience to help us transform the future at Goldman Sachs.
requirements: RequirementsBASIC QUALIFICATIONS  Bachelor or Master Degree Preferred degree in Computer Science, Technology, Math, Statistics and/or Engineering          No full time work experience (excluding internship experience) Interest and passionate in working in financial industry and technology Ability to work in a dynamic global environment with a focus on teamwork Impeccable attention to detail and excellent problem solving and analytical skills Ability to grasp complex issues, interpret information and communicate commercial and operational issues Display creativity and entrepreneurial spirit Flexibility to adapt to a dynamic and changing organization Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English A proactive approach and a high level of enthusiasm Proficient with suite of Microsoft Office software and other computer skills Preferred technical skills in JavaTM technology, C, C++, UNIX®, Microsoft® technology, Perl, XML, HTML, Visual Basic, VBScript and N-tier architecture, among others.   Goldman Sachs is an equal opportunity employer. © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2019. All rights reserved.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesClearstate, an Economist Intelligence Unit business, offers healthcare-focused market and business intelligence services complimented by strategic advisory to help medical device, pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and healthcare service firms understand their current and potential markets, and implement pragmatic and innovative strategies to ultimately tap into new growth opportunities. Clearstate aims to further augment its dynamic team by seeking high calibre and talented business consultants keen to grow their career in healthcare business advisory. The primary responsibilities of an Associate Consultant are:  Project management: You will lead a team of healthcare analyst in multi-country project engagement in the healthcare industry in the areas of market opportunity assessment, go-to-market strategy, customer insights, channel optimization strategy and competitive benchmarking. Client management: You will liaise with the client during the course of the project engagement, including communicating project updates, presenting key milestones, pre-empting project issues, managing different client stakeholders, etc. Staff mentoring: You will be responsible for the mentoring and guidance of analysts and senior analysts, ensuring that they meet their performance goals and successfully grow their careers at Clearstate. Team training and development: You will be responsible for the performance and appraisal of a team of analysts, including helping to train and develop the necessary skill sets they need to succeed as a healthcare business consultant at Clearstate.
requirements: RequirementsThe candidate should ideally possess the following skills/relevant experiences:  3+ years of relevant experience in healthcare business consulting Proven track record in project management and client handling, preferably in the healthcare sector or in business consulting Bachelor’s or Master’s degree from top tier universities, preferably Science major, with an MBA Exceptional command of written and spoken English, good command of business Mandarin is a plus Excellent people skills, with the ability to motivate teams and work well with people at all levels in the organization Highly analytical, organized and meticulous Versatile and able to think inside and outside of the box Able to work in a fast pace team structure

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Senior Adobe & Google Analytics Developer analyze, design, code, test and implement systematic Business Intelligence solutions to meet customer requirements. He/she will provide general support to maintain applications that meet the service levels, system availability, performance and quality levels required by their customers.
requirements: RequirementsRequirements  Minimum 5 years in systems integration and development, package implementation, and/or interactive design Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or related field preferred  Experience with Adobe & Google Analytics platform and WCM packages (AEM, Tridion, Interwoven, Fatwire, Drupal, Vignette, SharePoint or Sitecore)  Hands-on experience with Java, JSON, SQL or Oracle DB  Hands-on experience with web technologies including XML, HTML, XHTML, CSS, AJAX, JavaScript, Webservices/SOAP/REST  Experience with multiple web/app server/containers: Apache, Tomcat, Weblogic, Websphere  Experience with both open source and proprietary package solutions  Experience with both Waterfall and Agile methodologies  Experience with multiple source control products including SVN, Git etc. Proven leadership and managerial skills to "independently" manage a track of work (with 5-15 people), during multiple phases of project lifecycle   Pluses: Master's degree and/or specific industry domain knowledge in Retail, Insurance, Financial Services and Healthcare sector

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesImagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple's Global Business Intelligence (GBI) team is looking for a Software Engineering Lead for Apple’s Data Warehousing, Business Intelligence and Analytics solutions. Take a leadership role to implement innovative and challenging reporting solutions for one of the world's largest databases.   GBI team builds extraordinary high performing reporting and analytics solutions. The team consists of delivery leads and development engineers. This role is responsible for the design, implementation, maintenance, and overall health of DW solutions.   We are seeking a pro-active solution-oriented individual with strong written and verbal communication skills, and have a proven track record in Data warehousing architecture, application design, software lifecycle and technical team management coupled with excellent leadership skills.   You will enjoy the benefits of working in a fast growing business where you are inspired to "Think Different" and where your efforts play a key role in the success of Apple's business. - Deliver highly available, reliable, innovative large-scale data warehousing solutions to facilitate data induction, build optimized aggregates and building reporting solutions - Provide leadership and expertise to define solutions architecture and strategies at all layers, for next generation reporting platform with high performance and scalability - Lead a portfolio of multiple projects, setting priorities with measurable objectives, monitoring and reporting on the process, progress and results - Own ultimate responsibility for the deliverables, working with support and daily operations team to ensure 7x24 operation. - Effectively communicate program status to the senior management and functional partners on a regular basis - Keep up-to-date on the newest technology solutions in market to generate innovative ideas to solve business challenges - Influence work of global multi-functional teams - Provide technical guidance, direction and problem solving to engineering team members. Drive technical excellence in software development and solution design. - Use and help chip in to standard software engineering processes, improve development methodologies over time. - Provide staffing coordination and planning to achieve timely delivery of multiple, concurrent initiatives.
requirements: Requirements We are looking for, 8+ years experience developing DW solutions 3+ years leading a technical team, including prior hands-on technical experience  Architect and design Enterprise Data warehouse and reporting solutions  Solid understanding of analytics needs and proactive-ness to build generic solutions to improve the efficiency  Translate complex business requirements into scalable technical solutions meeting Data warehousing standards  Provide solutions and recommendations on technical issues in production system  Hands on experience in 2 or more of the database technologies like Teradata, Hadoop, Oracle and Vertica  Good programming experience in at least 1 of the following programming languages C, C++, Java, Perl, Python  Experience in architecting and building robust, scalable and performant data warehousing and analytics solutions  Experience or knowledge in the following areas will definitely be a plus : New generation technologies like Spark, Scala, Kafka, Advanced Python Big Data and NoSQL - Mongo, Cassandra Data Science and Machine Learning Knowledge Cloud technology exposure BS Degree in computer science or an equivalent

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe role of ADW Consultant ensures Oracle valued customer satisfaction by successfully delivering Oracle Cloud and Data Warehouse solution using technical delivery skills, business and product leading practices.  Responsibility: • Represent Oracle professionally on client sites. • Work with customer representatives, both technical and non-technical, to produce a solution that fulfils their requirements • Develop and maintain an up to date knowledge of relevant Oracle products and services within the rapidly evolving PaaS offerings, especially within Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence area • Support, and where necessary, drive technology adoption by clients, including positioning Oracle Consulting’s Data Warehouse services • Own project delivery as technical expert/leader to the customers when implementing solutions and developments • Develop solutions that follow product development guidelines and are in line with established build and design standards • Deliver innovative Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence solutions using Oracle’s PaaS offerings • Transfer product knowledge to customers to reinforce training or in lieu of training • Resolve or escalate client issues as appropriate to support and engineering team. • Collaborate by sharing knowledge and best practice within the practice and across lines of business • Participate in project planning along with the Domain Lead, Programme owners, and project managers • Develop peer network through which to provide and receive product and skills assistance
requirements: Requirements• Applicants should have significant Oracle Data Warehouse experience, ideally with integration to/from Oracle Applications • Able to perform complex problem solving and should be comfortable working according to company policies and processes • Knowledge and experience of Oracle’s PaaS Applications, primarily in Oracle Integration solution area • Knowledge and experience of Cloud Integration strategies and implementations • Having a good understanding of ETL/ELT tools implementation • Ability to develop function and program in PL/SQL and/or standard SQL programming • Good understanding and exposure to the following, in no particular order: • Oracle Database • Oracle Data Integrator • Oracle SQL Developer • Data Warehouse Concept and Implementation • Business Intelligence Concept and Implementation • Experience in working as part of an external/internal virtual team or alone as required by priorities • The ability to work in a collaborative and energetic environment with other technology and business disciplines  Additional Skills: • Good presentation and having an effective communication skill • Experience in data design and data modeling will be an advantage • Good business analysis and strong technical technology skills

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe National University of Singapore invites applications for the position of Research Fellow in the Department of Information Systems and Analytics, School of Computing (SoC). SoC is strongly committed to research excellence in all its dimensions: Searching for fundamental results and insights in healthcare data, developing novel computational solutions to a wide range of applications, building large-scale experimental systems and improving the wellbeing of society. We seek to play an active role both internationally and locally in the core and emerging areas of Computer Science and Information Systems. The Research Fellow will be responsible for working closely with the Co-Principal Investigators and lab members on one or more research projects. He/she should possess experience or interest in at least one of the following research areas:  Data engineering Data visualization Machine Learning Business Intelligence Healthcare or Fintech Information Systems Econometrics, costing models Automation  Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.
requirements: Requirements A PhD degree in Information Systems, Computer Engineering or Computer Science, Finance, economics;  Demonstrated skills in data analysis;  Good publication record; and Experience in research.

Data mining design and implementation.

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities Technology start up industry High potential role Finance business partner  Our client is currently in search of a Financial Planning & Analysis Manager due to business needs. Reporting to the CFO, you will be responsible for the full spectrum of financial planning & analysis including budgeting and forecasting. You will analyze the trends of Key Performance Indicators (KPI), especially relating to financial metrics such as sales, expenditures, and profit margin. You will monitor KPI, and identify the cause of any unexpected variances, develop and continually improve budgeting, financial projections, and operating forecast. In this role, you will be involved in ad-hoc business performance reporting and be required to present the monthly and quarterly financial reports of various units and departments. You will implement a business intelligence tools, dashboard reports and develop financial models and analyze them to support strategic initiatives.You will support management team and the Heads of Department with data-driven analysis.
requirements: RequirementsTo be successful, you should possess a strong Accounting Degree (Honors will be a plus) with prior Big 4 audit experience. You should have a total of 3 to 5 years of FP & A experience gained in the current company with prior Big 4 audit background. Suitable profiles should possess Advanced Excel skills. Financial modelling experience will be a plus (not a must have) Interested candidate can send the updated CV in word format to maggieong@ethosbc.com quoting reference number MO/ATDX-026865/FB. BeathChapman Pte Ltd Licence No 16S8112 EA Personnel No R1105973

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDigital and Analytics professionals define strategies and develop/deliver strategies and solutions for managing the capture, storage, security, revision control, retrieval, distribution, preservation and destruction of enterprise documents and content. Equip business users with rapid access to the information and services they need to work more efficiently, make better informed business decisions and enable their organizations to become more competitive.   A professional at this position level within Accenture has the following responsibilities:  Consistently build depth and breadth in technology expertise in Business Intelligence (BI) and Predictive analytics (PA) via mandated training, access to enterprise cutting edge engagements and working with Accenture client teams. Assist sales team with responses to RFI/RFPs and develop and presenting demonstrable material to support these efforts Provide expertise in BI and PA technology in combination with industry standard statistical techniques to implement solutions to meet customer needs, develop tools and assets to improve delivery and drive innovation in digital analytics. Evangelist and advocate in adoption of leading technologies / concepts in digital analytics.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCompany Description As the world's leader in digital payments technology, Visa's mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company's dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce. At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers. You're an Individual. We're the team for you. Together, let's transform the way the world pays. Job Description POSITION SUMMARY The Middleware Engineering team is part of the Global Service Engineering and is responsible for common middleware and integration infrastructure that supports communication between multiple enterprise applications and multiple business lines.  This role will be responsible for design, development, configuration, problem analysis, deployment, and continuous operational improvement of middleware technologies used at Visa.  The responsibility includes working with Global systems, Global Operations, Cybersource and external Integration partners in implementing  solutions via current or proposed middleware technologies, including but not limited to Application Servers(WebLogic, WebSphere, tcServer, JBOSS, etc.), Web Servers, Oracle SOA, Oracle BPM, Oracle Business Intelligence, Oracle Identity Management and Java/J2EE applications. Understanding of Actuate reporting, SOA, Data power, LDAP and DB2 database will be a plus.  He or she must be able to collaborate with others to manage and rationalize incoming requirements in order to implement appropriate solutions.  Key Responsibilities We are looking for Systems Analysts to join our Operations & Infrastructure team. Candidate should be able to:  Gather and analyze requirements from development teams to design, deploy and support of various enterprise middleware technologies. Provide technology leadership in tcServer, Tomcat, IBM WebSphere Application Server, Oracle WebLogic, messaging solution (message broker, MQ) Architect, integrate and configure applications to fully utilize the above technologies as well as Datapower, LDAP, Siteminder and other Middleware technologies. Provide level 3 (engineering) production support for integration solutions in production environments Lead problem resolution and improvement efforts Drive constant interaction with developers, architects, and project managers. Enhance Middleware and Integration operating procedures and engineering patterns. Provide input to project planning, estimation, budget, resource, and technology planning.
requirements: RequirementsQualifications  BS or MS in Computer Science or related degree from an accredited university Basic level of experience on Application servers like Tomcat, IBM WebSphere, Weblogic, etc. Basic level of experience on Web. Server like IIS, IBM IHS, etc. Basic experience with a scripting language (Shell script, Perl, Python, bash) Experience in troubleshooting production issues and problem solving. Exceptional oral and written communication skills Basic level of knowledge on Windows/UNIX/Linux OS. Experience with CA SiteMinder, CA Web Agent Integration with web server, CA Identity Manager, CA Directory Server, Red Hat Directory Server and Oracle Directory Server products Experience programming in Java, J2EE Experience with Fraud Management, Payment and/or Credit Card processing is a plus XML parsing and XML schema design experience

job_title: UI / UX Designer for Big Data Dashboard Visualization
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesTrakomatic ( www.trakomatic.com ) is one of Singapore’s fastest growing startups. Our mission is to digitize Planet Earth. We specialize in cutting-edge video analytics technologies that equip global businesses big or small with people counting, tracking and facial recognition analysis solutions. Our analysis and insights enable business leaders and practitioners from a diverse range of verticals including Retail, Banking, Government and Transportation, to make smarter data-driven decisions. We help retailers to access essential analytics which can help them gain insights into the visitors in all their branches. Our clients access our comprehensive dashboard which provides real-time overviews, campaign management, automated weekly reports, alerts & notifications which can be integrated easily with POS (Point Of Sales system) and third party system through our API (application programming interface). We are looking for highly motivated team players that can join our growing team. We'd love to hear from you! Prospective applicants may email their CV and cover letter to hr@trakomatic.com . For any data-driven application, business intelligence software or dashboard, the interface not only has to be pleasing to the eye, but also intuitive to connect with the intended users. We are very selective in who we take as our designers and information architects. As a UI/UX Designer for Big Data Dashboard Visualization, you will designing sketches and wireframes to carefully planning every interaction, along with using our visualization tools to tweak the user experience of the final product. The ultimate goal is to create an engaging and valuable user-centric solution.
requirements: RequirementsAt least 3 years of relevant working experience in product related role and successfully shipped multiple products. 4/2/2019 [Hiring] Job Description for UI/UX Designer for Big Data Dashboard Visualization (SG) - Google Docs https://docs.google.com/document/d/11yVGPj5HKtbRzCR67WhV2b-ezJ445rGeuqZZOdZDBiI/edit 2/2 ● Analytical minded with strong organizational skills. ● Detail oriented and forward looking individual. ● Self-starter mentality with ability to thrive in fast-paced dynamic environment. ● Experience working with software developers, analysts and marketing/sales team. ● Able to work independently, unsupervised and communicating with other people remotely. ● Excellent command in English in both spoken and written. ● Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role. ● Portfolio of design projects. ● Knowledge of wireframe tools and design software. ● Team spirit; strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders ● Good time-management skills.

Work closely with Project Manager and Senior System Analyst for the development, implementation and maintenance of Business Intelligence (BI) and Data warehouse projects. Scope of work includes: a) Work closely with stakeholders to gather their requirements b) Develop data warehouse and data marts c) Design and develop reports, dashboards and interactive visualisations d) Provide system documentation, ensure proper version control, and change management of programs e) Provide operational maintenance and support for non-production environments; f) Handle incidents and service request management to resolve issues within the Service Level Agreement g) Work with appointed personnel to support and provide response to regular audits or reviews for the projects and work on the follow-up action and recommendation from the audit findings h) Conduct testing of software patches or upgrades, and work with Facilities Management team for the production deployment
