job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWhat is the job about? You will work closely with Product and Operation team and taking an active role to architect the solution and solve daily operation problem, and also:  Work in an Agile environment and be part of the continuous improvement with new practices, ideas, concepts, methods and technologies Build and work on smart data environment Optimize and create new thing on top of our data platform
requirements: RequirementsRequired Skills:  BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent 1 to 2 years of professional software engineering Fresh Grad are welcome to apply Proficient in SQL Proficient in PHP will be preferable Experience with MySQL, MongoDB, and ChartJS Experience with Open Source technologies and Linux operating system Experience in HTML5, CSS, and Bootstrap Proficient in a source control system (preferably Git) Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills Knowledge on Data clustering will be a plus

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWHAT WE DO We invite you to be part of our ambitious, close-knit team creating systems for large customers who need to crunch through Tbps of data in real-time. Our approach is relentless performance-oriented software engineering vs. server sprawl in our customers' datacentres. You will use the latest high-end hardware and continuously devise ways to push the envelope of software performance. We build in-house systems if we must. We had to for indexing 1M 60-column rows/s, for aggregating high throughput event streams over hundreds of combinations of dimensions, and for pattern matching 5M patterns at 100Gb/s per 2RU. We use these to solve real customer problems. You will experiment wildly. For example we implemented network monitoring using a GPU, and we tested 4-socket machines with 2T RAM. Our current favourite platform is a 2-socket system with Platinum 8180 CPUs (112 lcores in total), 4x40Gbps NICs and 1T RAM, which we use to process 160Gbps. You will help us build a successful software platform for the long run. We invest a lot in flexibility, such as with our extensible rule engine and declarative aggregation system that empowers our analysts and helps us minimise the C code we have to write for supporting disparate use-cases. We work end-to-end. You will implement data engineering solutions that are both efficient and secure for handling events from 500 million users, and to extract insight without leaking individual information. We want to show off. To attract the best programmers we plan to showcase our technology. You can be part of our effort to open source interesting pieces of our technology stack.  YOUR ROLE AS DATABASE ENGINEER As a database engineer, you will review and analyse the efficiency and correctness of existing database code and architecture.You will also have to identify and troubleshoot bottlenecks to max out database performance and collaborate with team members on data modelling and schema design in order to implement new or improved features and functionality. You must be a very strong programmer, know how to measure and tune SQL performance, and be at home on the Linux command line. You must feel comfortable in an international work environment and able to learn by yourself and deliver. Your managers will be highly technical people who expect you to be better than them at your specialty. You should expect to be rewarded as our company continues to grow.
requirements: RequirementsWHAT WE VALUE  Bachelor’s or Higher Degree in Computer Science or equivalent Strong skills in data analysis, modelling and manipulation. Excellent understanding of relational database design and performance aspects. Expert level SQL coding skills, extensive experience with PostgreSQL. Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance monitoring, tuning, configuration, and troubleshooting. Proficiency in shell scripting and Python programming. Familiarity with at least one compiled language. Highly self-motivated and comfortable in an international working environment.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Physical Analysis and Cryptographic Engineering (PACE), Temasek Laboratories @ Nanyang Technological University, Singapore is seeking one motivated researcher to fulfill the research scientist position, in the area of embedded security. The candidate will perform the research on embedded security, specific to security evaluation and forensics of hardware and software targets.  This position is available from April 2019. The initial contract will be one year. There are possibilities for extension upon successful performance.
requirements: Requirements Candidates should have already completed or close to completion of PhD degree in mathematics, computer science, electrical engineering, or related disciplines, with strong background in embedded security. Experienced in embedded systems, Internet of things and security evaluation. Strong understanding of cryptographic algorithms (symmetric and asymmetric). Coding background in C/Java/Assembly/Python for analysis is required. Should have previous lab exposure to practical side channel equipment on embedded systems, which will be an integral part of the upcoming projects. The project would require implementation of assembly (AVR/ARM) optimized targets and analysis. Understanding of design and security analysis of cryptographic protocols on variety of embedded platforms. The candidate should have track record in R&D (publications in international journals and conferences. Creative, curious, self-motivated and a team player with good analytical and problem-solving skills. The candidate needs to be fluent in written and spoken English Previous experience in reverse engineering is a plus.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCPR is seeking for Research Scientists with expertise in drug discovery utilizing novel biotechnology platform.
requirements: RequirementsThe applicant should be highly skilled in at least one of the following areas:  Lead identification screening in drug discovery Antibody, protein or peptide engineering In vitro display and biopanning Biotechnology and biochemistry  The applicants must have completed and be awarded with a relevant Master or Ph.D. degree in Science or related field (not in the process of achieving it).  In addition, the successful candidates must be able to demonstrate technical expertise in areas which may include molecular biology, cell biology, protein chemistry and protein engineering as evidenced by projects, presentations, or peer-reviewed scientific publications. Scientists with strong passion in medical science for creating and delivering innovative drugs to society which leads to saving patients suffering from unmet medical needs are highly desired.  Familiarity or having prior work experience in drug discovery work will be a plus, although not absolutely necessary. Interested applicants are invited to email their detailed resume, as well as their qualifications, availability, current and expected salary to: recruitment@chugai-pharmabody.com  For more information regarding our Company, you may refer to our website at: http://chugai-pharmabody.com/   We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified

job_title: RESEARCH ASSOCIATE / SCIENTIST (CELL BIOLOGY / BIOASSAY / BIOANALYTICAL)
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesLaboratory Research duties  The applicants should have background in Science and candidates with some hands-on toxicity or/and bioassay experience in a research lab is preferred. He / she should be able to assist supervisor to plan, run experiments and studies, analyse results and write reports and SOPs. He / she should be able to design and perform experiments independently and work in groups. Bioassay: Applicants who are proficient in mammalian cell culture and aseptic techniques is a must and applicants who has experience in ELISA, SDS-PAGE, Western blot and immunohistochemistry are preferred. Experience in functional assays, genotoxicity, immunological techniques are preferred. Bioanalytical: Experience in Spectroscopy (UV, Fluorescence, Near and Far UV), Capillary electrophoresis (CE-SDS, cIEF) or FT-IR are preferred. Analytical skills (inclusive HPLC and MS) is a plus.  Experience in conducting study in GLP facility is a plus. job_title: SLS Manager Cell Culture Technologies, APAC
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe responsibilities of the SLS Manager Cell Culture Technologies (CCT) APAC will include managerial responsibilities (appr. 50%) as well as technical responsibilities as and individual contributor (appr. 50%). The workload division between managerial and technical responsibilities may vary with the team size. The team in the APAC region consists of cell culture scientists  (or Bioreactor Application Specialists) in India, Japan, China, Korea, Taiwan and Australia/New Zealand. General duties:  Lead the field support team in the APAC region that is responsible for supporting Cell Culture Technologies (SLS CCT-APAC team) and ensure the team responds to the business needs. Daily management of the SLS CCT-APAC team, incuding resource allocation, monitoring activities through agreed metrics and adequate management reporting. Harmonize efforts, processes and resources of the SLS CCT-APAC team with other SLS filed support teams, including the European and US based Cell Culture Technologies teams. Coordinate objectives and activities of the SLS CCT-APAC team wit hother groups and departments, including but not limited to the other managers in the Integrated Process Solutions team within SLS. Attend relevant business line meetings as appropriate. Drive integration of the SLS CCT-APAC team in the Integrated Process Solutions team to support Biotech Solutions Projects that involve compbinations of multiple unit operations/technologies.  Technical duties:  Participate in customer support and other support activities as key member of the SLS CCT team in the APAC region in the role of Senior Scientist. Provide expert scientific and technical support t obusiness unit globally and link with other regional and global SLS teams. Attend and participate at relevant industry conferences (report technical trends, changes to regulatory standards etc). Write and present technical papers for general publications/presentation at technical conferences and meetings.  People Management duties:  Responsible for hiring, training and mentoring of the SLS CCT-APAC team. Set realistic goals (P4G) for the members of the SLS CCT-APAC team, aligned with the business priorities for the SLS organiation and Pall Biotech as a whole. Mentor and support the members of the SLS CCT-APAC team to achieve their P4G goals. Mentor and support the members of the SLS CCT-APAC team in developing their career and their talents (D4G). Work with the local HR business partners to define the needs and align this with the regional organizations.
requirements: RequirementsPosition Competencies:  Degree in a relevant Science/ Engineering. Record of technology thought leadership supported by being presenter at international conferences and/or author on technical and scientific publications and book chapters. Adequate industry knowledge on biopharmaceutical processes, technologies, products and their applications and in-depth knowledge and experience in the application of Pall Biotech products in R&D, P.D. and manufacturing. Proven leadership and managerial capabilities of a technical organization. Proven experience and success working cross functionally wih Commercial (Account Managers, Specialists, Regional Mgrs., Vice Presidents) technical teams, Marketing, Product Management and Senior Management. Proven ability to motivate team and maintain full engagement in a program/initiative. Strong analytical skills, excellent interpersonal/communication skills. Language skills: fluent in English, knowledge of Mandarin Chinese language is a pro.  Other requirements:  Work safely and comply with the company's health, safety and environmental (HSE) policies and procedures. Prepare to work unsociable hours and travel in own time. Hold full driving license (where applicable) Hold current passport as will need to travel to other Pall sites and customer locations

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA successful candidate is required to be engaged in the research and development activities contributing to flight control and fault tolerant control project. In the algorithms development, the candidate will work on the design and development of flight control and fault tolerant control algorithms. Coding in C/++ and Matlab is required for UAV control logic and algorithm implementation. In the system integration, the candidate will be engaged in software modules integration and algorithm/platform testing.
requirements: RequirementsWe invite a motivated and creative researcher with the relevant qualifications and experience to join us as a Research Scientist. The qualification and requirements are as follows:  PhD Degree in electronics engineering, computer science, control engineering, computer engineering, mechatronics, mechanical engineering or related fields. Good knowledge of flight control theory Good knowledge of software development of PX4 autopilot. Good knowledge of fault tolerant control Good knowledge of C/C++ and Matlab. Good knowledge of physical system dynamics, mechatronics, systems identification, estimation and control theory. Much hands-on project experience in designing, developing, building and testing robot and control systems. Much hands-on project experience in conversional platforms.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout the Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) The Institute for Infocomm Research (I²R) is a member of the Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) family and is Singapore’s largest ICT research institute. Our strategic thrusts are in the spheres of intelligence, communications and media and our research capabilities are in shared sensor networks, public-public/public-private data-sharing platform, big data analytics and visualization solutions. For more information about I2R, please visit www.i2r.a-star.edu.sg The department of Image and Video Analytics of Institute for Infocomm Research (I2R), A*STAR, is looking for talented candidates to join our multi-disciplinary team in the development of an automated aircraft inspection system. As part of the Aerospace Industry Transformation Map (ITM), the project looks into how automation, image analytics, robotics and artificial intelligence can improve the productivity of the manual aircraft inspection process. We are looking for candidates with passion in research and development, as well as translating R&D technology into industry applications. Successful candidate will be required to work with a team of research scientist, engineers in robotics, vision, machine learning and human-computer interaction.
requirements: Requirements    Minimum Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related fields   Possess strong programming skills in C++, C#, Python   Experience and knowledge in OpenCV/ROS/Unity3D/ UnrealEngine/ CUDA, MATLAB, computer vision, image/ video processing and machine learning is a plus   The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_title: Research Scientist (1-year contract),  Living Analytics Research Centre
job_description: Roles & Responsibilities COMPANY DESCRIPTION  Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. RESPONSIBILITIES  The Living Analytics Research Centre (LARC) is a joint research initiative between Singapore Management University (SMU) and Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) that focuses on behavioural and social network analytics in the fields of Urban and Community Liveability, Personalised Urban Mobility, Jobs and Skills Intelligence, as well as Smart Consumption and Healthy Lifestyle. In line with Singapore’s Smart Nation goal, one of LARC’s objectives will be to harness technology to its fullest potential with the aim of improving the lives of Citizens and creating more opportunities. Candidates who join us can also expect to gain a deeper knowledge in the following areas: Big Data Analytics, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning and other relevant disciplines. The Research Scientist will work with faculty researchers on one or more of the following research topics in the urban/social computing, smart cities and consumer business domains.  Data and Text Mining Machine Learning Deep Learning Crowdsourcing Recommender Systems Social-Urban Sensing Big Data Infrastructure    The Research Scientist will also be responsible for one or more the following:  Designing research methodologies Developing algorithms and models Conducting data science studies Designing and conducting experiments Designing and implementing applications, tools and systems Developing analytics capabilities in big data infrastructure

job_title: Research & Development Project Scientist (Synthetic Biology) – School Of Life Sciences & Chemical Technology
industry: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs an R&D Project Scientist, you will be part of a team working to identify novel secondary metabolites for consumer care applications. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:  Microbial genome mapping, transcriptome profiling, proteomics and metabolomics analysis; Novel secondary metabolite Biosynthesis Gene Clusters (BGCs) identification; Refactoring identified BGCs in yeast; Pathway optimization for enhanced secondary metabolite production; Microbial fermentation process development and parameter optimization in bioreactors; Bioactivity and cellular activity assay of the novel secondary metabolites; Analysis of experimental results and preparation of technical reports; Preparation of manuscript for journal publication and patent application; Preparation of research proposals for grant application and industrial collaboration; Procurement of laboratory equipment, materials and accessories, chemicals and reagents; Supervision of junior research staff and final year project students; and Support research team and assist in laboratory management.    Pre-requisites:  At least 2 years of relevant research experience in Synthetic Biology, Microbial Metabolic Engineering, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics or a related field Hands-on experience in microbial metabolic/genetic engineering and fermentation Able to design and undertake research projects with minimal supervision Extensive hands-on experience in bioinformatics, microbial genome mapping, microbial secondary metabolite Biosynthesis Gene Cluster (GBC) identification and refactoring, or synthetic biology would be an advantage  Check out the details of the position and submit online at https://applyjobs.np.edu.sg. Be part of an institution with that something xtra. We thank all applicants for their interest. Shortlisted candidates will be notified within 2 - 3 weeks after the closing date.

industry: Education and Training, Public / Civil Service
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAs a Senior R&D Project Engineer/Scientist, you will work with a project team on the funded research project which aims to scale-up the production of high quality AQP for AQP-based biomimetic membranes applications which includes water reuse and desalination. The AQP-based biomimetic membrane technology is ready for practical applications if large-scale production is realised. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:  Setup and operation of benchtop bio-fermenter; Setup and operation of floor-stand Sterilisation-in-Place (SIP) fermentation system; Cultivation and harvesting of bacteria mass; AQP protein extraction, purification and characterisation; Production of proteolipsome; Purity analysis and quality control; Analyses and documentation of data/findings for project meetings and progress reports; Manage project administration and funding; and Manage project procurement.  Pre-requisites:  At least 3 years of relevant research experience in microbiology science which includes preparation and presentation of reports and findings Experience in bacterial cultivation, protein purification and processes optimisation  Check out the details of the position and submit online at https://applyjobs.np.edu.sg. Be part of an institution with that something xtra. We thank all applicants for their interest. Shortlisted candidates will be notified within 2 - 3 weeks after the closing date.

company: SINGAPORE-MIT ALLIANCE FOR RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY CENTRE
job_title: Postdoctoral Associate / Research Scientist - Behavioral Modeling
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesProject Overview Part of the FM research agenda involves the development of the SimMobility platform for the microsimulation of land use and transportation interactions.   SimMobility is an agent-based simulator that links together various mobility-sensitive behavioral models with state-of-the-art simulators to predict impacts of mobility demands, infrastructure changes, and evolving transportation options on the deployment and delivery of people, firms, services and freight.  This particular Postdoctoral Associate will focus on the so-called ‘long-term’ module of SimMobility. The behavioral models in the long-term, agent-based simulator address household residential choice, vehicle availability, firm location and real-estate markets in a manner that is tightly integrated with an activity-based ‘mid-term’ model that estimates agent-specific ‘logsum’ accessibility measures for simulated daily activity patterns. The overall scope of FM research includes a number of projects on the development, and analysis of new and advanced forms of mobility options (such as on-demand mobility and autonomous vehicles), as well as on their urban planning and management implications.  Both FM, and the SMART Centre, encourage exploration of new ideas and the use of ‘big data’ to advance our understanding of behavioral choices, urban activity patterns and the adoption of new forms of mobility. Responsibilities Depending upon project assignment and postdoc skills and interests, the specific responsibilities will involve some combination of the following:  Enhancing, estimating and calibrating the behavioral models in the long-term simulator, Generating and updating synthetic populations of residents, firms, and workers for particular cities at various points in time, Performing complex data analysis and integration of geospatial datasets, Contributing to the design and initiation of new research projects and ideas related to household and firm behavior as new options evolve for urban mobility and freight delivery, Presenting research results at international workshops, conferences, and exhibits as well as at internal project meetings, Co-authoring articles for publication in top-tier, peer-reviewed journals and conferences, and Monitoring the progress of project components, supervising PhD students, and regularly meeting with Principle Investigators.
requirements: RequirementsThe successful candidate must hold a doctoral degree in Urban Planning, Transportation Engineering, Econometrics or a related field. Candidates with experience in urban modeling and data science will have an added advantage. Additionally, they should enjoy working in a multidisciplinary team environment that values problem solving skills and creativity.  Advanced skill and experience in data processing and analysis is required. Expertise in agent-based modeling, urban-scale transport modeling; and/or behavioral economics and real-estate markets is desired. Knowledge of urban economics, discrete choice models, geoprocessing, and database management is expected. Experience with programming in scientific languages (e.g. Python and R) is necessary. Familiarity with object-oriented programming languages (e.g. C++ and Java) is desired. Independent thinking and innovative scientific accomplishments demonstrated via published papers is expected. Outstanding oral and written communication skills in English is required.  The Postdoctoral Associate will work with an integrated team of faculty, researchers and students from MIT and Singapore University partners, including (among others): Professors Joseph Ferreira, Christopher Zegras, and Moshe Ben-Akiva of MIT. Interested applicants should submit the following:  A motivation letter (one or two pages) stating the applicant's interest in working with the Lab, research areas and/or projects of particular relevance, key competencies, and anticipated date of availability, A full CV, including degrees, relevant projects and positions with dates, and key relevant publications (up to 5), and Names and contact information of three references.    We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesActive control of light at the nanoscale is an important and challenging goal to bring into reality the next-generation of spatial light modulators with sub-wavelength resolution. This task is currently under development at the Institute of Materials Research and Engineering using the novel concepts of resonant dielectric nanoantennas, within the framework of an inter-disciplinary project involving different A*STAR RIs and Singaporean Universities. We are looking for a strong candidate to work on the nanofabrication aspects of the project, who will be in charge of the nanofabrication processes as well as of the nanoscale characterization of fabricated samples. A strong track of record in the fabrication of nanoantennas, nanophotonic and optoelectronic devices is preferable.  The job will include fabrication of nanoantennas based on semiconductor or/and dielectric materials to be integrated in switchable cells for active control of light propagation and characteristics at the nanoscale. The job will involve, as well, working as a part of a large team, including project members with different science and engineering backgrounds, such as electronics, advanced optical packaging and device engineering and system integration.
requirements: Requirements- PhD in physics or engineering  - 3 years experience (including PhD studies) - The candidate should be an experimentalist with a strong expertise in nanofabrication techniques as well as in nanoscale characterization techniques such as Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM).  - The candidate should have, preferably, experience and knowledge in the area of nanophotonics, including nanoantennas and metasurfaces.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are looking for research scientists to join a team looking into developing hardware accelerators for AI/Deep Learning applications and the related tool chains (e.g. compiler/driver). There are plenty of opportunities to participate in the design and implementation of hardware accelerators for AI/Deep Learning applications and the upstream and downstream toolchains.
requirements: Requirements Ph.D degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering / Electrical and Electronics Engineering is required for the candidates. Programming in C/C++ and Python TensorFlow LLVM compiler framework Computer architecture design FPGA development with Verilog/VHDL, Xilinx HLS or SDSoC Good communication skills and team player

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResearch Scientists in the Proteomics Group are responsible for innovating process analytical technology (PAT) in biopharmaceuticals, food and nutrition bioprocessing. The position is required to develop and utilize liquid-chromatography-mass spectrometry (LC-MS)-based techniques for the comprehensive proteome profiling of biological systems, and characterization and quality attributes analysis of therapeutic and nutrition proteins. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAppointments will be for a 3-year initial period with future prospects of a permanent position. The Centre for Climate Research Singapore (CCRS) is a research institute focusing on a number of weather and climate research areas which are of importance to Singapore and the wider Southeast Asian region. The centre is well supported with long-term core funding from the Singapore Government. In addition to the establishment of a number of research positions, a dedicated CRAY XC-40 has been installed to support modelling activities. The Centre also supports research groups in Singapore with external project funding. In the climate area there are four main threads to the existing and future research activities:  The generation of climate scenarios for Singapore and the Southeast Asian region. In 2015 a major climate assessment project was completed and currently CCRS is embarking on a new assessment project to be delivered in the next few years. This project involves the regional downscaling of global model projections to a finer resolution over Singapore and Southeast Asia and a scientific evaluation of the results. Sea level rise is a vital aspect of climate change for Singapore and a dedicated National Sea Level Project has been initiated at CCRS. Current and future work involves an in-depth analysis of the key results coming from climate change projections and a scientific understanding of the mechanisms governing climate change. The fundamental understanding of climate processes and mechanisms that are of first order importance to Singapore and the wider Southeast Asian region. These include tropical convection, monsoon dynamics, MJO and the role of remote tele-connections from ENSO and IOD. Working with global centres, we are also developing our capabilities in sub-seasonal to seasonal prediction for the Southeast Asian region. A better characterisation and understanding of decadal climate variability and the drivers of changes in extreme weather in the region is needed. Fundamental research in this area is part of the research programme at CCRS. Climate change impacts on water resources, human health, biodiversity, food security and the energy sector. These research areas will be pursued in collaboration with research groups in Singapore universities and research institutes.  We are looking for a team leader for the climate area to both develop and lead the science programme and to grow the group. We are seeking established scientists with an international reputation and a strong background in climate research. The specific job responsibilities will include:  Lead and line-manage the research team that is working to better understand and predict climate variability and change in Southeast Asia Undertake and publish their own research in topics important to the region Develop research plans for the climate research activities Provide scientific/technical guidance and training to team members Ensure the appropriate external representation of the centre’s climate work via national and international conferences and workshops Collaborate nationally and internationally with key institutions that lead in associated climate research activities. There is also the possibility of developing an affiliated academic position with local universities. Engage in an advisory capacity with national level stakeholders who are responsible for climate change policy and planning  Requirements  A PhD (or equivalent research experience) in a relevant physical science such as meteorology, oceanography, mathematics or physics At least 10 years of post-doctoral research experience, with a proven record of success as demonstrated by publications in peer-reviewed journals Demonstrated ability to inspire, lead and manage a team of PhD level researchers and technical experts Experience from participating in large research consortia Good written and verbal presentation skills  It is an advantage to have  Familiarity with tropical/Maritime Continent processes Experience of leading large scale research consortia

job_title: Research Fellow / Scientist, Postdoctoral Fellow & Equivalent
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Monocrystalline Silicon Wafer Solar Cell Group focuses on the research and development of cost-effective high-efficiency (> 22%) solar cells that are suitable for high-volume manufacturing. Full-size p-type and n-type Cz silicon wafers are used as substrates and processed into either monofacial or bifacial solar cells. Selected research topics of the group include silicon surface passivation, silicon bulk passivation, ultrathin layers and new materials for passivated contacts, liquid based novel dielectrics, alternative doping technologies (e.g. ion implantation and doped thin films), solar cell optics, laser processing and advanced metallisation.   Design and plan activities required to fabricate large-area high efficiency (>21%) p-type & n-type monocrystalline silicon wafer solar cells.   Research focusing on the following:               -  Performing design-of-experiments (DOE) to obtain optimised junction profiles (homogeneous & selective) - diffused/ion-implanted/CVD doped layers             -  Integration of passivated contacts for large-area high efficiency industrial solar cells             - Advanced metallisation concepts for achieving high conversion efficiency             - Advanced characterisation and power loss/gain analysis of silicon wafer solar cells             - Effectively contribute in the project team(s) for solar cell efficiency improvements             - Effectively plan & communicate ideas and results to the team  Assist the group with processing and characterisation services for various company-funded and public-funded projects.
requirements: Requirements PhD Degree in Physics, Electrical Engineering or Materials Sciences, with specialization in Silicon photovoltaics or Microelectronics.   Minimum 3 years of experience in silicon wafer solar cell fabrication and characterizations or other relevant experience.   Researchers with prior experience on development of large area silicon wafer solar cells will be preferred.   Required to work in semiconductor clean room and characterisation lab.   Expertise in DOE softwares, AutoCAD or relevant grid design tools.   Excellent written and verbal communication (in English) skills required.   Regular, reliable and predictable attendance required.   Ability to work well with others in a collaborative team environment.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Immunology Group of Bioprocessing Technology Institute (BTI) is seeking two highly motivated individuals for postdoctoral positions to conduct exciting research in genetic engineering of T cells for therapy against cancer and scale-up bioproduction of engineered T cells. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesCOMPANY DESCRIPTION NTUC Enterprise is the holding entity and single largest shareholder of the NTUC Social Enterprises. NTUC Enterprise aims to create a greater social force to do good by harnessing the capabilities of the social enterprises to meet pressing social needs in areas like health and eldercare, childcare, daily essentials, cooked food and financial services. Serving over two million customers, NTUC Enterprise wants to enable and empower all in Singapore to live better and more meaningful lives. RESPONSIBILITIES The rapid adoption of technology and mobile devices have contributed to vast new flows of information which are larger in volume, faster in velocity, diverse in variety, and requires veracity of the information for use. This new type of information composed of structured and unstructured data, broadly known as big data (and combined with tools and platforms), if utilised well, could radically improve business performance. Data Governance Officer - He/she will manage all data governance activities and will have responsibility for improving the quality and managing the protection of sensitive data and information assets, respond to regulatory protection requirements. The position will focus on establishing an enterprise data governance framework for data policies, standards and practices. Facilitate the development and implementation of data quality standards, data protection standards and adoption requirements across the enterprise. Define indicators of performance and quality metrics and ensure compliance with data related policies, standards, roles and responsibilities, and adoption requirements. Responsibilities:  Design, build and implement the organisation data governance framework. Create and maintain data governance and or data management reporting. Prepare, maintain and present data quality reports. Formulate techniques for quality data collection to ensure adequacy, accuracy and legitimacy of data. Ensure processes and controls are in place. Roll out the relevant data governance framework and policies to various departments, which include obtaining buy-ins from relevant stakeholders to embed operational processes to support the policy objectives. Perform regular review of the data governance framework and policies to ensure they areupdated to meet changing organisational needs. Contribute in terms of best practices and thought leadership in Data Governance & Strategy, and in executing enterprise-wide data governance tasks. Create and maintain common data dictionaries and the tools/methods that support data standards for the organization. Assist with data monitoring and provide organizational management with guidance on streamlining data management.
requirements: RequirementsRequirements:  Relevant years’ experience in enterprise data governance and management. Experience in data analysis, including inspection, cleansing, understanding and transforming data. Experience in operationalising Data Governance, Data Stewardship and Data Quality, including good understanding of good management practices and data risk and regulatory issues. Well organised and disciplined in maintaining documentation. Familiar in working with SQL, databases, data structures and data modelling concept. Strong inter-personal and people leadership skills to interact with diverse stakeholders.  Preferred technical skills:  Data architecture and data modeling Data Warehouse design ETL/ELT implementation and data integration

Proven management skills in managing day-to-day operations. Strong stakeholder engagement and interpersonal skills.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesFull Stack Developer #123887 Credit Suisse Company Overview Credit Suisse is a leading global wealth manager with strong investment banking and asset management capabilities. Founded in 1856, Credit Suisse has expanded to be a global force employing over 45,000 people in 50 countries. With new leadership, a new strategy and a streamlined global organization, we are set for growth. We partner across businesses, divisions and regions to create innovative solutions to meet the needs of our clients—and to help our employees grow. It is a high priority for us to continually invest in our employees by providing ongoing opportunities for training, networking and mobility. Join us and let's shape the future of Credit Suisse together.   Further information can be found at www.credit-suisse.com We offer... Department Overview: The APAC Technology and Change organization is responsible for the engineering and support of technology solutions, implementation of change programs, and the associated change, design and data governance for the APAC Division. The organization includes APAC Private Banking (PB) IT and Global Markets (GM) IT. APAC PB IT provides digital capabilities and technology solutions for the APAC Private Banking business, delivering front to back aligned, high quality IT solutions and services to support the growth and profitability of the Bank, ensure compliance, drive efficiency and further reduce complexity and cost. Our Digital Private Bank was launched in Asia in 2015 and has won numerous accolades. We have been awarded the "Best Private Bank – Digital Experience" for the second consecutive year by Asian Private Banker applauding us for being "a true fintech pioneer in the private banking space" and for our attention to client experience and the platform's advanced functionalities. Role Description: A number of new and exciting projects have been initiated within APAC PB IT, enabling you to directly contribute to the success of the business. Naturally, project details are commercially-sensitive but all our projects exhibit the following common features:  Significant engagement with product owners and user-interaction Technical autonomy and innovation Highly motivated and engaged development teams High quality and commercial benefits  As an agile application developer you will work together with business users and members of the development team to provide quality systems that improve productivity, decrease operational risk, enable the business to expand and make users smile. These are high profile applications that offer you the opportunity to shape the future technical direction and take ownership for functional components. Role Responsibility:  Design, develop, test, deploy and support high quality systems. Become a strategic part of the CS business by building positive relationships with all business partners, understanding the challenges they face and using your technical expertise to deliver the systems we need. Collaborate with the Product Owner closely to deliver solutions and to build user-centric banking applications for use by Clients/Relationship Managers/Support functions around the world. Understand the different technology domains within the Bank and how the data across domains is interrelated. Constantly analyze and improve the performance and quality of the product and team. Be willing and able to adapt to changes in priorities and requirements. Remain open and alert to new technology opportunities.
requirements: RequirementsYou Offer… We have a preference for the following knowledge and experience:  Expertise with Java or any other JVM-based language Expertise with SQL, RDBMS design and optimization Expertise in JavaScript full stack development (e.g. React and Node.js) Expertise with HTML5 and CSS3 Expertise with JUnit, TestNG or any other test framework Strong knowledge of HTTP and (REST) API design Working knowledge of MongoDB or other NoSQL databases  We expect these qualifications and work experience:  Your Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Computer Engineering or related discipline is preferred but not required. You have significant work experience in commercial software development, full stack web frameworks and exposure to more recent technologies. You have theoretical foundations as well as practical experience designing and implementing distributed systems. You should have a real passion for and experience of Agile working practices like Scrum, with a strong dream to work with baked-in quality disciplines such as TDD, BDD, test automation and DevOps principles. You have attested ability to work well in delivering complex systems in a dynamic changing environment. You have the ability to develop intuitive and robust user interfaces which improves user experience.  We value these characteristics:  Pragmatism. You have a deep understanding of, and are highly informed by, the purist approaches. You also have an understanding of what it takes to deliver working software. Completion. Delivery. Shipping working software with high usability to our customers is what matters most. Your biggest thrill from a big new idea comes when you see it working in the real world. Collaboration. Building software is primarily a social activity so you will play well with others. Determining the right thing for the team to do is not about winning a debate at all expenses. Diversity. You value everyone's ideas, background, thoughts and culture. Curiosity. You like to learn. You continually, and deliberately, learn. Passion. You are passionate about software. You live and breathe software. It is not just a job, it is a way of life.    EEO statement                                                        Credit Suisse is an equal opportunity employer. Welcoming diversity gives us a competitive advantage in the global marketplace and drives our success

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Dathena Science Dathena is a Swiss and Singaporean company developing data governance software based on machine learning algorithms. Dathena is the most complete and accurate data governance platform and is the only solution to easily classify and manage data with this level of accuracy while helping companies to comply with regulations. Using cutting edge machine learning technology, Dathena sift through all unstructured data allowing to regain full control on company’s information. Job Purpose As a Cloud Operations Engineer, you will maintain reliable infrastructure so that our R&D and Product Teams can build solutions that solve our clients and partners' hardest problems and can be counted on when they are needed most. You will work collaboratively with Software and A.I. engineers to understand what they need to get their jobs done. You care deeply about the availability and security of our systems, and configuration as code is your tool for ensuring that everything is operating as it should. Core Responsability  Manage and secure Linux-based cloud systems and networks at scale. Work with tools to automate critical aspects of production systems such as: configuration management and deployment of infrastructure. Maintain the stability and performance of the cloud platform. Utilize the latest industry standard tools and practices to meet the evolving needs of our internal engineers/developers and external clients/partners.
requirements: RequirementsTechnologies We Use  Languages: Python, Scala, and Java Systems Management: Terraform, Docker, Ansible, and Puppet Cloud Platforms: Azure, AWS and GCP Linux: CentOS (7)  What We Value  1-2 years experience in a similar role, or related technical field Coding/scripting fluency in at least one language and a commitment to automate solutions Experience with Linux systems from the kernel level and up Experience with configuration management solutions Ability to quickly take on new roles and responsibilities Track record of successfully deploying and running configuration management systems Desire to see features through from development to deployment in production environments

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities The Client Solutions Manager is part of Dathena’s Operations Team. The Client Solutions Manager will be responsible for leading, managing, and developing a team which focuses on the European delivery of Dathena’s products through our leveraged partnership model.   As the Client Solutions Manager, you will act as a trusted Subject Matter Expert to our partners and clients to ensure they remain successful and realize the full value of their investment in our products.    On Customer front  Responsible for the end to end delivery and sales process for his/her European set of customers Drive the internal and Partners’ stakeholders along the sales cycle from assessment phase to closing of subscription Engage with prospects in “consultative selling” mode at CxO levels to federate key customer stakeholders and ensure they’re a driving force for Dathena’s implementation Define rules of engagement with Partner and ensure Partner’s professional services offering is in line with defined Professional Services templates Lead the team to take corrective action when needed to accelerate sales cycle. Update management with status and MI on a consistent basis As a trusted business matter expert in Dathena, constantly provide effective operational guidance around these technologies to our client platforms & partner vendor. Assisting them in the assessment of project risks and controls for better data governance and protection. Educating on the value of the overall solution and encourage optimal utilization. Give constant and structured feedback to Dathena’s R&D team to improve the solution New features which will increase value and reduce cost of compliance related activities for clients New tools to accelerate sales cycle (reduce assessment type, pre-defined pattern of customers, …)  Partner Enablement responsibilities  Contribute to Partner selection (in various segment Consulting firms, System Integrators, Resellers, ISVs) to optimize skills and geographical coverage Ensure and control Partners enablement on Dathena’s technology. Co-design, coordinate and control our Partners Professional Services, and manage our channel partners in delivering high value-added solutions to our clients. Help partners in their day-to-day sales activities and delivering innovative and scalable solutions to meet their business needs. Channel customers’ technical platform feedback to the Dathena product team. Assist in prioritizing product requirements and platform improvements by understanding and communicating customer needs.  Key Metrics  Customer and Partner satisfaction End to end sales cycle time % of conversion to subscription Size of user base in subscription as a % of total number of employees Reduction of Dathena’s resources involvement as compared to Partners’
requirements: Requirements At least 5 years of experience in IT Risk Management including experience in Cybersecurity & Privacy. Minimum Degree Required: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance/Economics, Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, Statistics Mathematics, Regulatory Compliance, Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics and/or other business fields of study. Certification(s) Preferred: Obtained or demonstrates an active pursuit of one or more of the following certifications: Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) certifications, or other related certifications. Knowledge Preferred: Demonstrates extensive knowledge of and/or proven level of success in developing and implementing cybersecurity, privacy and IT risk strategies, preferably for a global network of professional services firms. Common cybersecurity, privacy or technology industry standards/ regulations (e.g. ISO 27001/27002, NIST 800 series, COBIT, PCI-DSS, ITIL, HIPAA / HITECH, GDPR) especially as it relates to building a program and/or managing internal controls, risk assessments, business process and internal IT control testing or operational auditing; Providing consultancy services for cybersecurity, privacy or IT risk strategy, policies, organization and governance;

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJob title: Full Stack Developer                Reports to: Solution Architect                  About Dathena Science   Dathena is a Swiss and Singaporean company developing data governance software based on artificial intelligence algorithms. Dathena is the most complete and accurate data governance and classification platform and is the only solution to easily classify and manage data with this level of accuracy while helping companies to comply with regulations. Using cutting edge machine learning technology, Dathena sift through all unstructured data allowing to regain full control on company’s information.   We are looking for a Full Stack Developer for a permanent position or an internship to work with us and our partners to improve our leading technology in managing the confidentiality of information of our Fortune 500 clients.   Job Purpose:  Full Stack Developer, keen to develop web/cloud-oriented and big data technologies, and integrate new libraries / framework into our codebase. Bring the knowledge and curiosity in Dathena to develop big data applications. Live your passion for software development in exciting Data Science and Cybersecurity projects and be inspired by your colleagues' enthusiasm.
requirements: RequirementsResponsibilities:   You will implement sophisticated product development projects for the enterprise and cloud environments using modern, agile project methods within the Dathena Development & Engineering team. You will efficiently and competently solve tricky software challenges, because continuous further development and active knowledge exchange mean that you will be working with the latest methods and tools and always be on trend. As a Full Stack Developer, you will cooperate with interdisciplinary teams in projects and experience how technology and team spirit unite to create innovative solutions and work closely with our team of data scientists, researchers and developers to implement the state of the art.  Skills and Qualifications:  Python 3+ JavaScript: React & Node.JS Message queues (RabbitMQ / ZeroMQ) Database design & usage (MySQL / PostgreSQL) Used to develop and deploy on Ubuntu and/or OSX Celery is a plus Django / MVC is a plus Docker is a plus  Soft Skills:  Fluent in English Data-oriented personality Time management Interpersonal Skills Critical Thinking Proactive and interested in A.I., Big Data and cyber-security, the candidate should be able to implement good security practices. New tools are available every day, some of them could improve our overall environment. The Full Stack Developer has to be lazy in a smart way: everything should be automated with as little human interaction as possible  Working Conditions:  The Full Stack Developer must fully embrace the team spirit of a young and innovative Start-up. They must be able to adapt to a multi-cultural environment. Travel and remote location might be required.     Location: Singapore

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesKey Job Purpose:   To control and monitor sales performance, forecasts and product gross profit drivers. Assist Sales Analysis and Pricing Manager in implementing new analysis tools and reports that facilitates management understanding of the business situation. Assist Sales Analysis and Pricing Manager in transfer price computations and obtain the necessary approvals from Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Assist CFO in computation and review of Floor Prices used in quotation system. Data Governance Steward for product master for the region and Singapore. Sales related administrational activities.    Responsibilities:  (i) Sales Performance Monitoring   Prepares and provides sales performance analysis that considers all of key accounts/customers Monitors year-to-date sales vs forecast vs budget Calculate sales incentive based on Sysmex Asia Pacific Sales Incentive Plan Policy To assist Sales Department with preparation of Minimum Purchase Agreement, Distributor performance tracking Tracking tender status through the various stages of tender up to realization of sales  (ii) Sales Forecasting  Manages the submission of sales forecasts to the regional management thru business planning process in collaboration with Sales, Business Partners, Marketing and Supply Chain.  (iii) Product Gross Profit Analysis  Review drivers of product gross profits on monthly basis Present such analysis to CFO for review and management decision making.  2. Transfer Pricing Computations  Support Sales Analysis and Pricing Manager in reviewing market data provided by marketing team. Draft initial transfer price computation for Manager’s review. Obtain approvals from CFO for the transfer prices.  3. Floor Prices Computation  Review and analyse incidences of quote values falling below floor prices values and determine the cause. Together with CFO, compute the right floor prices to achieve the management objective of improving gross profits whilst increasing market share.  4. Data Governance Steward for Product Master Data  Ensure all product master data maintenance requests are validated prior to creation by Shared Service Center (SSC) Ensure that SSC maintain the product master data in a timely manner. Regularly review processes to ensure efficiency.  5. Reporting  Sales forecast report to Finance Consolidation of Quarterly Progress Report Updating Sysmex Asia Pacific sales results in Monthly Progress Report and other administrative request such as preparation of pro-forma invoice and calculating sales commissions. Report requirements from Sysmex Corporation (sales forecast, instruments by main units etc.) Consolidation of SMIS (Prepare templates and send out by 13th of the month, and consolidation from 23rd onwards.  6. Price Management  Preparation of Price List for Distributors (yearly) and Affiliates (twice a year).  This includes a review with respective Marketing managers to ensure discontinued products are removed from price list. Update of price lists as and when there are new products announced Update of price lists as and when there are new products announced Coordinate Annual Standard Price & PIR Update for the region  7. Security Trade Compliance (STC)  As a key personnel for administering Security Trade Compliance protocol in SAP system for the region, STC responsibilities include processing of GTS block for customer and product classifications, screening of new customers, providing systems support and training to all affiliates on STC related issues.  8. General Administration  Announcements via sharepoint – product related (new launch, discontinuation), price related (new price setting, transfer price adjustment)

We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Technology Group (TG) is a key enabler to keep our business moving forward and is constantly exploiting state-of-the-art information technologies to enhance GIC’s ability to be the leading global long-term investment firm. We aim to provide users with empowering and transformational capabilities, and to create an inclusive, innovative and integrated work environment. We are looking for a suitable candidate to join the Research and Market Data Management unit as part of the Data Governance & Management team within TG to play a part in shaping GIC’s strategic, long-term vision of establishing itself as a data-driven organisation. This role will be based on a 1-year contract with the option to extend if required.  Responsibilities:  Work closely with business end-users to implement and support data solutions using best-of-breed technology and methodology. Conduct data management work including data quality checks, job management, ops process improvement, bug fixes and downstream notification. Analyze, tackle and resolve day-to-day operational incidents and advisory to business users. Analyze operations data (SLAs, customer satisfaction, delivery quality etc.) to identify actionable trends for continual improvements.

Possess relevant working experience in data management, preferably in an investment and banking environment. Experience working with enterprise databases using database technologies (eg. PL/SQL, SQL, NoSQL). Experience in programming language (eg. Python). Passion for data and technology. Good team player, with strong analytical skills and enjoy complex problem solving with innovative ideas. Strong communication/people skills required to interact with business end-users. Good at working with details and is meticulous for operations. job_description: Roles & Responsibilities*Renewable Contract Job Purpose  Reporting to Asia Pacific Analytic COE Head in China, the incumbent who is based in Singapore, will be part of the team to support the China Asia Pacific project team in terms of maintenance of project management activities and documentation, the execution of some activities during the different project phases. The project are dealing with the following areas : controlling / FP&A (forecast, budget, reporting processes), master data governance and data analysis, TM1 system implementation ; Digital transformation (RPA, NJG, predictive analytics, etc.), Change management. In the frame of the set- up of the Analytic COE, the VIE position will be assigned activities related “Run”, i.e. services to perform / support to the internal customers. Responsibilities Reporting and Project monitoring activities   Together with the Project Management Office (PMO) ensure project information, including project status reports & milestones plans, are effectively maintained and communicated to relevant stakeholders through:   Manage the update of project status reports with the Project Team Consolidate project status reports & milestones plans for key stakeholders and follow-up if necessary    Supporting activities   Together with the Project Management Office ensure the project team are supported and assisted with:   Supporting project managers in day-to-day tasks, including analysis, presentations and ad-hoc requests from the management Scheduling and preparing project meetings/events for the project team o Supporting the preparation of project meeting and workshops (agenda, logistic of the meeting, presentation deck, minutes, etc.) Contributing to analysis to be conducted in the project and to the formalization of deliverables (Project document, SOPs, training materials, etc.) Participating to various activities falling in the Design, implementation, testing, change management and post go-live phases of the Analytic COE Actively participating to Proof of Concept phases on Digital tools   Carry out specific projects activities related to the topics mentioned above (FP&A, Master data, data analysis, TM1 related activities, Digital transformation initiatives. job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Cybersecurity & Technology Controls group at JPMorgan Chase aligns the firm’s cybersecurity, access management, controls and resiliency teams. The group proactively and strategically  partners with all lines of business and functions to enable them to design, adopt and integrate appropriate controls; deliver processes and solutions efficiently and consistently; and drive automation of controls. The group’s number one priority is to enable the business by keeping the firm safe, stable and resilient. The AWM Cybersecurity Technology Control team is in place to support in the identification, assessment, and management of technology risk and controls across Asset & Wealth Management. Our Technology Risk and Control Officers work with our AWM technology teams to design, implement, and assess controls designed to protect the Firm's information and supporting technology platforms.  We aim to balance sound control with efficiency, through smart process and automation.  Key deliverables and responsibilities supported by our global and regional Cybersecurity and technology Control team that would be extended to this role include but are not limited to the following; •Managing risk assessment processes to help our technology teams, control partners, and business stakeholders understand the state of our technology and data control suite, and from there, work together to prioritize and remediate identified gaps •Spearheading key initiatives across the whole of Asset & Wealth Management to strengthen key controls •Overseeing key operational controls to ensure ongoing operating effectiveness •Providing advisory services in shaping next generation controls, and engaging with Internal Audit, Legal and Compliance, and other groups as necessary to support reviews of our control environment •Assisting technology teams to drive accelerated development throughout AWM Technology and in particular offer guidance and support in relation to SDLC and Cloud adoption •Offer support in data governance and data protection including key regulatory programs
requirements: Requirements Qualifications •Experience in technology or technology risk management, preferably for financial institution or strong background in risk advisory •Demonstrated capability of designing and implementing data and/or access management programs •Track record of implementing successful risk or technology management solutions •Track record of developing and maintaining senior-level stakeholder relationships •Must be a self-starter and self-motivated and be able to prioritize accordingly depending on demands from technology teams, business and regulatory •Be comfortable talking to development teams and offering risk opinions We strongly encourage all applicants to apply via our careers website where you are able join our Talent Network to receive customized vacancy notifications and ensure that your details are accessible by our global recruiting team - www.jpmorganchase.com/careers. A quick link to this particular job posting can be found in this URL: http://jobs.jpmorganchase.com/ListJobs/ByKeyword/190025435/ Please note that only short-listed candidates will be notified. We thank you for your interest and wish you all the best in your career. Yours Sincerely, Human Resources JPMorgan

job_title: Assistant Director /  Senior Executive (Curriculum Planning and Analytics), Centre for Learning Systems
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAn Overview of the Branch   The Centre for Learning Systems focuses on: - (i) Professional development of Home Team Trainers by institutionalizing quality training frameworks, policies and programmes; (ii) Identification of suitable learning technologies to facilitate learning in the Home Team, including the development of a single learning platform such as the Home Team Learning Management System to cultivate a learning-centric environment; (iii) Drive the acquisition of assessment and evaluation expertise across the Home Team to ensure programme robustness in support of Home Team’s needs; and (iv) Development of professional and academic pathways to support officers’ continuous upgrading and achievement of higher level of professional and academic qualifications.   The Job   The incumbent will be responsible for developing and implementing training analytics projects. This includes the definition of tasks, implementation of projects, generation and construction of results and models, interpretation of findings, recommendation of deployment, and facilitation of deployment. These contribute to HTA’s strategic thrust in ‘Training and Learning’ and the achieving of Good and Effective Learning or GEL@HTA.   Reporting Structure   The incumbent will report to Deputy Director, Centre for Learning Systems.      Main responsibilities   1. Design, develop and implement analytics projects:   (i) Design analytics projects to meet specified objectives, including conceptualising and developing workflow and processes for data management and statistical analysis. (ii) Importing, cleaning, transforming, validating and exploring data to facilitate meaningful analysis. (iii) Design new data models and enhance existing ones. (iv) Implement analytics projects, including performing appropriate mining from structured and unstructured data, resolving complex modelling problems, interpreting results and making recommendations to address training and learning issues. (v) Prepare reports/papers and presentation materials, as well as make presentations to stakeholders. (vi) Work with internal stakeholders to pilot potential applications of data.   2. Drive seamless integration of system processes to facilitate end to end execution/automation of analytics:   (i) Design dashboards and interactive visualisation tools for data exploration. (ii) Gather user requirements for dashboards, data warehouse and systems. (iii) Develop user specifications for all systems in the analytics process. (iv) Draft and staff up procurement papers (e.g. Approval of Requirements, Schedule of Requirements) for approval. (v) Manage the procurement process (e.g. ITQ / ITT) and ensure that each milestone is achieved on schedule. (vi) Evaluate bids from vendors and render administrative support to the Evaluation Committee. (vii) Facilitate testing of prototypes, including managing the involvement of users. (viii) Work with stakeholders to ensure smooth deployment and adoption of new system/ solution. (ix) Manage budget for projects, including making requests, forecasting expenditure and tracking payment / balances.   3. Ensure data collected and utilised adhere to data governance regulations required of government agencies:   (i) Develop training and learning data management and governance strategy and framework to ensure data quality and integrity. (ii) Standardise data definition and manage data issues resolution.         Requirements   a) Knowledge and skills  Academic background preferably with research-based and/or in Statistics/Computer Science/Mathematics/Engineering/Data Science Proficient in the use of various statistical analysis software (e.g. STAT, SPSS, SAS, R-programming) Experience coding application with C/C#/C+, Visual Basic, Java Programming, Python programming will be an advantage.  b) Experience  At least 5 years of working experience in data analysis, mining and reporting Good expertise in extracting, cleaning and analysing data from raw sources.  c) Attributes  Ability to think in the abstract and conceptualise from literature and empirical data Organised, adaptable, meticulous individual with excellent analytical and problem solving skills Ability to communicate complex concepts in applied and practical manner in emerging situations to diverse stakeholder groups Ability to effectively engage both internal and external stakeholders.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPosition Purpose & Summary   Cargill Ocean Transportation (OT) is a leader in chartering, trading, logistics, operations and risk management of ocean freight solutions. We are committed to safety, high quality and risk management solutions that ensure our customers cargoes arrive safely, on time and in good condition. Our global coverage across all major oceans allows us to develop customer-oriented solutions that focus on connecting commerce across a wide variety of commodities.   Along with Cargill’s global commodity expertise and insight in agriculture, energy, industrial and mineral industries, Cargill Ocean Transportation is able to provide complementary trade flows, logistics supply chain expertise and financial stability. We provide commodity and market expertise, physical freight, risk management services, custom solutions and ship vetting.   We offer a unique and exceptional learning curve opportunity within the ocean freight business. During your 18 months assignment, we will provide you with a rotating program to cultivate and fast track trainees who aspire to build foundational merchandising and trading capabilities in dry bulk shipping.   Principal Accountabilities Spend time on different desks and departments such as Trading, Risk Management, Vessel Operations and Analytics. Responsibilities include and not limited to: • 10%-Develop and maintain customer relationships when working on the Freight Trading desks • 20%-Learn about the Trade Capture process and the importance of the trading contract and charter party clauses • 20%-Analyze supply and demand, survey market conditions, and other economic forces in order to maintain and grow Cargill's position in the market place when working on the Analytics desk • 5%-Initiate, negotiate and agree on terms of commodity purchase/sale contracts, such as price, quality, quantity, transportation, timing and payment • 10%-Coordinate transportation and logistics to execute commodity contracts • 10%-Ensure thorough and accurate follow-up, execution, and closure of all contracts • 5%-Work on daily, weekly and months Risk Management reports and statistics • 15%-Timely and effective communication and interaction with other OT teams such as Risk Management, Analytics, Operations, Finance and Trading • 5%-Other projects and assignments as assigned

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe selected candidate will join the Risk Policy & Analytics team. Reporting to the Head of Risk Policy & Analytics, this position is responsible for innovation and critical thinking with deliverables relating to SGX risk management policies.  We are looking for bright individual who is able to work in a group and build relationships within SGX and with the industry as a whole.   Key Accountabilities      Coding, code control, testing, “big-data” and data visualization.  Develop, test and deploy risk tools in-line with end user development roadmap led by Risk policy   Collaborate with internal and external stake holders to deliver projects   Assist in architecting and building out infrastructure to facilitate risk visualization and quant work.    Position Deliverables    The candidate is expected to:  Have strong hands-on experience with development using Python. Ability to work on individual projects as well as contribute to development projects taken up by the team. Good understanding of software development life-cycle, documentation and governance requirement. Familiarity with different type of databases, including time-series databases. Experience with different tools for visualization of large data sets like Tableau, Qlikview, Plotly etc Comfortable using source control systems (GIT) and ensure that the practices are in line with best practices, Assist in setting up test cases and debugging of code, and Assist in architecting and building out infrastructure to facilitate risk visualization and quant work.
requirements: Requirements Degree (or comparable experience) in computer science, engineering, mathematics or statistics. We are looking for experience of programming, preferably in Python. Coding experience from languages other than Python (we also have some R and Java codes) is welcomed and a suitable candidate would embrace new tools and languages. Proven coding skills is a definite plus, either from previous work experience and/or open source contributions. Ability to work with “big-data”, and preference for someone with system architectural experience from working in a quant shop. The applicant should be able to estimate how the code and architecture would scale as number of input factors grows and throughput is increased. Ability to work with a modern tool stack, and also motivate and drive other team members towards better practises. Current tool stack includes the use of GIT and Python, but an applicant should be open to continuously improvements. Familiarity with financial markets and risk is a plus but not an absolute requirement. Fluent with both written and verbal communication.                                            Essential Attributes   Curious personality and is eager to learn new things. The ability to have a high level view as well as drive to dive down to deepest level of an issue to understand root cause is essential. Positive attitude and willingness to change. Coding competency in Python. Understanding of databases.

business  Digital Strategy: Experience in the business application of technology, an analytical and rigorous approach, business case experience, ability to turn data into insightful executive
