job_title: Aladdin Business, Aladdin Client Engagement, Vice President
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Aladdin Client Engagement (ACE) group manages the partnerships formed with each BlackRock Solutions client and is the trusted advisor, problem solver and business partner to Aladdin clients.  They are the key point of contact and are charged with driving, deepening and growing the relationship over time through product and analytics knowledge.  The Client Manager is highly focused on understanding the needs and evolving priorities of client organisations and on providing analytical and investment process solutions that leverage the capabilities of the entire BlackRock Solutions organization. Are you a highly motivated professional interested in building a career in FinTech?  Can you shape and enhance clients’ investment processes?  Do you thrive on working with clients to solve complex problems? Can you deliver in a fast-paced environment and demonstrate resilience in the face of challenges?  If this sounds like you, then join our Aladdin® business.  As a member of one of BlackRock’s fastest growing areas you will have the commercial and client-facing skills to help with a variety of risk management and investment process needs – using cutting edge technology to help some of the largest institutions and investors in the world. In this role, you will:  Serve as a trusted advisor to our clients, driving to identify, understand, and solve complex problems Own relationships with client teams, including senior management (e.g. Chief Investment Officer) Build strong internal relationships within BlackRock Solutions, and the wider BlackRock, in support of your clients Develop a deep understanding of your client’s business objectives, and help leverage Aladdin expertise to achieve their organization’s goals Provide impactful solutions, combining investment lifecycle expertise with your knowledge of financial markets Work closely with Aladdin product managers, developers, and financial modelers to further the value proposition of the Aladdin platform  We have:  The feel of a start-up with the backing of the world’s largest asset manager A dynamic environment where professional growth opportunities abound The chance to help clients achieve challenging strategic objectives ranging from streamlining workflows and integrating business lines to designing tailored investment and risk analyses An organization that prides itself on delivering a superior user experience
requirements: RequirementsYou have:  A foundational understanding of portfolio analytics and modeling paired with a keen interest in financial markets Fixed Income market experience and understanding of capital markets A consultative approach to understanding client needs and a passion for solving problems Familiarity with buy-side investment management workflows Strong interest in technology and an aptitude for learning new systems The ability to translate innovative ideas into action Emotional ownership, pride in what you do and a strong team ethos  2-6 years of experience in Financial Technology, Consulting or Buy Side firm.  A willingness to travel and be on site with clients as required  You may have:  CFA, FRM or other qualifications A track record building client relationships Direct portfolio management, trading, compliance, or operations experience A working knowledge of SQL, UNIX shell, or a modern programming language  Who are our clients? Portfolio managers, risk professionals, operations experts, and data analysts at all levels of an organization. The Aladdin platform empowers users from all walks of life to achieve their investment and risk management goals by providing them with direct access to the best in class investment technology, cutting edge risk modelling methods and a dedicated team of service specialists. We pride ourselves on delivering a differentiated service, not software

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities1) Provide leadership support in execution of key invoice to cash processes for GE Industrials viz collections, cash application and dispute management 2) Act as the relationship manager for the APAC, ANZ and India region for all regional businesses in matters related to past due performance, operational execution, new portfolio integrations, I2C platform support and management of operational risk and compliance 3) Act as the escalation point for the GE industrials for management and resolution of key issues 4) Work closely with Global and Regional operating leaders in growing and penetrating the APAC, ANZ and India markets in I2C and other related Finance space 5) Report KPIs and provide meaningful insights and analysis to global and regional leadership team on monthly, quarterly or as needed basis 6) Collaborate, identify and deploy best in class processes and tools (leveraging Machine learning, data analytics, AI tools, etc.), especially on GECARS ( this is a must-know skill), in partnership with global technology and SMEs for driving productivity, process standardization and automation, and optimize performance 7) Act as a champion for continuous learning, development and process improvement utilizing lean six sigma tools and techniques 8) Provide day to day leadership support to 20+ collections and cash application specialists and team leaders 9) Develop and coach the existing team members while recruiting talent for continuing operations effectively and succession planning
requirements: Requirements- 15+ years leadership experience in leading MNCs or shared services organization preferably in operations and finance management - MBA or equivalent - Lean Six Sigma Black Belt certification - Project management certified. - Account management and planning experience; Ability to gain senior client buy-in. - Change management, facilitation and/or transition experience. - Being able to work in Matrix organization and with ability to work across timezones. - International experience, preferably having worked abroad. - Intercultural sensitivity - Exposure to latest trends in technology ( e.g. Machine learning, data science, AI, etc.) -Previous WCS collections experience on more than one Industrial portfolio

company: TEXTILE AND FASHION INDUSTRY TRAINING CENTRE PTE LTD
job_description: Roles & Responsibilities COMPANY DESCRIPTION  Textile and Fashion Industry Training Centre (TaF.tc) is the training arm of the Textile & Fashion Federation (Taff). It’s also the first Continuing Education and Training Centre (CET) for the textile and fashion industry in Singapore, with the vision of becoming a global fashion school without boundaries.  RESPONSIBILITIES  As a Digital Marketing Executive, you will have the opportunity of becoming a full-stack marketer. Be part of the journey of growing and shaping TaF.tc’s brand by making key strategic choices. This role is for you if you like:  Bringing Marketing Campaigns to Life. You will be a part of a tightly-knit team of in-house marketeers, and work closely with external agencies/vendors. Having Full Autonomy in Project Management. You will have the opportunity to take ownership for a variety of assigned projects. Bonus points if you know how to handle timelines and budgets while maintaining quality output. Getting down and dirty for Customer-Centric Problem Solving. You love to solve problems and can identify key leverage points in a customers’ journey to bring out the most conversions. Make Customer Service Great Again. You believe that customers come first - which will ultimately translate to great designs and marketing goals.    What’s on offer: Taf.tc provides a great environment and platform for employees to build their marketing career and portfolio:  Unique opportunity to develop, lead, and implement innovative marketing strategies Autonomy to run your own marketing campaigns Understand the power of marketing data analytics through on-the-job learning in extracting, analysing and data storytelling Exposure to a fast paced work environment Working with passionate, smart, and driven colleagues in a vibrant environment Develop your own digital marketing strategies using Facebook, Google Ads, Inbound Marketing, and SEO.
requirements: Requirements  Requirements:  Ideally you should have: 		 Bachelor’s degree in any major from a reputable university Strong ability to copywrite and conceptualise messages using attractive and impactful visuals Strong ownership and ability to work with minimal oversight Technical and software skills related to marketing and other related fields. Skills in Adobe Suite and copywriting are a plus!

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities Our Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team of innovators rewarded with innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you’ll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. You’ll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you—and the products you deliver—will thrive. As a member of our Software Engineering Group you will dive head-first into creating innovative solutions that advance businesses and careers. You’ll join an inspiring and curious team of technologists dedicated to improving the design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming that goes into creating high quality software and new products. You’ll be tasked with keeping the team and other key stakeholders up to speed on the progress of what’s being developed. Coming in with an understanding of the importance of end-to-end software development-such as Agile frameworks-is key. And best of all, you’ll be working with and sharing ideas, information and innovation with our global team of technologists from all over the world. Our Cloud Services Group is teeming with passionate innovators like you who are rapidly designing, building and deploying groundbreaking internal and public cloud platforms. By putting your technological know-how to work on creating best-in-class cloud-aware applications, your efforts will help us work faster and smarter, not to mention reinforce our position as a global leader in fintech cloud services.
requirements: Requirements This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: •BS/BA degree or equivalent experience •Advanced knowledge of application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines •Understanding of architecture and design across all systems  •Working proficiency in developmental toolsets •Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to accomplish common goals •Proficiency in one or more general purpose programming languages such as Java, Python, JavaScript, Go, etc. •Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance and software improvement •Hands-on experience developing cloud native applications on platforms like CloudFoundry, Kubernetes, Heroku, AWS, GCP, Azure, etc. •Exposure to effective operational patterns like SLOs, metrics, health checks, error budgets, distributed tracing, etc., using tools like Prometheus, Grafana, Zipkin, Jaeger, ELK, etc. •Exposure to building frameworks and tooling for large scale engineering operations is a strong plus. •Exposure to resiliency patterns like circuit breakers, bulkheads, backpressure, etc. using tools like Hystrix is a strong plus.   When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity.  We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation.  If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you. Ready to take your career to the next level? Apply today We strongly encourage all applicants to apply via our careers website where you are able join our Talent Network to receive customized vacancy notifications and ensure that your details are accessible by our global recruiting team - www.jpmorganchase.com/careers. A quick link to this particular job posting can be found in this URL: http://jobs.jpmorganchase.com/ListJobs/ByKeyword/190004598/ Please note that only short-listed candidates will be notified. We thank you for your interest and wish you all the best in your career. Yours Sincerely, Human Resources JPMorgan

Proactively identify business processes in Workday which can be enhanced to optimize manual work. Update business processes as and when required.  Create & Modify various organizations in Workday including but not limited to Location, Location Hierarchy, Company, Company Hierarchy, Cost Center, & Custom Organizations. Well organized and able to effectively prioritize tasks. Basic Compensation configuration in Workday. Good to have knowledge of various ATS and learning & Development products.   Must have worked on Workday projects before. Must have configured business processes and developed reports in Workday. Flexible and should be one who is ready to "get their hands dirty". job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA career at Arup offers you the chance to make a positive difference in the world. Independently owned and independently minded, we attract a diverse mix of people to work on ground breaking projects around the world. The Arup Digital business works across the built environment combining innovative digital solutions with our domain expertise in strategy, design, analytics and visualisation and operations. Our Arup Digital Practice in Singapore is seeking a qualified and experienced ICT Technical Design and Delivery Consultant. As an integral member of our Digital team, you will be responsible for leading and working with a group of aviation design / IT professionals to deliver ICT infrastructure design solutions for aviation projects of varying complexity and size. This role will be our key design and delivery interface to support our clients at all stages of the design lifecycle, from the requirements capture, business case development and initial design through to commissioning and in life support. Responsibilities will include the development of our Arup’s Digital Aviation business in accordance with the Arup Group Strategy and the Australasia Region Strategy. This includes understanding the built environment market, the needs of existing and potential clients, and the total proposition on offer from the firm. This person is also responsible for building collaborative relationships across the region, with other business areas and geographies, with client organisations and with other collaborating enterprises. In addition, they should be able to articulate a vision for our position in the market to clients and to all contributing teams.   Duties and Responsibilities  Lead and provide technical guidance and support the various Digital infrastructure-oriented specialist design teams (e.g. multiple workstreams) with the delivery of ICT / airport systems in a large-scale airport environment, including but not limited to ICT infrastructure to enable structured cabling systems, extra-low voltage systems, active networks, specialist airport IT systems, etc Lead and support the development of cost estimates, plans / schedules and specifications and technical reports Lead and participate in project decisions regarding technical strategies, business case justifications, technical approaches, cost and scheduling, and performance Develop operating plans and business plans to grow the breadth and scope of the business in the target market(s) Understand the needs of clients through regular contact, and develop an offering that meets those needs Communicate externally and internally - articulate our offering and our position in the market to all clients and contributing teams and share and promote best practice throughout the region Become known externally and regionally as a significant operator in the market and be sought after for market knowledge, understanding, opinion or expertise to attract and win work Identify and take responsibility for investments to develop our capability and market presence Identify, support and/or orchestrate the successful pursuit of potential projects Ensure that legal, commercial and brand risk for key projects in the market are well understood and managed To ensure Arup corporate business processes and procedures are followed as appropriate, and assist in meeting the requirements of internal and external audit teams
requirements: RequirementsKey Requirements  At least a Bachelors’ Engineering degree [BSc (Eng), BEng] related to the role or equivalent experience Experience in project and programme management capabilities to undertake large scale and/or complex design management / co-ordination tasks with specific airport communications/ICT systems technical expertise 8+ years of design / PM experience in managing the production of deliverables on aviation-centric ICT design projects Demonstrable thought leadership and creative thinking applied in long gestation aviation development projects Demonstrable track record of managing and/or working on large-scale aviation development projects    Desirable Requirements  A relevant professional qualification such as BICSI RCDD qualified or similar. Knowledge of data networks, data centre operations, command and control center infrastructure, ELV systems, telephony, television, radio communications and wireless LAN infrastructures, in-building cellular enhancement, sensing networks, audio visual, multimedia and collaboration technologies and solutions. Use of BIM techniques and related programs are preferential Applicants need to have the ‘know-how’ and experience of serving the local aviation clients in Singapore and/or ASEAN countries Experience with statistical modelling tools and data visualisation / analytical tools is a plus 	    “It is not the wish to expand, but the quest for quality which has brought us to this position… to do work of quality, we must have people of quality. There are many kinds of quality, and there are many kinds of job to do, so we must have many kinds of people, each of which can do their own job well.” Ove Arup, 1970.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA career at Arup offers you the chance to make a positive difference in the world. Independently owned and independently minded, we attract a diverse mix of people to work on ground breaking projects around the world. The Arup Digital business works across the built environment combining innovative digital solutions with our domain expertise in strategy, design, analytics and visualisation and operations. Our Arup Digital Practice in Singapore is seeking an ICT Consultant to provide the design of ICT physical infrastructure to support active and passive systems such as structured cabling systems, extra-low voltage building control and communications systems, typically deployed in aviation related projects within landside and airside facilities of varying complexity and size. This role will manage the production and coordination of design and construction drawings, specifications, reports and studies for the ICT physical infrastructure to support airport operations. As well as design management the role will include designing the ICT physical infrastructure. The skills required for this role include technical site surveys, site investigations, management of site installation activities, knowledge of building services prerequisites for ICT systems including power, heat and environmental criteria for safe operations and technical assurance when delivering ICT physical infrastructure. The role will require knowledge of enabling high performance and high availability systems within design solutions. While initially assigned to a specific project, this person will also support the Core Team to further support Arup in future projects within the region. Duties and Responsibilities  Design management of the production of concept, schematic and detailed designs and construction drawings in compliance with relevant industry standards and regulations Requirements management and validation Ensuring that the quality of project work meets agreed standards, specifications and delivery schedules Consulting with clients, collaborators and stakeholders to capture requirement and probe into the desired outcomes Carry out QA checks of drawings and documentation completed by the team producing design deliverables such as Technicians / Engineers / Design Consultants Maintain a reliable and consistent written and verbal communication interface with Technicians, Engineers and Consultants with very good command of English Capable of writing of clear and concise reports and specifications in both technical and non-technical language, including preparation of easy to understand system diagrams and schematics Manage / Undertake ICT design work using AutoCAD and BIM designs and specifications Developing detailed designs including detailed calculations, specifications, drawings etc., for the purpose of calling the construction tender Client liaison, relationship management and business development Liaison with other contractors, companies, suppliers and internal / external multi-disciplined engineering teams Awareness of security and information assurance Awareness of Project management, Project finance and time/cost management techniques
requirements: RequirementsKey Requirements  IT / Engineering degree related to the role or equivalent experience in the sector or in related industry sectors in telecommunications 3 – 5 years of design experience on aviation-centric ICT physical infrastructure systems, including ICT equipment rooms, pathways, containment system and risers for data centre, operations centre; structured cabling system design for in-building and outside plant; and MEP facilities for ICT e.g. power, cooling, etc Have relevant experience and understanding of building services infrastructure and the design of resilient ICT systems  Ability to develop production working relationship with key clients and suppliers at all levels, including coordination with architect / MEP teams Competent in use of MS Project, MS Visio, AutoCAD, and MS Office - Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook Ability to plan and create documents / reports / design processes appropriate to the needs of the recipient Demonstrable ability to provide agile working, schedule and programme management and prioritising workloads    Desirable Requirements  A relevant professional qualification such as BICSI RCDD qualified or similar Knowledge of data networks, data centre operations, command and control center infrastructure, ELV systems, telephony, television, radio communications and wireless LAN infrastructures, in-building cellular enhancement, sensing networks, audio visual, multimedia and collaboration technologies and solutions Use of BIM techniques and related programs are preferential Experience of serving the local aviation clients in Singapore and/or ASEAN countries is desirable Experience with statistical modelling tools and data visualisation / analytical tools is a plus    “It is not the wish to expand, but the quest for quality which has brought us to this position… to do work of quality, we must have people of quality. There are many kinds of quality, and there are many kinds of job to do, so we must have many kinds of people, each of which can do their own job well.” Ove Arup, 1970.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesExperience in various SAP Lines of Services like Implementation, Application Support, Upgrade and Migration and  Cloud offerings  are essential Candidate who can demonstrate existing strong customer network and SAP relationships in Singapore/APAC will be preferred Candidate must have strong experience in customer management, business generation, revenue growth and RFP lifecycle management Candidate must have managed a portfolio of  15M + USD Experience and good understanding of  SAP S4/HANA/Analytics  , SAP Cloud, SAP Leonardo, and other new age product offerings Should have experience working in onsite/offshore model and high collaboration index
requirements: Requirementsre Bachelor’s degree is a must 18+ years of overall experience Minimum 3 years of Industry domain experience. Strong understanding of processes in the Industry domain and its mapping into SAP 15+  years of SAP experience  across industries, should have a strong business process mapping knowhow Minimum 5 years of experience in Singapore/APAC market (preferably in the above role)

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout us We pride ourselves as the best and largest vertically integrated, omni-channel women’s fashion brand in the region. Founded in 2010, we’ve grown to 150 people strong, proudly headquartered in Singapore with country offices in Indonesia and Malaysia and an omni-channel presence across these 3 markets. In addition to our retail franchise in Cambodia, we ship internationally to 15 markets (Hong Kong, China, Philippines and Australia, New Zealand, US, Canada, Macau, Japan, Korea, Vietnam, Thailand, Myanmar, Cambodia & Brunei) We are taking our definition of new female retail global, with our sights set on becoming the most thoughtful brand for the everyday woman. The Role You will be responsible for developing our global sourcing and production strategy. You will play a pivotal role in the cultivation and growth of vendor relationships, helping to transform our design ideas into actual products for our community of women. As our Sourcing and Production Manager, you will be the key point of contact for our suppliers, dealing with the timing and practical aspects or orders. Reporting directly to the Head of Design, you will play a key role in shaping Love, Bonito throughout this exhilarating expansion phase. Main Responsibilities Sourcing  Open up new manufacturing leads within the region to support new product lines and/or categories, ensuring the best-fit of resources, cost and specialties are aligned for respective products. Together with Product Development team, visit international shows to stay up-to-date on new trends in manufacturing, technologies or raw materials. Develop a model to analyze capabilities of different production markets and hence inform our short-term and long-term production strategies. Together with Operations and Merchandising Team, using data and analytics to ensure that our product lines are developed in the correct market, at the correct price. Work out the terms of all contracts, licenses, insurance and liability agreements with all suppliers.  Production Quality Control:  Develop Love, Bonito’s QC guidelines (stitch + measurement variation tolerance, colour + print difference tolerance, etc) Frequent visits to factories to check the measurement, technical specs and workmanship of a garment, measured against our internal LB QC guidelines Play an active role in inspiring and pushing our suppliers to find the best technical solutions. Together with PD, conduct all relevant tests (stitch test, rub test, dye test) on new sample yardage & garment suppliers before going into bulk orders.  Optimisation:  Optimise bulk production lead times, liaising with production factories and our Internal Operations & Logistics teams to ensure that production schedule is on time. Negotiate high level costing with tiered discounting levels for volume maximization. Perform cost and scenario analysis, and benchmarking across the industry. Tracks and measures supplier performance via score carding while fully analyzing and understanding supplier's economics.  Sustainability:  Develop Love, Bonito’s code of conduct & ethics to ensure all our products are developed within a sustainable and holistic work environment Work in close cooperation with all our partner factories to ensure that comply with Love, Bonito’s code of conduct & ethics
requirements: RequirementsYou should have / be  An extensive knowledge of garment manufacturing, standards, requirements and processes. Possess extensive quality contacts with a range of international and regional manufacturers. A finger on the pulse of changing market dynamics within our production countries. Exceptional communication and negotiation skills, with assertiveness in supplier management. A natural ability to establish, nurture, and cement strong working relationships to help us grow. The aptitude to navigate ambiguity and make decisions using both intuition and rationality. Adept with numbers and a have penchant for collecting, analyzing and interpreting data A natural enthusiasm for collaborating among different departments. A can-do entrepreneurial and innovative mindset Open to extensive travel or periodic relocation in initial phases of factory tie-ups  Qualifications & Experience  Advanced understanding of apparel design, fabric qualities, printing techniques, and merchandising and product development processes Advanced communication skills; capable of interpreting and conveying international business concepts 4 to 6 years industry experience in Fashion, Textile and/or Apparel Manufacturing, Sourcing, Product Development or Supply Chain Experienced in working on a regional level, with people of different language and cultures. Proficient in English and Chinese. Other languages are a plus.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are looking for a digital native who loves to create original videos for the social space. If you are bursting with creative ideas and have a proven track record producing videos for digital platforms, we would love to meet you. Responsibilities :   To conceptualise and produce digital videos series and formats that are entertaining and shareable. This includes at least 3 or more of the following roles - writing, directing, shooting and post production.   Constantly keeping your fingers on the pulse of what is trending and going viral in the digital space. This comes with a competent knowledge of reading video analytics.   Apply best practices in platform management to ensure the videos are published efficiently   Work with cross-functional teams to create multi-platform content. For example, work with writing and social media teams to create social media content
requirements: Requirements  Minimum 5 years in a video production role and mostly for digital platforms.   Experience with managing your own YouTube account is a plus.   Able to independently conceptualise, direct talents on set and follow through the entire video production process – from pre to post-production   A high level of proficiency in digital video post-production using Adobe Premiere Pro CC, Adobe Media Encoder, Adobe Photoshop/Illustrator   Working knowledge of Adobe After Effects   Understanding of the digital publishing process   The ability to work under pressure of tight deadlines and occasionally at night, on weekends and Public Holidays if required.   Added advantage if you are capable of any of these - live streaming production and/or fronting videos   Interested applicants, we welcome you to submit your detailed resume stating your current and expected remuneration including links to your portfolio to careers@asiaone.com.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe AXA Group is a worldwide leader in insurance and asset management, with 166,000 employees serving 103 million clients in 64 countries. AXA is the number 1 Global Insurance Brand for the 10th year running, and is also the number 1 insurance company in the Top 50 Most Innovative Companies.   A glimpse of your daily mission: The first main objective is to leverage the development of the team’s optimization capabilities through the following areas identified (can be adapted in case of new issues identified):  Improve our capability to quantify retention for all LoBs in GI business, this includes managing different systems and enhance calculation of earnings impacts per band of exposure Measure Reinsurance Capital Efficiency and quantify Reinsurance Loss Curves (OEP, AEP) Enhance CAT Reporting and develop our capabilities in flood modelling in Singapore and overseas to which we are he exposed taking examples on known systems (Aon Analytics, Guy Carpenter) Manage Underwriting and Profitability Monitoring in Actapps and fully link the figures to Finance / PnL reported + assist in MAC (Monthly Actuarial Communication) for Reinsurance Provide any necessary support to the Commercial Lines Pricing team in property pricing/portfolio reviews, and in implementation of technical pricing frameworks
requirements: RequirementsA successful qualifier of this mission:  Graduate in Engineering, computer science, actuarial sciences or financial engineering Strong IT knowledge: Excel, VBA, SAS,R, Python Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Good presentation, communication and inter-personal skills Strong team player and influencing team / internal stakeholders positively Solid project management skills due to large number of parties involved and tight deadlines Timely and accurate delivery Independent innovative with a self-starter mindset  As we are continuously looking for great talents like you, do share AXA career opportunities with other talents! Link for our website is https://www.axa.com.sg/about-axa/careers To all recruitment agencies AXA ONLY accept resumes from appointed agency under our Preferred Supplier List. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, AXA employees, any AXA entities or company location. AXA is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesDEPARTMENT OF MARKETING  NUS BUSINESS SCHOOL FULL-TIME EDUCATOR TRACK POSITIION The National University of Singapore (NUS) Business School invites applications for an educator track faculty position in the Department of Marketing.  Applicants are expected to hold a PhD degree from an accredited institution, have excellent communication skills, and sustained reputation as a highly effective educator. Preference will be given to candidates who have at least three years of teaching experience and are able to teach in the areas of digital marketing and/or marketing analytics.  The initial appointment is for a 3- to 5-year term.
requirements: RequirementsEducator track faculty is expected to:  Deliver modules across different degree programs. Develop new teaching materials and modules that support the department's and school's initiatives. Engage in other aspects of teaching scholarship (e.g., case/textbook writing, student project supervision). Deliver a full teaching load of 28 modular credits or equivalent to 7 full modular courses per academic year.  Person to contact: Ms Jothi S. Email: mktsec@nus.edu.sg

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPosition Summary The Manager - Digital Partnerships will support key digital partnerships within the group. The role requires an experienced sales manager capable of identifying and closing commercial partnerships with large digital and emerging Fintech companies in AP as well as executing key account management and growth initiatives.  Success requires working closely with a multitude of cross-functional Visa teams who help contribute to the growth of the partnership and the distribution of Visa’s products and capabilities. This includes closely aligning with the Regional Digital Partnerships and Fintech FastTrack team, Visa’s Core & Digital Product teams, Country Management and Business Development teams as well as other internal stakeholders such as Processing, Pricing, Legal, Risk and Marketing to execute partnership agreements and deliverables that are complex, strategic and cross-functional in nature.  In this role, you will use strong analytical skills, contextual business sense to map the market landscape, identifying partnerships opportunities as well as creative flair to solve real world business challenges for Visa’s Digital Partners and emerging Fintech partners. Responsibilities Market Mapping & Analysis: • Research industry trends and emerging themes in technology and payments that will shape the future of Visa’s business and support the development of a ‘point-of-view’ to inform stakeholders • Extract actionable business insights from the data and build deliverables that clearly communicate the findings and recommendations • Perform other analytical tasks on an as-needed basis Program and Partner Management: • Align the cross-functional teams on key proposals including representation from Marketing, Product, Operations, Market Research and Technology. • Support the development, negotiation and signing of proposals by working with various internal stakeholders and relationships with strategic partner executives Segment Knowledge: • Support the regional Digital Partnerships team in developing the team’s strategy, and business development approach • Continuously review market landscape, identifying developing partnership that will position the Digital Partnerships team as best-in-class Execution: • Work with senior team members and cross functional teams to support partner implementations are on track and delivering against plan • Support the evaluation of potential partnership opportunities for their strategic and financial value and providing business rationale and analytics in support of the opportunities • Supporting engagements including commercial deals, alliances and opportunities from inception to active discussions to execution • Numerate and be able to build business cases and financial and commercial models to support partnerships Communication: • Report to and interact with senior team to indicate the status of the partnership progress • Foster in-depth and productive relationships at all levels with the client and the Visa organization • Proactively educate the Visa organization on market developments and partner opportunities
requirements: RequirementsQualifications • A minimum of 5 years business experience within Visa or Payments related industry • The ideal candidate will bring a combination of business knowledge and financial skills • Ability to work within a complex and often ambiguous environment, and ability to guide the relevant stakeholders • Willingness to learn and ability to partner, communicate and manage/navigate through multiple disciplines and organizational groups • Team oriented, Ethical, empathetic, collaborative, diplomatic and flexible • Bachelor’s degree required

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWe are looking for an Assistant Manager Risk Analytics to support the implementation of credit risk methodologies. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES  Develop, implement and maintain Probability of Default (PD) models and credit risk methodologies for Financial Institutions (Banks and Non-Bank FIs) and Sovereigns, for both regulatory (i.e. IRB and Stress Testing) and accounting (i.e. IFRS9) purposes Prepare and maintain clear and detailed documentation of model revisions and new model developments Liaise with and support the technology team to implement models into various risk systems, providing model specifications and testing system functionality prior to deployment Support the internal models’ approval and governance processes, providing detailed explanations and justification of modeling decisions and assumptions and addressing potential issues, particularly along Group Model Validation’s reviews and Group Internal Audit’s reviews Support the external models’ approval and governance processes, providing necessary explanations, justifications and analyses, particularly along the relevant Supervisors’ approval assessments and external Auditors reviews Research, propose and develop enhancements of existing models, to improve accuracy, risk discrimination, forward-looking capability and responsiveness to economic environment, considering the evolution in the relevant regulatory environment, academia and industry
requirements: RequirementsSKILLS AND EXPERIENCE  Advanced degree (preferably postgraduate) in an applied quantitative discipline (e.g. Economics, Statistics, Finance, Financial Engineering) with a clear ability for analysing data and developing statistical predictive models Expert knowledge of statistical/database software such as SAS, Excel VBA, MS Access etc. Relevant experience in a related area (credit risk for financial institutions and sovereigns) a definite plus Knowledge of risk-drivers for financial institutions and sovereigns a definite plus Knowledge/experience in credit, marketing or risk functions an asset Knowledge of the Bank’s product/ business/ technology system Regulatory Framework and Requirements: awareness of the regulatory framework in which the firm operates

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Digital, Analytics and Creative (DAC) team in Golin Singapore is on the lookout for an awe-inspiring account manager who can galvanise and organise their teams, partner closely with our clients to elevate their business and communications impact, and consistently deliver first-rate work across the board.
requirements: RequirementsWhat we expect from you  Attention to detail and impeccable project management skills are crucial when it comes to leading key client relationships and overseeing day-to-day account work and seeing campaigns through from end to end for global and regional brands Strategic thinking is a must as you’ll be responsible for identifying growth opportunities for and with your clients Be a team player, as you’ll work night and day with our kick-ass creatives and planners to deliver effective campaigns and results Understand communications (and we mean everything from traditional PR to social media, influencer work, thought leadership, you name it) inside and out, as you’ll lead new business development for the DAC team Effective communicator – we need everyone on our clients’ teams, our own team, and other teams at Golin Singapore to work seamlessly together  Basic requirements  Minimum 5 years of experience in client servicing for integrated communications work Latest knowledge on industry trends and effective campaigns Knowledge of budgeting and planning Experience in managing multi-market campaigns in APAC

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesNUS Business School is recognized as one of the top business schools in the Asia-Pacific region. It also co-hosts the NUS Business Analytics Centre jointly with the NUS School of Computing. Our vision is to be the leading business school in Asia, globally recognised for excellence in education and research, and our mission is to advance knowledge and develop leaders so as to serve business and society. The Department of Analytics & Operations in the National University of Singapore (NUS) Business School is seeking qualified candidates for a Lecturer/Senior Lecturer (Educator Track) position in analytics and operations, starting July 2019. The appointee will be expected to teach both undergraduate and graduate courses such as text analytics, social media analytics, network analytics and general machine learning/AI. Candidates should ideally have a Ph.D. degree in data science, machine learning or a related field, plus teaching experience at university level. Candidates with a Master’s degree and profound industry experience in relevant areas might also be considered. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package as well as a promising career path.
requirements: RequirementsThe NUS Business School has a long tradition of excellence in both teaching and research. We strive to nurture future-ready, open-minded, and professionally competent graduates. The ideal candidate should be a passionate and student-centric educator who can demonstrate a commitment to a teaching career, a practitioner who can relate machine learning theories to business applications, and a coach who will groom our students into business-focused and analytics-driven managers. Candidates who are early career academics should ideally have at least some previous teaching assistant experience, while those more experienced candidates should have previous lecturing experience, evidence of curriculum development and ideally also experience in supervising Master’s students. Qualified applicants should submit a full CV (including a full list of publications and teaching achievements), a cover letter addressing their teaching philosophy, and three letters of reference (or a list of three individuals who can serve as references) to Dr Liu Qizhang (bizlqz@nus.edu.sg), on or before 31st May 2019. Applicants without a publication record should also submit a job market paper.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Manager/Senior Manager uses data analytics and determines new strategies to make production processes more efficient to meet organisation's goals. He/She establishes, implements and manages projects to meet operational objectives. He/She manages his/her team resources and balances between production requirement and manpower resources to ensure organisation's sustainability. He/She integrates quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance within the organisation.   In addition the Manager/Senior Manager evaluates the organisation’s approach towards a lean enterprise and uses data analytics for business insights identification. He/She drives innovation practices in the organisation and review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimize inventory levels.   As a people manager, the Manager oversees manpower, financial, training and resource planning deployment within the organisation. He displays a high level of organisational awareness and leadership skills by working in a consultative manner with other departments/sections within the organisation.
requirements: Requirements~ Analyse data for business insights identification.   ~ Analyse production efficiencies.   ~ Conduct interviews and make hiring decisions.   ~ Determine priorities dynamically and set planning assumptions for work in progress levels by product, cycle time and yield.   ~ Develop On-the-job training programme.   ~ Develop workplace learning plan.   ~ Evaluate organisations approach towards a lean enterprise.   ~ Evaluate the sustainability of manufacturing process by preparing rough cut capacity plans.   ~ Evaluate workplace safety and health management system for compliance and improvement.   ~ Improve operation planning through use of big data and advanced analytics modelling.   ~ Integrate quality principles and methodology to enhance engineering performance.   ~ Lead change management in the organisation.   ~ Manage balance between production requirement and manpower resources.   ~ Manage innovation practises in organisation.   ~ Manage manufacturing key metrics including loading, performance to commitments, on time delivery and bottlenecks.   ~ Manage material requirements planning taking into account the sales forecast, production plan and production capacity.   ~ Resolve workplace grievances and disputes.   ~ Review manufacturing processes to reduce working capital and optimise inventory levels.

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities• Conceptualize, design & execute all creative for website • Create web graphics, animations, layouts and digital imaging skills for use on website • Responsible for layout, visuals and usability of website • Proficient in web design software to create the designs for use in website • Can do web design from scratch up to final working website and upload to web server. • Proficient in web development- HTML, CSS, PHP and MySQL, JavaScript, Wordpress, Joomla • Working knowledge on latest web standards – HTML 5, CSS 3, cross-browser and mobile web compatibility • Creative thinker with a marketing mind set • Self-motivated and be able to multitask in a fast-paced, rapidly growing environment • Good eye for design and be able to conceptualise ideas • Proficient in software such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Dreamweaver and Premiere • Familiarity with CRM, email marketing, web and social analytics would be an advantage

If you possess what it takes to be part of the winning team, please submit your resume, stating Job Experience, current and expected remuneration and enclose a recent photograph to: careers@lukealexandrea.com

job_title: Senior Pricing and Phone Valuer Analyst
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesJOB PURPOSE This role is responsible for valuing large portfolios of second-hand phone sales relating to the company’s Upgrade and Leasing programs. It includes valuing and setting reserved prices for the sale of salvage stock across APAC markets. In addition, this role also ensures the accuracy of data relating to the value of phones, and historical and forecasted device valuation curves, taking into account market dynamics which have an impact on these valuations. This role requires a solid understanding of factors impacting the mobile market and device values. ACCOUNTABILITIES Perform day to day tracking of devices (phones) values and market trends, and estimating the expected values of current and future phones, including forward pricing. Work closely with the business and global analytics to provide forecast accuracy and market trends. This includes analyses on initiative/projects, KPI impacts such as sensitivity analyses, forecast trends for devices, markets, etc. Perform comparison of Asurion sale values to external market data to assess accuracy and performance. Map market and history of second-hand phone values by OEM, Age of device, capacity and condition of device, and using historical data of market to price the future value of second-hand phones according to these categories. Build external networks with phone resellers and valuers. Set sale price and auction floor price for phone sales. Provide forward looking monetisation (resale value) curves for the purpose of pricing, business cases, budgeting and forecasting. Work closely with APAC CFO and frequent interactions are also required with different departments, as well as with senior management teams in the APAC region.
requirements: Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or equivalent business related degree. Master’s degree is preferred. Preferred: professional experience in the mobile industry, with an understanding of different phone types and values. Strong interest in mobile industry. 10 years financial analytics and pricing experience. Commercial pricing and statistical background. Superior analytical and financial and data modelling skills. Experience with dashboards/BI tools, Spotfire and/or other reporting tools. Good with numbers and possesses business acumen. Ability to understand and interpret complex data, financial reports, and technical documents Project management experience. Strong problem-solving capabilities. Strong knowledge of management accounting is an advantage. Strong customer focus, and ability to respond effectively to clients, colleagues, and senior management. Able to handle sensitive and confidential information well. Strong communication and interpersonal skills in a multi-cultural and bilingual business environment (English and Mandarin). Motivated to help and support others as One Team. Self-motivated, well organised and able to work with tight deadlines.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPosition Summary The role will involve solution design and working with the team in delivering the BPC solution to our global customers. This role requires following skills and experience: ·         Mandatory skills  - SAP BPC 10.x  ·         Domain skills – CAPEX, OPEX, Headcount Planning, Driver Based Planning, Revenue Planning, Financial Statements Planning. ·         Expert working knowledge of SAP BPC classic / embedded / Optimized functionality performing all development (configuration, security, modelling, scripting, input template and report writing, AO) & administrative functions. ·         Advanced proficiency level skills in MS Excel (including Macros, VBA, complex formulas). ·         Nice to have developer knowledge of SAP BW, SAP HANA, SAP BOBJ applications. ·         Translation of business requirements into functional and technical solution documents ·         Strong leadership & analytical capabilities to effectively lead teams to build, manage & optimize the BPC models ·         Good to have – Experience in SAP BI-IP, BW and Exposure in SAP modules ·         Ideally has experience with SAC (SAP Analytics Cloud for Planning) formerly known as BOC (BusinessObjects Cloud) ·         Ideally experience with integration of data between SAC and BPC ·         Relevant year of experience – 6-9 years ·         Type of projects worked  – Minimum two end-to-end BPC implementation project Overseas exposure – it will be considered as a plus point for candidate
requirements: Requirements  Candidate should possess good soft skills as mentioned below: ·         Should possess excellent problem solving, and is able to work effectively in a less structured environment and manage time. ·         Excellent verbal and written communication skills  ·         Should be able to coordinate with onsite/ functional/development teams independently ·         Willing to travel to the customers locations on need basis outside of India      Primary Responsibilities:  ·         Unit design of the specific planning area based on high level design of the overall solution ·         Build and Test of the solution   Qualifications:   ·         CA/CPM/MBA Finance

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesOur vision is to build a unified Commercial Digital Platform capability (data, people, processes, technology), which will enable us to enable a step change in commercial performance, transform customer experiences, and play a pioneering role in redefining our industry over the long term. Our aim is to deliver the most engaging experiences for our customers, underpinned by digital technologies and new agile ways of working. As part of this work, in partnership with BCG Digital Ventures (part of the Boston Consulting Group), Rio Tinto has built a MVP for a predictive shipping analytics platform using the latest Machine Learning and AI technologies. They are now looking for smart people to join the team and propel the next phase of the product’s development, and support the broader digitalisation transformation across Rio Tinto’s commercial function. We're working with a modern tech stack - ES6, React and Redux, with a Python back end deployed on AWS, and are looking for experienced engineers to join us, working on the design and development of the new product under the direction of the Venture CTO.  What you'll do:  Collaborating with a team of engineers across the venture team to ensure we deliver an empowering user experience Communicating ideas across the cross-functional team in an effective manner Sharing technical solutions and product ideas through design reviews, pair programming, code reviews and discussions Utilising a proactive and responsive approach to problem solving Implementing highly scalable and maintainable frontend services, and working with business specialists and visual designers to design optimal solutions Working with ES6, React (boilerplate), Redux
requirements: RequirementsWhat you'll bring:  Sustained experience in professional software development using ES6 and React An appreciation for design, with a focus on building elegant applications that are pleasing to the eye Strong analytical and debugging skills A preference for working with cross-disciplinary teams to introduce and enhance behaviour and test-driven approaches, resulting in clean, elegant code and application architectures Experience of working with team members to encourage the writing of clean, elegant code using test-first approaches A background working in teams using Agile approaches  Tech Stack:  ES6, React, Node, AWS, Serverless

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe National University of Singapore (NUS) invites applications for the Research Fellow position in the Institute of Operations Research and Analytics (IORA). The applicant will be tasked to research on data-driven causal design leveraging the large amount of data from industry partners, working closely with Project Investigator, Prof Jussi Keppo.
requirements: RequirementsExperience in causal identification, deep learning, reinforcement learning, and statistical learning. Experience in the designing and implementation of causal and learning models for commercial applications. PhD in computer science, operations research, mathematics or statistics. Journal publications in these areas.

job_title: AVP, Full Stack Developer  /  Lead (Private Equity & Infrastructure)
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesFull Stack Developer/Lead (Associate/AVP) Investment Services for Private Equity & Infrastructure, Economic & Investment Strategy The Technology Group (TG) is a key enabler to keep our business moving forward and is constantly exploiting state-of-the-art information technologies to enhance GIC’s ability to be the leading global long-term investment firm. We aim to provide users with empowering and transformational capabilities, and to create an inclusive, innovative and integrated work environment. This is an opportunity to join GIC as a Full Stack Developer/Lead (Associate/AVP). This role is embedded in an integrated team that provides investment services for all private market investment activities. Exposure opportunities  You will play a key role, building and supporting Analytics systems used directly by the Front Office investment professionals and senior management As a person with strong analytical skills, you will use your technology know-how to bring value directly to the business. You will also be exposed to end-to-end investment processes, learning valuable business domain knowledge. You will participate in fast-moving agile projects and have the opportunity to work with modern technologies, such as ReactJS, .NET Core. You will also have the chance of exploring emerging technologies. As an excellent team player with a collaborative mind-set, you will work directly with investment professionals at different levels. You will also work alongside experienced professionals across our extended Technology team in GIC as well as have exchanges with other industry partners.

job_title: System Engineer / Senior System Engineer  - Enterprise Monitoring
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBuilding, deploying, and maintaining enterprise monitoring technology platforms as assigned. The monitoring team is responsible to integrate the tools with critical IT infrastructures, platforms & systems, deliver an effective system monitoring platform to proactively monitor the health of systems and work with relevant IT teams to resolve system issues via system alerts to ensure the availability and reliability of business services. Responsibilities: • Act as monitoring tool administrator for Quest Fog light, ScienceLogic, BigFix, VMWare Epopts, Dynatrace, etc. • Act as a point of contact for any monitoring related incident. • Identify and remediate gaps in the Enterprise Monitoring environment • Onboard, operate and optimize the monitoring and event management solutions to support all IT/business systems. • Study the enhancements from product vendors, conduct impact assessment, plan and perform tool upgrades, ensure supportability and availability of latest functionalities and features. • Raise product support tickets for all issues, defects and enhance requests with respective vendors, ensure timely respond and resolution to minimize the operation impact. • Assist in Incident Management to identify correct team to recover the incidents within the shortest possible time. • Provide consultation to various support teams in monitoring using tools to isolate the fault domain, through log analytics and dive deep into application code when required and identify root cause of performance issues. • Work with production support, testing and infrastructure teams to enable Dynatrace APM capability, provide expertise and support to understand all issues that may affect the end to end performance of systems that support key business operations. • Developing dashboards and reports to provide ongoing visibility into the system resource utilization and performance of business applications. • Profiling application performance insight from user experience perspective, highlight performance concerns and suggest tuning opportunities for all StarHub retail and online systems. • Regularly review the monitoring landscape and trending of monitoring data and provide recommendations to the support teams to pro-actively address potential issues. • Infrastructure project management.
requirements: Requirements• Have good knowledge of fault and performance monitoring concepts for network, systems, application and databases • Hands on experience in system administration in Windows and UNIX server • Experience with one or more of following tools: Quest Fog light, ScienceLogic, VMWare Endpoint Operations, Dynatrace, Elastic etc. • Willing to work extended hours and understand the sense of urgency and be able to manage different priorities • Team player with excellent inter-personal skills • Hands-on experience in Application Performance Management (APM) tools such as DCRUM, Dynatrace or any other APM tools is advantages • Understanding of standard protocols/technologies such as DNS/WINS, TCP/IP, FTP, SSH, RDP, Active Directory, HTTP/S, IIS, JBoss, Load balances, etc. • Working knowledge of application technologies including SOAP/XML, JavaScript, Java, Python, .NET, Databases, etc.   *We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe Rapid-Rich Object SEarch (ROSE) Lab is a research initiative of Nanyang Technological University (NTU) aims to create a platform for fast mobile searches on object databases.  The three key thrusts of the ROSE Lab are:  (i) large-scale object database collection and analytics, (ii) scalable mobile object search with contextual mobility, and (iii) media cloud platform.  Resources at the ROSE Lab consist of NTU Faculty, Researchers, PhD Students, and Visiting Scholars & Students from other institutions from around the world. Learn more about ROSE Lab at http://rose.ntu.edu.sg/ Job Description The successful applicant will be responsible for the development of action recognition and computer vision systems using machine learning techniques.  This includes:  Develop action recognition and computer vision systems, including parallelising and optimising the algorithms. Working with industry partners of the ROSE Lab to test the classification systems.
requirements: Requirements Master degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, or Engineering. Must have research and development experience in Human Activity Analysis, Computer Vision, and Machine Learning. Must be good at C/C++. Must be good at Python. Applicants with experience in deep learning with convolutional and/or recurrent neural networks are highly preferred. Ideally, the applicant should have experience working with large-scale datasets. Applicants with good publication are highly preferred. Good interpersonal skills, with the ability to work with people from varied backgrounds.   We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesSoft robotics is a growing, new field that focuses on these mechanical qualities and on the integration of materials, structures, and software. In the same way that animal movements are based on the tight integration of skin for protection and sensing, soft robotics aims to achieve better and simpler mechanisms by exploiting the ‘mechanical intelligence’ of soft materials. This job aims to develop intelligent soft robotics with 2D materials protective and sensory skin, and also to build a machine-learning model to enhance the analytic capability of robotics.   The intelligent soft robotics will feature  high mechanical stretchability, effective chemical and flame protection that allows the personnel and robotic to survive or work in a harsh environment, skin-like sensing capacities that can monitor the actuation of pneumatic robotic hands and their interaction with human/environment, and AI neural networks with advanced analytics capabilities.  The machine with sensors can enhance their environmental awareness and improve the robotic-human interaction, which will be effective in overcoming mobility limitations experienced with standard rigid tools.
requirements: RequirementsA Ph.D. degree in Chemical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Material Science, Chemistry, or related fields. The ability to work independently, and adapt to new areas is required as the needs of the project evolve. The candidates with computational background (coding or simulation) will be highly preferred. Experience in 2D materials assembly, stretchable electronics, electrochemical characterizations, and soft robotics would be an advantage. The candidate should have excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as excellent interpersonal skills.   Applicants should email a cover letter and curriculum vitae to Asst. Prof. Po-Yen Chen (checp@nus.edu.sg). The CV should include educational and professional background, a list of publications/posters/conference presentations, and contact information of referees.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesROLE/JOB SUMMARY: This is a hands-on role driving sales and P/L by mean of analytics of demand in sales pipeline and market opportunities.  The role is responsible for regional market and sales pipeline, and in consolidation with global demand.  In addition to working with sales personnel in ensuring a sanitized and up-to-date pipeline database, the role also acts as the regional process owner and trainer on pipeline information.  Work will be down to deals level analyzing the dynamics of movement of demands, making recommendation in volume and pricing.   ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:  Analysis of global PV markets  - Monitor global PV markets with respect to PV growth, regulatory and policy issues, key players, current and  emerging business models, pricing and price trends - Generate reports (ad-hoc and regular) on the above, merging insights from primary and secondary research as well as from first-hand knowledge obtained via customers, sales colleagues or other stakeholders in the markets   Analysis of competitor and supply landscape across the value chain  - Develop a deep understanding of key REC competitors as well as other players in the PV Industry supply ecosystem and generate reports on the above  Analysis of demand situation both in sales pipeline and potential market opportunities. Continuously update and report demand situation as required in the demand analytic process. Jointly design and work with REC wide team a robust demand analytic process yielding meaningful and executable recommendations.   Work with regional sales to ensure data integrity is protected and updated. Be the regional demand process owner and trainer to sales personnel. Ability to chart trends and indices to management for decision making and discussion. Part of the team in recommending deal level strategy in volume, pricing and timing. Work with Global Planning and Logistics teams to strategize inventory and product positioning globally. Be part of Pricing control/co-approval process. Involved with some strategic sales dealings, recommendation and decision making. Sub-chair demand related meetings at regional and global level. Collaborate with but not limited to global planning, logistics, production/material planning and product launch teams to ensure successful a solid execution of sales and fulfillment. Attend to end customer ad-hoc demand situation. Participates in employer branding, product marketing initiatives. Supports finance forecast and budgeting process.  ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES  Perform other general support to Management team as need. To support and be part of any future change role change in the organization.

job_title: Research Fellow (1-year contract), Living Analytics Research Centre
job_description: Roles & Responsibilities COMPANY DESCRIPTION  Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.  RESPONSIBILITIES  The Living Analytics Research Centre (LARC) is a research centre set up in Singapore Management University (SMU) and Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) as our strategic partner that focuses on analytics in the fields of Urban and Community Liveability, Personalised Urban Mobility, Jobs and Skills Intelligence, as well as Smart Consumption and Healthy Lifestyle. Candidates who join us can also expect to gain a deeper knowledge in the following areas such as Big Data Analytics, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Human Computer Interaction, Urban Computing and other relevant disciplines. The Research Fellow will work with faculty researchers on one or more of the following research topics in the urban/social computing, smart cities and consumer business domains.  Data and Text Mining Machine Learning Deep Learning Crowdsourcing Recommender Systems Social-Urban Sensing Big Data Infrastructure   The candidate will also be required to:  Design research methodologies Develop algorithms and models Design and conduct experiments Implement applications, tools and systems Develop analytics capabilities in big data infrastructure Conduct data science studies
requirements: Requirements PhD in Computer Science and related disciplines Good knowledge in relevant research topics and related research skills Proficient in at least one or more of these programming languages: Java, Python, C#, C++ and C Strong interest in human computer interaction and visualization is an added advantage Self-motivated and able to carry out tasks independently Excellent team player and possess strong inter-personal skills Analytical and meticulous with attention to details

The candidate will work with cross functional team members to research, design, implement and validate cutting-edge CV/VA algorithms to create world class solutions/technologies.  Research and develop new Video Analytics capabilities Participate in Proof-Of-Concept/trial projects with customers Participate in exhibitions/conferences as exhibitors/presenters Create new inventions and find opportunities to file patents for CV/VA technologies, and eventually realize them into real workable solutions Any other ad-hoc duties as required or assigned
requirements: Requirements At least a Master in Computer Science/Engineering, or equivalent, preferably with focus in Computer Vision and Machine Learning At least 3-5 years of research experience in Computer Vision and Video Analytics related fields and applying them in industrial applications Excellent knowledge in Image/Video Processing and Pattern Recognition techniques and algorithms Good knowledge in OpenCV and have experience in developing VA-based applications with it Experience in Deep Learning frameworks such as Caffe, Tensor flow and/or PyTorch is a must. Experience with application development that takes advantage of multiple CPU cores Experience with GPU programming like OpenCL/ CUDA Proficient in programming languages such as Python, C++ and/or Java Good working knowledge with various types of security/surveillance cameras A self-starter, with good initiative, commitment and drive

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesWHAT - Business / People Goals WOWA: Excellence in Access and Policy Shaping Win for patients today : 1)    Ensure regional pricing business cases across all therapy area, specifically solid Tumours and CNS/IDV  are commercially viable and makes sense from an overall access and pricing perspective.   Providing early consultation to OpCo to guide local pricing strategy  Considerations for mid-long term product & portfolio strategy Aim to optimizing Business upsides/Mitigate downside business impact for pricing proposals that are being reviewed by the region Assessing reference pricing risks – flag out potential impact of IRP, especially within AP to ensure any downside risks are properly considered during business planning cycles Facilitate timely regional and global pricing approval to ensure timely commercial launch or meeting reimbursement timelines Overall success to be measured through the improvement in quality of business cases and achieving access for products at optimal price points     2)    Facilitate data-driven decision making in the region through improvement in overall price management, documentation and tracking of approved prices  Create and manage product pricing (List and net) & access trackers for key strategic assets in the region: Imbruvica, Darzalex, Stelara, Tremfya, Zytiga and Apalutamide Creating of pricing activity tracker: Tracking of all pricing business cases, timelines and regional impact on the cases regularly through the pricing activity tracker. Maintain proper documentation of all pricing business cases that have been reviewed by the region / global team in shared folder and myPrice (where applicable) Create an overview of pricing guidance for key products based on EBTP principles  Work with global and AP MA to outline Zytiga generic entry situation, price points and key mitigation tactics Increase overall quality of AP price documentation, by ensure wave 2 countries such as SEA (Thailand, Indonesia, Malaysia and Philippines), China and Hong Kong starts documenting and managing prices in the myPrice.  Ensure wave 1 country users in myPrice (AU, KR, TW, JP) continues to manage and maintain high quality prices in myPrice to facilitates a more coordinate approach in referencing at the enterprise level Key Deliverables: Pricing trackers, maintenance of pricing activity tracker YTD (quarterly report via short email message to key stakeholders), improvement of myPrice KPIs especially in wave 2 countries  Invest for Tomorrow’s patients: 3)    AP pricing input into GPAC to ensure AP pricing considerations have been flagged out and/or aligned before Global pricing policy has been set. This will be addressed via:  Gathering of early pricing input and implications to feed into global considerations before GPAC (e.g. Esketamine, erdafitinib) Facilitate alignment through working sessions with global and local opco to ensure overall access and pricing strategy have been aligned       HOW - Leadership Commitments [Shape and Deliver]  Advocating business cases on behalf of OpCos to global pricing to ensure successful approval and implementation of pricing / access strategy in APAC countries  Continuous monitoring of IRP risk within the region and larger Janssen organization and facilitate early communication to flag out potential re-pricing risk Providing pre-consultation to OpCos, supporting the teams in the business case refinement to ensure that access and pricing strategies address market specific patients/stakeholders needs, provides an upside impact to the business and make sense at an enterprise level (e.g. considerations for price policy, referencing risk) Increase exposure and knowledge on technical skills for market access through training programs (eg MAnGA Bootcamp) Support China team in NRDL preparation as part of short term stretch assignment  [Lead]  Leading and conducting training sessions / workshops for OpCo teams to challenge status quo and generate new ideas or increase business productivity  Advocate the use of myPrice to improve quality of price input and overall price management within APAC. Partner global pricing analytics to conduct and/or facilitate training of myPrice portal  [Connect]  Collaborating with OpCos and global pricing team for price/business case approval, ensuring that key assumptions or considerations either from OpCos or global team are well communicated Support training of new pricing intern / pricing resources if required (e.g. IRP risk assessments, myPrice analysis, support in price certificates etc.)

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesYou will work closely with the data analytics team and internal and external stakeholders to support the development, deployment and maintenance of data protection policies and technical solutions for the governance and safeguarding of privacy and confidentiality of all research databases, as well as the ensuring of institutional integrity under prevailing regulations and institutional policies (including the Human Biomedical Research Act and the Personal Data Protection Act, among others).
