job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAbout Tookitaki Tookitaki is providing machine learning-powered enterprise solutions to address regulatory compliance problems in the financial services sector. Incorporated in November 2014 in Singapore, the company is led by a core team with cumulative 30-years’ experience in finance, AI and big data analytics. Backed by institutional investors such as Jungle Ventures and Spring Seeds (a subsidiary of the Singapore Government), the company’s accolades include:  We are among the selected 21 companies which got accreditation from the government of Singapore for their stringent technology, finance and operations due diligence (www.imda.gov.sg/industry-development/programmes-and-grants/startups/accreditation-at-sgd) We won the first place in the MAS FinTech Awards (Singapore SME) in the regulatory compliance space from the Monetary Authority of Singapore for our approach to make the workflows in AML and Reconciliation scalable and highly auditable (beyond ML based black box approach) (www.mas.gov.sg/News-and-Publications/Media-Releases/2016/Ten-FinTech-companies-recognised-for-innovative-solutions-at-inaugural-FinTech-Awards.aspx) We are voted as one of the top 21 AI start-ups focusing on the financial services space by medici (www.letstalkpayments.com/medici-top-21-ai-companies/) We graduated from Nomura's corporate innovation program in November 2017 where we successfully delivered our product – Reconciliation Management Suite – in a pilot environment (https://inc42.com/buzz/nomura-voyager-fintech-accelerator-voyager-demo-day/)  In regulatory compliance, we focus on anti-money laundering and reconciliation and our products – Alerts Management Suite (AMS) and Reconciliation Management Suite (RMS) – cater to these areas, respectively. The mission or goal is to achieve 40% operational efficiency with significant savings in infrastructure and operational costs. Tookitaki's unique selling proposition (USP) is in our approach where we combine our proprietary modelling technique with our complete auditable framework to make the process dynamic and highly explainable (moving out of the black box approach). Moreover, our flexible on-premise and cloud-packaging capabilities, along with the option of easy integration to exiting core-banking applications (REST API end points), make the solution deployment faster with lesser barrier to entry.   Today, regulatory compliance processes have become more complex and fluidic, increasing the chances for rule-based models to fail. Banks need to move beyond static rule-based systems and adopt a new approach to prevent financial and reputation loss. Tookitaki bridges the gap with its innovative software products – AMS, RMS and PMS.

job_title: Project Manager, Systems Integration (3-year contract), Centre for Teaching Excellence
job_description: Roles & Responsibilities COMPANY DESCRIPTION  Singapore Management University is a place where high-level professionalism blends together with a healthy informality. The 'family-like' atmosphere among the SMU community fosters a culture where employees work, plan, organise and play together – building a strong collegiality and morale within the university.Our commitment to attract and retain talent is ongoing. We offer attractive benefits and welfare, competitive compensation packages, and generous professional development opportunities – all to meet the work-life needs of our staff. No wonder, then, that SMU continues to be given numerous awards and recognition for its human resource excellence.  RESPONSIBILITIES  The EDGE: EdTech Greenhouse, under the ambit of SMU’s Centre for Teaching Excellence, is an exciting educational technology set-up which aims to translate high potential research projects (e.g. Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, learning analytics etc.) into minimum viable products for potential campus-wide distribution, bringing about the synthesis of design and development to enhance student learning outcomes. As part of the dynamic EDGE team, the Project Manager, Systems Integration, is required to identify and explore the complex technical and business issues involved in integrating custom software, hardware solutions, commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) software and business procedures and services. This would require the clear analysis of existing research prototypes and user requirements for translation to deployment to the university. The project manager’s role is to manage projects of increasing scale, complexity, and risk and to make sure that all of the components come together to ensure that the projects are completed on time and within budget. He/she will work closely with faculty researchers, software developers and the SMU’s Integrated Information Technology Services to understand user requirements, define and deliver new features, test new concepts, and assist with IT Systems integration and final implementation. Job Description  Explore product concepts to find and propose promising directions that address both human and business needs. Study existing system architecture and propose strategic decisions based on associated rationales about the overall structure, including the mapping of human interaction with these components. Gather data to analyse and specify the requirements of a system as part of the IT Systems Analysis and Design process. Supervise and support the coding and development process of software prototypes and minimum viable products. Collaborate closely with software developer(s) and researchers. Project management and support multiple projects simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines. Advise front-end engineers on User Interface (UI) implementation best practices.
requirements: Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Engineering. 3 to 5 years of professional experience in project management and application of project management methodologies. Experience in managing cross-functional projects. Ability to write codes to develop proof of concept/minimum viable product systems. Project Management Professional (PMP) is not required, but would be advantageous. Ability to build relationships with and influence other functional areas. Ability to apply Agile and Design Thinking/user-centric methodology to understand user requirements. Experience in the supervision of the coding and development of software prototypes. Knowledge in common database manipulation language, e.g. Structured Query Language (SQL) and applications programming. Experience in machine learning methods and algorithm would be advantageous. Strong interpersonal skills. Highly developed verbal and written communication skills. Experience in managing cross-functional projects. Organization and time management skills. Problem-solving skills with ability to perform root cause analysis. Ability to manage several concurrent projects. Knowledge of the development project lifecycle (e.g., design, development, testing, implementation, etc.) Extensive experience in meeting planning, facilitation, and presentation.  OTHER INFORMATION Candidates who do not possess the stipulated qualifications but have relevant work experience may still apply. Remuneration and appointment terms shall commensurate with qualifications and experience. SMU reserves the right to modify the appointment terms where necessary.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesA Research Fellow position is available in the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering at Nanyang Technological University. Established in 1981, the School of Electrical & Electronic Engineering (EEE) is one of the founding Schools of the Nanyang Technological University. Built on a culture of excellence, the School is renowned for its high academic standards and strong tradition in research. To support teaching and cutting-edge research, EEE is host to 11 research centres and more than 50 laboratories, which are well-equipped with modern facilities and state-of-the-art equipment. With about 200 faculty members and an enrolment of more than 4,000, of which about 1,300 are graduate students, it is one of the largest EEE schools in the world. Job Description Traditional classroom teaching in universities is undergoing a paradigm shift. For instance, an emerging paradigm is team-based learning (TBL), where students work together in small groups in the classroom on group application exercises. It is not particularly well-understood yet how to guide students and teachers in TBL settings, and how to create suitable strategies to maximize learning in this setting. Moreover, it remains unclear how assessment can be rigorously conducted for TBL sessions and other alternative learning paradigms. Our long-term objective, over the next 4 to 5 years, is to design technological platforms that are capable of collecting and analysing real-life data in learning environments, and are able to generate objective assessments, in an automated fashion. The overall aim of this project is to make significant progress in the direction of this long-term objective. More concretely, we will adopt state-of-the-art speech and video processing technologies to 21st century learning and education settings, and conduct trials with such technologies in real-life teaching environments. Specifically, as a first step, we aim to develop speech processing algorithms that can detect speakers, language, gender, and social behaviour from audio recordings. Second, we will design video processing algorithms that can detect people, movement, gestures, and facial expressions. Third, we plan to combine these audio and video processing algorithms in order to characterize human behaviour during social and learning activities, and to apply these technologies in three test cases. At last, we will investigate correlations between the behaviours extracted automatically by the technological platforms and manually annotated behavioural scores. The latter are determined by independent trained observers, e.g., according to the Classroom Assessment Scoring System (CLASS) or following the 5C model. In this way, we can validate the audio-video analytics platforms, and potentially predict CLASS (and other) scores automatically from audio or video recordings. The Research Fellow will assist in developing the software platform for this project.
requirements: Requirements PhD in Electrical Engineering 3-4 years of experience with machine leaning is a must Experience in data science and clinical data collection and research Excellent writing and presentation skills Analytical and critical thinking, creative, problem-solver Programming skills in Matlab, Python  We regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

As a business process subject matter expert, you will work with business counterparts to identify areas where business processes can be improved through IT systems. You will then design and deliver those systems functionalities. As an applications subject matter expert, you will perform day-to-day systems administration for these systems, and support the use of these systems. You will also be responsible for systems maintenance and application operations and managing and regular reporting on the systems and resources in your area. You will need to work with many stakeholders and partners including our 3rd party technology partners, and end users.   Your Role:  Business process analysis and design (IT business analysis)  To develop actionable insights in business processes, and business data used for decision making and controls in the areas of Sales, Sales operations, Point of Sales, Customer Relationship Management, architectures To design application enhancements (or applications functionality)   Build and Quality    To build scripts and code fragments to implement enhancements To manage the delivery of software Recovery: To design applications, that in conjunction with infrastructure architecture, comply with disaster recovery architecture and strategy, to allow RPO and RTOs to be achieved.       Application job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesTÜV SÜD is an international service corporation and a world leader in consulting, testing, certification, and training. Headquartered in Munich, Germany, TÜV SÜD, employs more than 24,000 professionals across 850 offices in more than 50 countries around the globe. In line with Singapore’s Smart Nation initiative, TÜV SÜD setup a global Center of Excellence (CoE) Digital Service in Singapore to drive the development of new services and businesses in our customers’ sectors and future markets. For our strategic development of “Continuous Certification” we are currently looking for a highly skilled senior software architect to lead implementation efforts of new tools and machine learning algorithms in the domains of ‘Smart City’, ‘Smart Equipment’, and ‘Industrie 4.0’. We offer the unique opportunity to work with world leaders at the forefront of smart digital systems, shaping the way people use rely on technology. The team of the CoE embodies the spirit of a dynamic ‘start-up’ environment, but backed with reliability and strength of an MNC.   Position Summary The Centre of Excellence Singapore is a key driver of TÜV SÜDs international digital initiative. The successful candidate will take a leading role in the development of novel tools and services under the strategic thrust of smart inspection and the domain of visual analytics. Visual inspection takes a key role in typical inspection workflows. Automation of visual inspection holds the promise to increase productivity, reduce risk, and enable novel inspection services. For example, drone-based inspection of large equipment and civil infrastructure can already automate data collection and reduce the risk for inspectors to work at height. With advanced visual analytics algorithms, defects can increasingly be identified and quantified automatically. The successful candidate will lead development projects of visual inspection technology and develop business plans to bring the technology to market.    Key Responsibilities Development of visual analytics algorithms for automatic façade inspection Toolchain integration including done base data collection, and machine learning backends Design workflow and dashboards for visual inspection services Automatically generate inspection reports Lead development teams with interdisciplinary backgrounds Liaise with TÜV SÜD domain experts and external stakeholders Project representative for TÜV SÜD for business development
requirements: Requirements§  Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or comparable with a focus on software design and implementation §  More than 5 years of relevant work experience in industry or academia developing machine learning algorithms and working with image data §  Strong project management experience §  Background in deep learning and large scale parallel processing §  Background in production ready software system development §  Team player with ability to work in international and multi-cultural teams §  Strong communications skills, fluent in English (oral and written) §  Ability to represent the company and discuss with external stakeholders §  Highly motivated to perform applied research and bring solutions to the market

This includes sourcing processing and validating data using standard database tools and techniques; developing methodologies and working closely with clients  Continuously work to improve on internal research tools, processes and production environments Support and build strong relationships with clients by attending client meetings and responding to queries regarding, market, content, analytics, reports and quantitative models. Develop and improve Commodities quantitative analytic models Design and develop new methodologies Maintain existing content analytics Work with sales, product and business development managers to enhance the market value of current analytics offerings by researching and directing efforts to develop and implement value-added services. Data handling, data processing and programming Work effectively across internal departments, including Sales, Product Management, IT and the Business.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesBoeing is the world's largest aerospace company and leading manufacturer of commercial airplanes and defense, space and security systems. We are engineers and technicians. Skilled scientists and thinkers. Bold innovators and dreamers. Join us, and you can build something better for yourself, for our customers and for the world.   Summary As Researcher in the Boeing Global Services, Digital Solutions & Analytics Research and Rapid Development Group you help us radically change the airline industry through innovative leadership. You participate in aviation research in order to provide technical and new business ideas. Research focus is on delivering navigation, crew, fleet, maintenance and flight optimization solutions. This spans research in the fields of classic commercial aviation and new form of transportation like autonomous air vehicles and such. Works in a fast pace self-directed global team environment and performs a variety of duties, such as technology and data driven research, technology, market and business needs analysis, workflow and information analysis, system specification, innovative/creative systems design, and concept evaluations with user centered design approach. Investigates emerging technology & aviation market trends. Assists with coordination of internal and external customer consultations, demonstrations, and presentations. Assists with generation of high level estimates for R&D proposals. Collaborates with peers; coaches university students.   Main Responsibilities and Tasks    Serves as technical solutions researcher providing domain experience to peers and management; assists team members and directs future concepts     Workflow and information analysis in a self-directed global team, including market focused approach and analysis, system specifications, innovative/creative systems design and concept evaluations with customers, applying known techniques in creative ways.     Supports labor estimates for iteration planning and future project planning. Identifies and enlists internal and external partners to be used in departmental research efforts.     Researches aviation technologies and initial markets to create future concept solutions     Follows best practices from agile processes, works in an iterative and innovative project framework and supports minimal documentation during concept development as appropriate to research environment. Makes recommendations for improvements to existing processes.     Researches important targets and areas for innovation, including intellectual property submissions, patents, and publications.     Communicates with internal and external stakeholders and customers, including iteration and design reviews, industry presentations, possible participation in industry working groups, R&D proposal reviews, and other support as needed.     May oversee individual thesis and project work with university students, including working with universities to onboard students; establish national and international university relationships.     Attends conferences and reports out on trends and technologies identified.   Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the country where the position is located. Benefits and pay are determined at the local level and are not on Boeing US-based payroll.  Division Digital Aviation & Analytics  Relocation Assistance Available  No. Relocation assistance is not a negotiable benefit.
requirements: Requirements  Qualifications  Your Minimum Qualification:    B.A. / M.A. in Entrepreneurship, Business Psychology, Innovation Management, Economics or MBA  / M.S in Aerospace, Computer Science, Engineering  or a combination of both   Entrepreneurial initiative with a strong ‘hands-on’ mentality, loves getting things done   Motivated by an international and fast-paced work environment with a strong team spirit and motivational character   Excels in building cohesive teams through innovation, design thinking and professional collaboration   Experience in business model frameworks and methodology, e.g. Product Value Proposition Design & Business Canvas Modeling   Experience working with research & product teams and/or designers to drive insights into product solutions   Strong written and verbal communication skills, can express him/herself fluently in English   Ability to push boundaries while maintaining a well-structured way of working in self-directed teams and a collaborative environment amongst business as well as academic partners     The ideal candidate would also have:   Aviation or Airline industry experience   Experience in research and development   Experience in rapid prototyping or agile software development processes    Experience Level  Individual Contributor  Job Type  Standard  Travel  Yes, 10 % of the Time  Contingent Upon Program Award  No  Union  No

industry: Building and Construction, Information Technology, Sciences / Laboratory / R&D
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesAn unprecedented explosion of sensor and spatial data are being generated in the building industry. The Internet-of-Things  (IoT)  and  building  and  energy  management  systems (BMS/EMS) are commonplace in modern commercial buildings, while building information models (BIM) capture geometric and meta data from the design phase.  These temporal and spatial data are highly underutilized.  Through their heterogeneity, buildings defy traditional analytics and diagnostics techniques and human ad-hoc analysis is unavoidable. A research assistant position is available to focus on the analysis of meter data from thousands of buildings. The project is focused on city-scale analytics data processing.
requirements: RequirementsDesired candidates should be familiar with the building and construction industry through previous experience in design, project management or analysis of buildings.   The position will require experience in temporal data analysis tasks such as supervised model development, unsupervised clustering analysis, and interpretation of results.

Joining as a Research Associate (RA), the role is primarily on ship data collection, data analytics and modeling. Also the RA will need to assist in other aspects of the research project, which includes preparing reports and papers if there is a need.
requirements: Requirements Master degree holder with very good academic results in Marine Engineering/ Maritime Studies/ Computer Engineering or equivalent from a reputable university Holistic knowledge of international shipping Sound engineering knowledge or research experience in the field of alternative fuels (for shipping industry) preferred Highly motivated and research oriented Able to work independently and assist junior researchers Fluent verbal and written communications in English Strong publication record and experience in industry R&D projects will definitely be an added advantage

job_description: Roles & Responsibilities Analytics is core to PayPal and we are a highly data-driven organization. The individual will be part of Global Analytics and Insights team, primarily focusing on lifecycle / CRM analytics, leverage cross channel expertise (paid, owned, earned etc.) to ideate, build and implement customer centric data driven solutions (e.g. Next best action). We are looking for someone who has a good blend of technical expertise, cross channel exposure, cross functional exposure and an extrovert who can package analytics product and sell analytics solutions within organization to internal leaders. industry: Customer Service, Logistics / Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Others, Purchasing / Merchandising
job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesPOSITION SUMMARY: The primary purpose of this position is to achieve the company’s objectives and maximise sales and margin by making timely and informed price recommendations through the use of relevant tools and analytics – working between the sales and product teams to achieve the best possible price and a win-win situation for all stakeholders. The Analyst will deliver quotes and contracts within the pricing guidelines and governance for their allocated regions and customers. This position acts as a price escalation point and requires frequent collaboration across sales regions, business units and pricing team colleagues. Must work cross functionally but is also able to make the right decision to ensure timely implementation and turnaround of quotes and contracts within the agreed service levels.   MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES TO BE ACCOMPLISHED:  Review, analyse and implement pricing for quotes and contracts. Prepare contracts through data analysis and working with multiple stakeholders to finalise the contract pricing proposal ready for negotiation and final implementation of contracts into the Model N system. Execute consistent pricing to local and global customers and channel partners and implement stretch pricing targets to drive high performance. Ensure service levels and KPI’s are achieved to target and ensure monthly reporting is communicated across various levels throughout the organisation. Ensure compliance with pricing guidelines and governance covering quotes and contracts. Pro-actively identify and recommend improvements to existing pricing processes, policies, system enhancements and other areas to increase efficiency and effectiveness. Act as the price escalation point in the allocated region for the sales, GSAM and product functions. Gather competitive data, track and understand the competitive pricing environment.    KEY CHALLENGES:  Working across a complicated, cross functional global organisation with multiple stakeholders. Data and systems. Achieving the highest price the customer is willing to pay whilst balancing the different expectations from multiple stakeholders. Ensuring service levels are achieved against demanding customer requirements. Understanding the market demand and market price. Linking profitable opportunities to capacity available.
requirements: RequirementsEDUCATION: Diploma / Degree (Business/Finance/Engineering)   EXPERIENCE & KNOWLEDGE REQUIRED:  Expert in Excel. At least 5 years of working experience in the electronics industry, preferably the connector industry. 3 to 5 years of pricing experience. Systems – experience of Model N revenue and pricing management system. Experience of Qlikview and Business Objects required. Degree (Business/ Finance/Engineering)    SKILLS REQUIRED:  Results orientated and able to take ownership and use initiative, meeting deadlines and working in a fast paced environment Detailed-oriented with strong analytical ability. Must demonstrate effective negotiation skills. Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and working with minimal supervision. Proven track record of working in regional or global pricing teams. Must demonstrate collaboration skills, team working and influencing skills.    PERSONALITY TRAITS:  Results orientated and able to take ownership and use initiative; meets deadlines and can work in a fast paced environment Good interpersonal, communication and analytical skills. Ability to work under pressure and adaptable to change. Eager, diligent and can work independently.

job_description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities –    Drive and develop a strategic and innovative approach to the capital markets and analytical components of client engagements. The individual will have a wide range of responsibilities across the life of FMA’s processes and client assignments including, but not limited to:   Providing capital markets content, including asset class expertise and trade execution capabilities, across engagements, leveraging direct and Firm resources (e.g., provide liquidation cost analysis related to a portfolio of complex, structured securities in support of a Client’s strategic divestment initiative, valuing and managing the wind-down of a Client’s non-core portfolio of structured assets) Driving the design and execution of analytical processes within engagements, working in concert with practice area professionals, engagement managers and other engagement team members (e.g., work on a project team responsible for developing a suite of stress testing models for a large European bank, covering the end-to-end process from onboarding millions of records of historical loan portfolio data to building comprehensive balance sheet models for review with bank and regulatory stakeholders, ultimately impacting capital decisions)  Serving as the central point of coordination with the BRS Financial Modeling Group (“FMG”) and the Portfolio Analytics Group (“PAG”) with respect to project design, execution, and delivery, as well as strategic deployment and coordination of resources (e.g., develop a deep understanding of analytics, modeling, and technology at BlackRock while building a broad network across the firm) Providing oversight on the quality of all analytical deliverables across the department, through the development and execution of a consistent quality assurance process
requirements: RequirementsSkills/ Experience required –     Professional experience in the consulting or advisory industry with expertise in global capital markets and a track record of outstanding business achievements in complex financial and other services Demonstrated ability to lead and direct a diverse, cross-functional team in a consultative fashion Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to synthesize complex ideas into clear messages and the acumen to lead discussions with client project team and selectively client senior management Professional experience in the consulting or advisory industry with a track record of outstanding business achievements in complex financial and other services Ability to promote sustainable and scalable workflow structures by leveraging systematic and thoughtful processes

job_title: Quantity Risk Analyst – LNG trading multinational
job_description: Roles & Responsibilities• High growth  • Energy trading experience  • VBA, Python, SQL  This is a fast expanding LNG trading multinational company with a significant presence in Singapore and Asia Pacific. Due to expansion reasons, there is an opportunity for a high calibre Quantity Risk analyst to join the Risk Management team.   Reporting to the Global Head of Risk, the Quantity Risk Analyst will play an integral role in establishing the market risk capabilities and governance framework. Working closely with senior stakeholders in market execution and trading, he/ she will also provide risk analytics support on trading strategies and new business initiative. The analyst will also be refining and enhancing valuation/ market risk methodologies including the implementation of VaR or CFaR (Cash flow at risk) and stress testing. This is a highly visible role requiring cross functional interaction with senior stakeholders.
requirements: RequirementsThe successful candidate will possess a degree in Mathematical / Quantitative Finance / Business discipline with at least 3 years of market risk management experience in an energy trading environment. You will possess good analytical and organisation skills, is solution oriented and is meticulous. Proficiency in VBA, Python, SQL or Matlab will be highly desirable.   To apply, please submit your resume to Alsa Chia at AL@kerryconsulting.com, quoting the job title and reference number AL15510. We regret that only successfully shortlisted applicants will be contacted.   Registration no: R1765623    Type of Work: Permanent Region: Singapore Licence No: 16S8060
